the lodge rooms are stunning if you go as a couple .

as friends , you may want to rethink this one as they have open showers which are terribly inconvenient ! Their rangers are good but I have seen far better in other lodges in South Africa but they are eager and enthusiastic .
I suggest you ask for a senior ranger - they seemed much more knowledgeable .
The sightings were good pretty much on every drive .
Their food was actually much better than i would have hoped for so that is a huge plus .
The Internet is very poor so do not expect to stay connected !
! A word of obvious travel advise while travelling to South Africa , that I slipped up on .
Do not keep any valuables in your check in luggage ! !
Perfect location for a good Safari and recreation .
We have stayed in Phinda Mountain lodge for 3 nights .
The Safari daily trips were to our expectations .
The staff are very friendly , though the gift of explaining the nature and habits of the wildlife , varies from one Ranger to another .
The food was outstanding and it looked liked the Chef really enjoys his job and moreover - enjoys his guests enjoying his food .
Go for it whether you are a couple or family .
Fantastic , but noisy with children .
We stayed at the Phinda Mountain Lodge and the facilities and the view were magnificent .
Staff was very friendly and helpful , took concerns and feedback seriously and resolved problems as quickly and efficiently as possible .
The room was very well sized , nicely furnished and clean , with large panorama windows ( even the bathtub had a view ! )
and a small plunge pool at the private sun deck .
The common areas were large enough to give space for the many guests and provided the comfort and luxury associated with & Beyond .
The food was very good and the kitchen happy to cater for special dietary requirements .

Breakfast and lunch were served at a restaurant with a wonderful view over the valley , while dinner ( weather permitting ) was in an enclosed space outside under trees and with a large outdoor kitchen for brais .
Wine selection was good , although maybe somewhat pricy .
The excursions were nice too and our guide accommodated all the special requests .
All in all a true & Beyond experience - if it hadn ’ t been for the children .
Don ’ t stay at this lodge if you don ’ t have any of your own .
Believe all you read on Tripadvisor - the lack of discipline during meal times and the very high noise level in general really spoiled the experience for us .

Maybe if the lodge had fewer rooms and hence fewer families staying at the same time it wouldn ’ t have mattered , but the large number of small children made us feel like in the middle of a kindergarten .
Of course it is not in the power of the & Beyond staff to deal with the children of their guest , but there is a systematic flaw in the set-up of this lodge .

Maybe there could be various spaces for eating to break up the large group of guests , maybe they could offer meals in the room and there should really be more rooms for guests without children away from the noisy pool area as well as the family rooms .
With the set-up as when we stayed there , we would not advise anybody without small children to stay at the Phinda Mountain Lodge .
Fantastic !
Safari with family .
A beautiful experience , amazing views and animals , .
Top service at the lodge , very exclusive !
All food and drinks were inclusive , which gives a nice touch of luxury .
Superb ranger who put in the little extra effort to make the experiece extraorinary .
The food was good and dinner settings were different every night .
The lodges were spacious , well equipped and beautifully decorated .
The game reserve is very well maintained , plenty of animals but not too grouded , only occasionally you see another jeep .
Everything good you hear is true .
2 nites Mountain Lodge .
one at Forest lodge -- -- great experience -- -ask for Sam at forest lodge for great experience .
Liked Mountain Lodge accommodation more .
saw all the animals .
wonderful time .
wonderful people .
Exceeded high expectations .
We were at the last minute convinced to spend a large part of our travel budget on a good ( no , EXCELLENT ) safari .
`` There is no point in spending less money on a bad safari '' .

With that in mind , we were recommended Phinda Mountain Lodge ( this particular lodge is recommended for families with kids ) The experience starts already at the gates , where you receive a personalized letter that you can read while making your way through the reserve in your way to the lodge .
The staff was extremely helpful , with special focus on making the kids ( 4 & 6 ) feel comfortable and happy .
Thuba , an amazing child minder , took care of the kids while the adults were on long game drives ( small kids not allowed to come along ) .
Our kids do not speak English but that was not a problem for them or Thuba .
Phinda Mountain Lodge has a well equipped kids play room with good activities .
The rangers are friendly and dedicated - and want to help you find the animals on your `` list '' .
We were very happy with our ranger , Ross .
We saw the Big 5 in just 2 game drives .
The only drawback was that after 3 game drives you quickly recognized the terrain and locations .
The reserve is big , but you still generally drive in the same areas .
Magical .
This lodge is very exclusive - and it is well worth it .
Suites are freestanding , each with their own verandah and plunge pool overlooking the African bush .

The view from the large bath , shower and even toilet are even fantastic ! The food was excellent and the service fantastic - lovely warm , African hospitality - while still ensuring you have a good level of privacy .
Game drives take place first thing in the morning , and in the late afternoon .
Each open-toped safari vehicle has it is own experienced game ranger and tracker - you literally track down the animals you want to see !
These drives are broken by either a tea / coffee break in the morning or sundowners in the evening - right out in the middle of the Africa bush .
This exclusivity does not come cheap - but it is really worth it !
Luxury in the bush .
We just returned from three nights at Phinda Mountain Lodge , where we had a wonderful experience .
I think the first and most important thing that makes this lodge special is the staff .

From the time Eleonor gave us our very personal welcome through all of Jes delicious meals , on all of our game drives with Ross ( our ranger ) and Saphiwe ( our tracker ) , and during every encounter we had with every member of the staff , we were incredibly impressed with the service , dedication , and enthusiasm of the staff .
They made us feel like one of the family , and any request we made was treated as no problem .
Any negatives in the description below are things we did not bring to the attention of the staff or they would have been addressed immediately .
These thoughts are only to alert future visitors that if you have any of the same issues , you should speak up , and they will respond .
Safari drives : Understand that Phinda is a relatively small private reserve , so the rangers have a somewhat precise idea of the exact number and probable location of many of the animals .
What this means for the visitor is that you have a significant chance of seeing at least the big 5 , and we saw all of them and more .

It also means , however , that the safari experience is a little less `` wild '' than what we found in Kruger , which we understand is even less `` wild '' than the safari experience in other African countries .
That said , we very much enjoyed our game drives and can not imagine how they could have been better at Phinda .
Having a great ranger and tracker , who are knowledgeable and work well together , makes all the difference , and we could not have been happier with Ross and Saphiwe .
Our ranger and tracker did an amazing job of finding the animals and giving us the time and information to really observe their natural behaviors .
We had so many special , up close and personal viewings of different animals that we could neither describe them all nor choose a favorite .
Ross and Saphiwe are incredibly knowledgeable and enthusiastic , so we learned a great deal from them and enjoyed every minute we spent with them on the drives .
The morning mocha-chaca-rules and evening sundowner beers on the game drives are a great touch that we did not find at our other safari lodge and made every day more relaxing and fun .
Lodge : The lodge and rooms are beautiful and very comfortable .
Even the animals seem to appreciate the peacefulness of this lodge , as we saw many nyala and warthogs wandering the grounds and calmly grazing .
Our room was fantastic , with a comfortable bed , large bright bathroom with indoor and outdoor showers , a deck and plunge pool , and excellent and fully included mini-bar .
The location is amazing with beautiful views and frequent breezes .
Food and staff : As stated above , the staff is outstanding at every level and could not have made us feel more comfortable .
The food was also excellent at every meal .
They even accommodated our dietary restrictions as if it was no inconvenience .
Our only issue on this front was that we ate outside , over grass or sand and under trees every night , so there were always a lot of bugs crawling on the table , in the butter , etc .
We realize that we were in Africa in the bush and that the staff went to a great deal of trouble to give us not only a beautiful but an authentic dining experience .
That said , it was a bit difficult to enjoy the delicious food sitting in the dark with beetles and other bugs on the table .

Because we kept thinking that the next night dinner would be in a less rustic setting , we did not mention this concern in time for them to make special arrangements for us , which they no doubt would have done .
We also realize that we might be more uncomfortable eating under these circumstances than others and mention it only so that future visitors will know to speak up if they are uncomfortable .
Overall , we had a wonderful experience and will look for & Beyond lodges for future visits to Africa .
Thank you to everyone who gave us such a special experience !
We would recommend Phinda Mountain Lodge to anyone .
Incredible Safari Experience .
From start to finish our entire experience at MountainLodge was incredible .
The service , food , accommodation and game viewing were outstanding .
The entire staff made our safari experience unforgettable and we will definitely be returning , they exceeded our expectations in every way .
As mentioned in other reviews , this is the most family friendly and largest lodge in Phinda but they went out of there way to make our experience as tailored and private as possible .
Couples beware this is a family oriented camp .
We transferred from Forest to Mountain Lodge ( 2 nights each ) - Phinda has 5 lodges on the reserve .
We were told to check out of Forest at 12p and drive ( we had a car ) to Mountain lodge .
Upon arrival , we had to wait a few hours for our room .

I really think for such an expensive and premium quality lodge , that the 2 camps could have spoken prior and allowed us to relax more at forest before being stranded in the lobby waiting for a room in Mountain .
Especially on our honeymoon , this was quite inconvenient and ruined our moods coming from a high at Forest lodge .
Upon seeing the room , the style was different , a little less high end than Forest but charming in the rustic nature of the decor .
The outdoor shower , plunge pool and spectacular view were much appreciated .
Sadly our special treats that we requested and honored at Forest lodge were missed here .
I think we were in room 17 , which was very private .
The meals were all buffet style which we do not prefer and the food quality was no where as high as we expected , completely average to be honest .
We were a bit surprised with so many families and kids around but we stuck to our room between drives which was more romantic ( we did not visit the pool ) .
The guides were good with the kids so I would definitely recommend for families .
Thankfully our game drives were with adults only and we did see very good game including a herd of about 20 elephants and babies which was fantastic .
Overall the special touches at this lodge were lacking .
For the same price as Forest Lodge per night , we were quite disappointed with our stay at Mountain lodge .
The game drives are memorable .
We only stayed one night at Phinda ( pronounced Pinda ) Mountain Lodge , so I can not give a full report about it .
We arrived , after driving from Phinda Forest Lodge , in time to settle into our room before going out for the afternoon game drive .
The room was very big , and the bathroom was huge , also .
There is a deck with 2 lounge chairs , and a very deep plunge pool .
It was so deep , we could not touch bottom , so we always sat on the steps when we went in .
Our room was close to the main lodge ( as we had requested ) , and seemed to always have nyalas and warthogs around during daylight hours .
The room was very private , as no other rooms could be seen .
After a bit of lunch , we went on our game drive with the very knowledgeable drive Daryn , and the tracker Sifoso .
Since the resort was not crowded ( we never even saw any children ) , we were the only guests in our vehicle .
We immediately saw a leopard , and then went on to see many other animals .
Much time was spent trying to find some lions near the airstrip , but we were ultimately unsuccessful .
Having seen many lions before , this was not a bitter disappointment for us , and the process of trying to track them down was fascinating to observe .
They even got out of the Land Rover and went in on foot , with a gun , a machete , and a stick for protection , to try and find them .
Later , we tried to catch up with some fast moving elephants , but it was getting dark , and we did not see them before we moved on to observe a hyena and her 2 cubs at their den .
Following this , we had dinner in the bush , with many lanterns to light the area , including the toilet .
The next day we were up at 5 for our morning game drive at 5:30 .
( Game drives start early in the African summer ) .
This drive was more successful , as we found elephants ( or more correctly , he found us ) , a black rhino , and in view at the same time , white rhino .
We even discovered an African Rock Python .
As always , Daryn was incredibly knowledgeable about what we were seeing and hearing .
We would go back to Mountain Lodge again , if we get a chance .
Exceptional !
Just .
WOW !
You honestly can not fault Phinda Mountain Lodge .
The Lodge is just as breathtaking as the wildlife .
From the second the staff pick you up from the airport , to the minute they farewell you , the staff at Phinda were simply gracious , friendly and so helpful - just beautiful !
The breathtaking scenery and decor of Mountain Lodge is second to none , and the food is outstanding .
I enjoyed every single second of my stay here and often dream about returning .
My favourite holiday yet ! ! !
Book with confidence .
you will not regret it !
Unforgettable experience .
I have just returned home from a 3 night stay at mountain lodge having seen the most amazing range of wildlife , our rangers Ian and Bhetal were simply outstanding !
If you are looking for a 1st class game drive experience you could not do better than visit Phinda , it is no surprise that the `` Gety '' family have a lodge on the reserve .
Fantastically Friendly Staff and Lovely Accommodations .
The Mountain Lodge staff was fantastic from the moment we arrived .
Our room featured our own plunge pool , and the Vervet monkeys and baboons occasionally made a showing ( safely ) .
This lodge had wonderful views given its location .
Early on one morning drive , we saw a Cheetah and her two cubs chasing a warthog .
The day prior , we had seen the trio finishing off another meal .
( BTW , the wart hog did not succumb .
) For a special occasion , we were treated to dinner on our patio one evening .
We got a lovely deal of stay 3 nights and get a 4th free .
Even though this is a pricey place , it was well worth it .
Everyone was eager to ensure guests had a terrific time .
The typical schedule was wake up by 5:30 , have a bit of coffee or tea , on board the Land Rover by 6:15 for the first game drive , which lasts about 3 hours .
At its conclusion , the vehicle pulls into a nice spot , and there is more coffee or chocolate ( with liqueur if you like it ) and then back to lodge for full breakfast .
Lunch about 1 pm ( which we learned to skip given the amount of food ) , and then 3 pm high tea , and shortly thereafter back on Rover for evening game drive .
Cocktail stop at dark with the Rover and back for dinner .
What a full and exciting day each and every day .
In room massages are possible .
Good family lodge .
We stayed 3 nights at the lodge and had a good experience .
The lodge is quite large which does not give you the feel that I like about the bush of being one with the wilderness , but it is ideal for groups or families as they are very well geared for kids .
On the plus side , the rooms are amazing , large and luxurious , with really nice views ( except for the larger units at the back or next to the main pool ) .
The staff is great and attentive but felt a bit reserved compared to other lodges we stayed at .
The ranger and tracker were good and knowledgeable , we did not have the greatest of luck with the sightings , probably because of a wet weather .
On the minus side , the vehicles are older than I expected from a luxury lodge , same for the blankets and ponchos that we were given .

All in all we had a great time , but for couples or special stays I would recommend Forest or Rock Lodge which are smaller and offer a different experience ( we stayed at Forest years ago but I still remember it as one of the best lodges we stayed at ) .
Short but very sweet .
We were there at the mountain lodge with a large group of cruise passengers for a all too brief one day .
Oh and it rained the entire time we were there .
Yet , they did it , they made me fall in love with Africa .
The animals were breathtaking , the food outstanding and the staff extraordinary .
The lodge and cottages were first rate even though we did not get a chance to have the whole experience .
Above all was our ranger Edward and his tracker .
We had an elderly woman , wheelchair bound , and Edward lifted her in and out of the vehicle , made sure her poncho was on her and wrapped her up in blankets .
He even went so far as to help her take pictures of the extraordinary things we were viewing .
Way above and beyond !
I am saving up for my return , hopefully , next year .
Thank you Phinda for the best of your world .
What a great experience .
Me and my girlfriend stayed with local friends over the weekend at Phinda Mountain Lodge .
Service and food is great , staff is very friendly and helpful .

We had great rangers who gave us a beautiful view on cheetah and hyena cubs !
Very pleasant and luxury trip that makes your stay even more comfortable ! do not forget to close your windows in your villa otherwise the baboons steal your fudge from the desk : )

Superb .
Fabulous .

Awesome Adventure .
The arrival by small plane from Johannesburg to Phinda Airport was greeted by traditional dancers and then taken by Land Cruiser to the Mountain Lodge with hippos and elephants en route .
The staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful , making sure we were all relaxed and happy .
The food was superb and the accommodation excellent .

The high light was the game drives with Matt and John our Ranger and Tracker whose knowledge and bush skills ensure we saw the Big Five plus many other species including an Aardvark ! A very `` special '' place and highly recommended !
More than i could have ever asked for .
I took a 3 day break in Phinda and stayed at Mountain Lodge and Forest Lodge .
Mountain Lodge was just superb - The staff were amazing helpful and friendly .
The game drives were great - I managed to see all Big 5 within my72 hour stay ! !
The rooms were incredible - Great finishings , beautifully constructed , refreshing plunge pool , all bathrooms and facilities were top spec .
Food was great also - Again , all staff were just very attentive and friendly , which added to the whole experience .
I got the impression that & Beyond literally go that extra step to ensure that EVERY guest has a amazing time .
Thank you to all that made my stay unforgettable .
Peak experience .
We had never been on a safari holiday before and because it is expensive we did a lot of research .
We ended up choosing Phinda and we are extremely pleased we did so as it would be hard to imagine having a better all-round experience .
First of all the welcome was very friendly and professional with our greeter ready and waiting for us at the car drop-off point having been alerted by the main gate .
A small thing maybe , but how few hotels get these basics right .
Secondly our cabin was lovely and luxurious .
Some may prefer one with more open views but we were more than happy with the seclusion afforded by the trees - we even used the inside/outside shower !
Thirdly the dining area had a lovely view across the vlei with animals roaming both near and far , plus delicious food .
Fourthly , ( and we had not appreciated how important this would be ) we had an excellent ranger , Devon Myers and tracker Nkisa , plus congenial company in the vehicle .

We did not go with a big five shopping list and liked the informal style of the drives without vehicles scruming around a sighting , but nonetheless we saw many different varieties of animals , birds , insects , trees and plants .
Devon was very knowledgeable about all of these and we were especially impressed by his imitations of bird calls !

Some may have a preference for a completely open space across which wildlife can roam , and one can respect that purist stance , but Phinda is a pretty good compromise with the perimeter roads and fences being relatively unobtrusive and containing vast acreages .
Interesting to learn that Tara and Jesica Gety are major supporters of Phinda and maybe that accounts in part for the exceptional quality encountered everywhere .

AMAZING 2nd time around ! !
The mountain lodge is amazing you have plenty of animals on the game drive and the people are simply fantastic .
the house is beautiful , the food is great .
this was our 2nd time at the same lodge and we can not complain , i feel it was better then the 1st time around if that is even possible .
the reserve is fantastic and the ranger knows his stuff , you can ask any question they have the answer .
the reserve itself was simply beautiful very luxurious and the food was great , the staff treats you with such great care you feel like you live there .
we saw lions climb trees and even heard a leopard hunt right next to our lodge at 4am you can not beat that .
the mountain lodge is one of the greatest places to stay ! oh and do try the cold coffee served in the afternoon simply tasty ,
safari .
Just an amazing overall experience .
The service can not be beat , and we saw every type of animal you could imagine , almost close enough to touch .
The attention to detail , the food , and the level of commitment to ensuring you enjoy your experience can not be matched .
Awesome experience .
Amazing safari experience especially with children .
Many have reviewed and said this place is great and i could not agree more .
What made it special for us - A great holiday requires really good food options , cant go hungry on a holiday .
We are vegetarians and there were enough options on the menu and the flexibility of the staff in tailoring the food was outstanding .
We had our six year old son with us , because of the timezone difference he would sleep early by 6pm ( 9 .
30pm india time ) right on the safari drive itself .
So we had to ensure that he was fed well before that and he need to be taken care of when we were eating dinner .
The staff packed snacks , sandwiches , fruits for him and would let him sleep in the lounge couch and watch over him when we ate our food .
Except for in the boma one night , we were able to handle it very well .
The sightings - the tracker Sibu and Ranger Divan were excellent and went the extra mile to make the drives enjoyable , informative and exciting .
We were lucky that most of the time we were the only family on the drives and practically it was a personalized experience .
The potty stops and snack breaks in the forest during the game drives are very thoughtful and ensure that we enjoyed every minute thoroughly .
Overall from planning the trip , booking through the AndBeyond agent - Carla , to the actual trip , it was an excellent experience .
We stayed 3 nights at mountain lodge and stayed at forest for 2 more days .
This was supposed to be a once in a lifetime experience .
Now i know it is not - that we will go back there again .
A wonderful Lodge & Game Drive .
A lovely luxury place to stay near Durban .
Staff , food , driver ranger excellent .
Our chalet was wonderful with a nice view and very quiet .
The terrace has a fantastic view .
We saw the Big 5 several times .
The Game drives were amazing .
This is my favourite place in South Africa !
Incredible accommodation , incredible staff , incredible rooms , incredible food and wine , some of the best game viewing I have ever experienced and I have been to lots of reserves .
I highly recommend this property and reserve
Unforgatable experience .
More than you expect .
Difficult to describe in words .
it is all what it should be .
Luxury rooms without being posh , Fantastical view of the savanah , great food and 100 % service staff .
It is more than you expect .
We had excellent game drives and boat drives , we saw all animals we dreamt of .
A must-go .
As good as any in Southern Africa .
We were really surprised to find an excellent game park in KZN .
It is perfectly organised , personal and the game is great .
We saw the Big 5 and Cheetah on the first drive !
It still has the luxury without you feeling like you need to dress up for dinner .
Staff make a huge effort with little surprises that make each day special .
They also catered for 2 teenage kids very well .
We will be back .
The most kind staff of all luxury hotels .
Besides the fact that this place is unbelievable with regards to the acomodation , views , wildlife , bush dinners , pool and more it is the staff that made this trip so unique .
Every single person there was very very friendly , very helpful , and everything felt like it was real .
Not because they have to be friendly becasue its their job .
It was sincere and very pleasant .
I would go back to an andBeyond accommodation in a second ! ! ! !
Our ranger Luke and tracker Bathuel were excellent ! ! !
Wonderful Bush Experience .
Together with another couple my wife and I visited Phinda Mountain Lodge in the Phinda Private Reserve in KZN for 3 nights in mid-Aug .
The booking process went smoothly however we had to move rooms after the first night which the staff made easy and painless .
The room itself was fantastic ( # 23 is worth requesting - larger deck and great view from the plunge pool ) .
The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly whilst our ranger was exceptional , especially as we requested him to find specific birds only found in this area .
They arranged 3 different suppers with the last one being a surprise in the bush and they really went to a lot of trouble for all the guests .
Generally the food was good but has room for improvement .
We also went on the boat cruise which , whilst short , is worthwhile and at no extra cost .
This lodge is part of the & Beyond Group who we really recommend for busg experiences as the cost is all inclusive of EVERYTHING .
Look out for their Specials which are a 50 % at short notice .
Next time we will try another one of their lodges in the same Park ( I think there are 6 ) .
If you like comfort in the bush this is worthwhile .
2nd year in a row .
This is my 2nd year in a row to Phinda Mtn Lodge ( 2012-13 ) and I have to admit it always first like the first time .
It is so good and the experience is worth so much , I would work here for free .
I recommend Phinda 120 % to anyone .
Its an experience you will never forget .
Food is outstanding , accommodations are great and the staff is superb .
Go for it .
The Perfect Safari !
If you are looking for an amazing safari experience ( especially if you have children with you ) then you should book Phinda Moundain Lodge !
We had 4 fantastic days at the Lodge and could have stayed even longer .
We had a wek-long safari stay at Phinda ( Forest Lodge for 3 of the days ) and we could not have asked for better service , accommodations or overall safari experience .
From the minute you are greeted with a drink and cool towel you feel like you are at a home away from home .
The staff do everything they can to make you comfortable and happy .
I have never had an experience at a hotel where literally EVERY staff member is happy , helpful and beyond professional .
The rooms at Mountain Lodge are beautiful and very clean .
You feel like you are on safari as they are designed in a rustic theme and have plenty of outdoor space to enjoy during your breaks from the drives .

We had loads of animals around the rooms to watch and interact with ( do not leave your door unlocked as the monkeys WILL come in and steal your food : ) ) You do need to be walked to your room at night because there are no fences , but that is part of the appeal of being in the wild !
We had adjoining rooms with our kids and each room had a small splash pool on the deck - we did not use them as it was winter , but they would be great in the summer .
The lodge itself was beautiful with a great view of the reserve .
They serve tea and coffee before each drive on the patio and on each drive all 3 of my kids had a bag of snacks and drinks to take with them .
The Lodges `` Wild Child '' program was fantastic with a backpack , journal , crayons , stickers , necklace and many other things included .
It made them feel really special to be able to carry their packs with them and document what they saw !
On each drive we saw more than we ever expected .
Not only the big 5 , but loads of other animals and flora and fauna .
The guide , Matt , could not have been more informative and friendly .
He was fantastic with the kids and told them even tiny details about things we were looking at .
He never got aggravated by questions or requests for a quick potty stop : ) Each drive includes a drink and snack stop that is really nice during the 3+ hour drives .

They will track the animals right into the bush which is why a private game reserve is a fantastic choice ! From food to rooms to drives to service , you would not go wrong booking Phinda Mountain Lodge ! !
Superlative Safari Experience .
Wow , what a safari experience !
From the moment you arrive you are treated like royalty .
From the check-in until the time you depart you are made to feel special .
The accommodation is stunning sadly ours was without a view and which was adjacent to another suite which when occupied is a little less private .
The plunge pool is great to cool off however the only problem is that elderly folk would struggle getting in and out as there is no handle to hang onto .
The game drives , the 4 we did where excellent with a knowledgeable ranger who worked hard to find the wildlife with amazing sightings of black and white rhino literally forging together .
Food is very good and substantial .
If self-driving from Durban and surrounds be wary as the trip is longer than expected with a pretty hectic drive of dodging pedestrians , domestic animals , trucks and the taxis .
do not try driving after noon on Fridays !
Great Family Safari Lodge .
My extended family and I recently completed a four night stay ( maybe invasion is a better description as there were a total of 19 of us ) at Phinda Mountain Lodge .
Our group included 10 children between ages 5 and 16 , which had a few of us parents more than a little nervous as to how they would handle a safari lodge , and vice versa .
Needless to say , our stay was among the best quality and most memorable travel experiences we have ever had .
All the management , staff , rangers and trackers were first rate in every respect and could not have been more accommodating .
I completely agree with prior reviews as to high quality of the rooms , food , staff , thoughtfulness of the service etc .
and would encourage families to bring their kids to Phinda , as ours had a wonderful time .
I would also strongly suggest taking advantage of some of the excursions offered .
We visited Sodwana Bay Beach ( about 75 min drive ) which was spectacular and great for the kids to swim , play beach sports and climb the dunes .
We also visited a local school which is supported in part by a foundation connected with Phindas parent company .
We met with the principal to hear how she struggled to start and grow the school , visited classrooms and got chance to speak with some of the kids .
It was something none of us ( our kids included ) will ever forget .
These trips were a nice alternative to the game drives and gave us a chance to see and connect with the surrounding region .
Great Safari Lodge .
A lovely luxury place to stay in the African bush .
Service and food excellent .
Our chalet was not quite as private as we hoped and there were really no views from the chalet but fantastic views from the terrace and restaurant .
The Game drives were amazing with an informative ranger ; we saw lots of wonderful animals and followed a pair of cheetahs for half an hour to a kill .
A wonderful stay .
This stay was booked directly through & Beyond who were excellent in every respect .

Upon our arrival we were greeted from the car by staff bearing hot towels and drinks which were much appreciated , This is a large lodge and we were fortunate to be put in the palatial room 8 which has the view featured in the brochure , it was , until another & Beyond Loge I visited later the most luxurious room I have ever stayed in .
Mountain Loge is Phindas family Lodge but there were fortunately no children when we were there in early Sept , I would suggest checking term times etc .
As there were very few people staying in a large lodge there were always plenty of staff around to provide drinks etc .
