An amazing lodge .
I went with a group of friends and had 3 nights .
We were superbly looked after , the accommodation , food , surroundings , staff and wildlife could not be faulted .
Well worth all the saving I needed to do to get there !
A wonderful serene experience .
a family tradition where you always feel like you have come home .
Fantastic spot to stay .
Great game drives and extremely friendly staff
I love this place .
it is one of the best in the world .
Awesome place .
great service !
Best Luxury Safari lodge .
Stay there and you are immediately in a different world .
Mountain Lodge , Rock Lodge , Vlei Lodge .
there is seven lodges and camps at Phinda , each one in a different ecosystem , and each one truly special in its own way .
The views at Mountain lodge are spectacular and the suites luxurious in every sense .

But most of all , it is the wildlife experiences here - this is one of the best places to see cheetah in South Africa ; Phindas rhino conservation has been superb ; its rangers are knowledgeable and charming ; and if you have got the money , it is very , very special place to go on safari .
A most special bush experience .
What a special place to spend our 10 year anniversary .
Very personal service from all staff , excellent food , wonderful rooms in a most awesome setting .
Impossible to beat game viewing with friendly experienced guides and trackers .
A perfect 3 nights , thanks to all .
Not as kid friendly as we had hoped .
Stayed 3 nights with my husband and 4 yr old daughter .
On the positive side : Phinda reserve was lovely as usual ; lush grasses , sleek animals and spectacular wildflowers .
Truly one of the best reserves in Africa .
Tracker Tom was possibly the best we have ever had escort us through the bush and Ranger Toby was good company .
A real plus is that we could take our kid out twice when we were the only guests going out on the vehicle - thanks for this !
The lodge is beautifully positioned with wonderful views out over the mountains .
The food was plentiful and of an exceptionally high standard ; the kitchen and restaurant staff also all seemed to be a cut above .
Front of house hostesses ( ?
for want of a better job title ) all seemed to be trying a bit too hard and did not seem to be very experienced - no one thing to pick on but they seemed awkward around us .
We got the feel that Mountain Lodge was a bit of a training ground and none of the managerial girls seemed quite up to usual & Beyond standards .
Room 6 was okay but a bit dark and really had no view of anything .
Also quite a hike on slippery paths especially for our 4 year old .
Given that the occupancy could not have been much more than 10-15 % , it would have been nice if we could have been allocated something that had a bit more going for it .
Our biggest gripe is that this is the only lodge at Phinda we were allowed to take our little girl to and despite a much touted Kiddies Program , this was really only a token effort .
The backpack and its contents were received on arrival , given by a very pleasant nanny .
No other involvement from anyone at all to make this a special experience .
Had the kitchen staff not allowed for 2 lots of cookie baking , there was nothing else laid on for little kids who can not officially go out on game drives .
The first sitter got on well but when she went off sick , the replacement was a nervous woman who inspired no trust in any one , least of all the 4 yr old !
All in all , this did not make for a good family holiday as we felt nervous leaving our daughter at the lodge for extended periods knowing there was nothing to really occupy her .
As an alternative , Tuningi at Madikwe is great when it comes to giving the kids stuff to entertain them ( although Madikwe is nowhere near as beautiful as Phinda ) .
What An Amazing Experience .
My husband visited Phinda in 203 and wanted to take us there on a family vacation .
All I can tell you is , you have to experience this amazing place for yourself , simply breathtaking .
We have a 9 year old girl that traveled with us and she was catered to by everyone .
The staff is accommodating and very friendly , rooms are clean and the animals walk around outside grazing on vegetation .
The game drives are outstanding , our ranger had a passion for his job and animals like I had never seen before .
It truly does feel like a dream while you are driving around the reserve looking at animals , birds , trees , ect .
Worth the long flight to travel there and we will be going back !
5 star price , 3 star service .
This was my third visit to Phinda and was saddened by several issues that readers should take note of ; Every activity we tried to arrange was either fully booked or too difficult to coordinate .
The rhino tracking programme – as advertised on their brochure and one of the reasons why we chose this camp – had no rangers with the correct permits to accommodate .
Offered a free laundry service on our arrival orientation briefing – only to find out management could not accommodate at short notice .
“ Wild Cat Cheetah Programme ” fully booked , but when we contacted the company direct , they were more than accommodating to make space .
( Although seeing big cats in the wild and then behind a fence with poorly maintained enclosures raises an eyebrow as to why Phinda would suggest such an activity .
Patting and cuddling wild cheetahs for a fee is not in the spirit of animal conservation .
Being woken up for game drives after specifically explaining to our ranger we were not taking part in certain slots .
It sometimes felt like a student `` Contiki tour operator '' i. e. : all back on the bus departing at 16h0 please .
The final straw was not being provided with an exit slip since we were in a rush to get a cheetah programme we had to book for ourselves .
After 20 minutes at the exit gate and some 15 km away from the camp , we were instructed to drive back to the camp and retrieve the correct exit paper work .
( Helpful hint to trip advisor readers would be to please remember your exit paper work – it can get very heated at the gate .
) Food was good and the rooms are masterfully decorated .
In all , a 3 star establishment with a 5 star price tag .
4th camp .
This was our 4th & beyond camp on our recent trip to SA , following on from Kirkmans , Ngala Safari Lodge and Ngala Tented Camp .
We took a charter flight from Ngala to Phinda so we had time for the morning game drive at Ngala , a leisurely lunch and 3 hour relax at Phinda before the afternoon game drive .
& Beyond certainly know their stuff and take all the hassle out of these `` relocations '' , everything very well organised and no hassle for the guests .
The Phinda mountain lodge has great accommodation with private plunge pools and very luxurious rooms ( not as good as Ngala tented though ) .

One evening after returning from dinner at the Boma we found our room decorated with candles , a bubble bath awaiting , sparkling wine and a note to `` Pico and Vanessa '' wishing them a happy anniversary .
Such a nice thoughtful touch , unfortunately we are not `` Pico and Vanessa '' , we did let the staff know so we hope they were able to do up the correct couples room in time !

We enjoyed the wine though : ) This is very typical of & Beyond though , just doing that little bit extra for their guests and always a surprise awaiting , whether it is the bush breakfast rather than returning to the camp , the dinners in bush locations or simply a special sundowner during a game drive .
Once again and excellent Ranger/Tracker tean in Cebu and his brother Thomas , Cebi can be a bit moody at times , chill out man : )
Heaven on Earth !
A friend recommended .
It totally exceeded my expectations .
In fact , because it was during the Soccer World Cup , I thought it was going to be crowded .
The second we went into the property , it was like a different world .
Every staff member smiled at us , welcoming drinks , professionals .
The Kitchen Crew did everything they could to pamper us .
The highlight of the breakfast - in additional to the animals running free in front of us - was the monkey stealing my muffin !
And then elephants were drinking our pool water ?
Are you serious ?
Our Ranger was awesome , very detailed oriented .
Did everything he could for us to find `` the big 5 '' .
In the Spring you get to see the babies !
Go out on all shifts , you see different animals at different times .
Unforgettable .
One of the best experiences I have ever had .
Spent 5 days at this lodge , marvelling at it is location , their skilled rangers , the safari - a private reserve to only a few guests .
The roms/cabins are just the most wonderful luxury , with huge windows facing away from the hotel for your privacy .
More Than I Could Ask For !
We stayed at Phinda Mountain Lodge for 3 nights , would have stayed longer if we had time .
The staff are amazing , always welcoming , friendly and intent on making your stay memorable .
Divan and our tracker were so accommodating and friendly .
The food was always something to look forward to , but with such divine meals and would suggest an in-house gym I really needed to work off some calories !
The rooms , well what a treat , I did not want to go out at all , I could have spent all the time in my room .
We will definitely be planning another visit .
Thank you for spoiling us and making our visit worth it .
OUTSTANDING IN EVERY WAY .
The reserve was `` & Beyond '' anything I had hoped it would be .
The staff was most attentive , the animal viewing was awe-inspiring and the food and accommodations five star .

From being greeted upon arrival with wet cloths and drinks , to the custom cooked breakfasts and beautiful dinners ( never made lunch as there was just `` too much to eat at breakfast ) there was nothing that I felt could be improved upon .

Our tracker and guide were most attentive ( funny and knowledgeable - Mensie and Nick ) and enabled us to see all of the big five with the exception of leopard , which remained elusive both at Mountain and Forest Houses .
Our first dinner took place in the bush ; it was magical .
The stops on morning and evening drives were also magical .
Eating so elegantly in the bush was both surprising and delicious .
Coming into my candlelit room after dinner with the tub filled with bubbles was another delight .
I remember thinking when I was there , this is so perfect , it must be a dream .
I look at the pictures I took , and sometimes have to pinch myself as the experience was like a perfect dream .
Perfection
Amazing Private Game Reserve .
They have plenty of lodges .
Our favourite is Rock .
Mountain is the flagship great high views of the open planes .
Forest is in the Bush .
All lodges have fantastic staff that are all very knowledgeable .
They all try there best to see what your wishes are .
Food is amazing All rooms have there own plunge pool .
Highly recommended to go to this Private Game Reserve if you go to SA
Luxury ending to family holiday .
We went to Phinda Mountain Lodge as an ( almost ) end to our holiday .
As we had been travelling around a lot in South Africa , we wanted something more luxury and it worked out perfectly .
From the moment an & Beyond agent replied to my enquiry to the end of the 2 day stay .
There are limited number of lodges that take kids ( ours was then 2 .

5 years old ) , especially on game drives , but Mountain Lodge was fine - we had to work around the rules , but had a great solution - on one of the drives , we had a babysitter at the lodge ( which is surrounded by beautiful nature and animals roaming freely ) , and the next two , we had a private car , which meant that we could do everything at a more leisurely pace .
We understand why kids are not allowed in the bigger groups , and it worked out well for us .

The room was fantastic , with the dip pool ( and animals grazing just next to it as husband and son were in the dip pool ) and the no walking alone after night fall adds to the excitement of the place .
The drive up to the lodge was fantastic ( seeing lots of animals on the way ) , and the reception was great .
However the lady who walked us to the room was a bit rushed , and it felt as if she just wanted to get it over and done with .
On the first night , we had dinner outdoors , and at that point , I was afraid that it would all turn a bit tour group style , with a buffet , and almost felt below expectations .
However the food was all ok , and our son thought the camp fire was rather exciting .

The staff at the lodge in general was nice , but rather stand offish , and not at all personal which we had expected given the first bit of communication we had ( hence the average rating for service ) .
However the drivers and trackers were fantastic ( they would get 10 stars if possible ) !
We had a brilliant time with them , and they were all extremely friendly with us and our son , and in our eyes very knowledgeable , so that made up for everything .
Breakfast in the middle of the drive was also fantastic .

Although & Beyond is on the expensive side , it is worth it as it is a conservation project , and they want to try to run lodges on a pure conservation basis as opposed to allowing for hunting to supplement income .
Phinda did us proud .
On this our second visit to Phinda , we felt like coming home .
All is done with the aim to have a perfectly relaxing , yet at times exciting game experiences .
Attention to detail is ever-present , the staff are relaxed , friendly and clearly proud of their achievements .
It even sometimes as if the animals that we saw in abundance went the extra mile ! Highly recommended .
Fantastic safari experience - truly exclusive .
We have just come back from three nights at Phinda Mountain Lodge .
We had the most amazing time .
Phinda was the last stop on a two week tour of South Africa and , to be honest , was the part that we were least looking forward to .

We had done a safari at the Masai Mara a couple of years ago and found the experience rather unedifying - every time you stopped ( some way off ) from an animal , half a dozen other landrovers bulging with tourists and telephoto lenses crowded in too .
Not very exclusive .
Phinda was utterly different and quite spectacular .
We had our own dedicated Ranger and Tracker ( both excellent ) and shared the drives with no more than 2-4 others .
We were lucky enough to have almost all our drives to ourselves due to other people deciding to lie-in ( in a safari lodge ? ! ) .
So we had an even more exclusive treat .

Davin , our ranger , and Tom , our tracker , were both so knowledgeable - answered all our questions with patience and enthusiasm , found almost all the animals we wanted to see ( only the leopard remained elusive ) and got so close that I found the experience rather hairy at times !
However they were both so experienced and so utterly confident I never really felt at risk - but it was certainly not a tame experience .
Much more exciting !
We barely saw anyone else when we were out , although clearly the rangers shared sightings over the radio .
Strict rules of engagement ensure that animals never felt overwhelmed by watchers which kept our sightings much more exclusive .
Every drive was punctuated with either a coffee or a drinks stop - tablecloth and table , freshly cut lemon and tins of home made biscuits , dried fruit or biltong to go with it as appropriate .
One drive we took a trip on the river ( highly recommended ) and I came within two feet of a crocodile sitting on her eggs .
Very adjacent !
We saw so many birds and animals - from the tiny leopard tortoise to the largest matriarch elephant protecting her month old baby .
Fantastic .
The lodge itself was great - very comfy rooms , almost hermetically sealed from all the bugs outside .
Very welcome to me as I did not feel the need to entertain animals both inside and outside our room .
The outside shower was fun ( my husband tried that ) as were the three or four frogs that joined him .
One night the staff left candles all over the room and along the ( newly ran ) bath - very romantic .
Free laundry was an extra bonus .
The staff at meals were charming and friendly and nothing was too much trouble - as were the `` safarists '' who welcomed us each day and ran the lodge with such efficiency .

The lodge was full of game running around freely within - guards accompanied us back to our room at night for safety - there were nyala , warthogs , monkeys , lizards and ( unfortunately ) golden orb spiders by the number .
All in all a fantastic experience and we would highly recommend it .
Book now !
Awesome experience not to be missed by foreigners .
We have been here often and were reminded just how wonderful it is .
The staff are very friendly and professional and are eager to help out .
The food is divine with huge breakfasts , lunches , dinners , and snacks in between .
The food also changes every day .
The rooms have great decor and space , with plunge pools , modern bathrooms and wifi !
The game drives are wonderful and you are guaranteed a good ranger as they all have lots of training/experience ( we had Ian who was great ) .
You have huge chances of seeing wonderful animals and especially cheetah .
We saw the big five .
This lodge and other & beyond lodges are known for making your trip special and i would especially recommend this to overseas tourists before other places .
Mountain Lodge is the best for families and do accommodate for children better than the other & beyond lodges ( there is a childrens room and they make pizzas ) .

This is great for families , however , if you want less kiddies running around ( it is very private but one still hears them in main part of lodge ) then rather stay at Forest , Vlei , Rock , or another & beyond lodge in Phinda .
This is not a big concern but just advice if it is your honeymoon or something : )
Safari was five star , service at resort makes it a four star .
The safari experience here is amazing and the rangers and trackers work hard to ensure you have a great experience .
We were able to get up close to most animals , while respecting their much needed space .
do not worry too much about having the perfect safari outfits .
The rangers agreed that it does not really matter what you wear but I would avoid neon !
I wore a ball cap the entire time and would recommend a hat for all outings .
Also , if you get hungry early in the morning , you may want to bring a biscuit or something since you are out on early morning drives for two hours and then come back for breakfast .
The service in the restaurant is what brings this resort down a notch .
There is lack of anticipation of the customers needs and this causes frustration and confusion .
Not once was my water or coffee refilled without asking and it was difficult to find someone to do it .
Not a huge issue but after 3 or 4 days it gets annoying .
The lunch set up is confusing and apparently there was dessert but it was not once offered to me over 4 days .
Apparently you need to ask .
I would recommend having coffee delivered to your room in the morning for a more relaxing morning .
The rooms were amazing !
Lots of animals around the resort but nothing to be concerned with .
Overall I would recommend this safari and think it would be perfection once the service at the restaurant is worked out .
Phinda staff on strike - avoid .
Having spent a wonderful two weeks travelling from Cape Town around the garden route and on to Durban we were really looking forward to a few days at Phinda Mountain Lodge .

Imagine our surprise when we were contacted two days before our scheduled arrival to be told that the staff at Phinda were on strike and more worryingly our safety could not be guaranteed so our booking was cancelled .
Phinda is an expensive destination so we could not believe what we were being told .
More importantly we could not believe the contempt shown by the company at the situation they had left us in .
We had spent the previous two weeks receiving wonderful service and a warm welcome from everyone we met , with no sign at all of the problems often associated with South Africa .
We spoke to our travel agent in the UK who told us that it appears Phinda has had staff problems for a long time and were hoping to keep it covered up .
Our advice to others is not to risk a booking at Phinda that might be cancelled at the last minute - there are many other wonderful game reserves in South Africa .
Very good Service .
The service at this lodge eclipses pretty much everything else .
Views from the rooms could be a lot better and the lodge has a very generic feel although it is very comfortable indeed .
Staff are extremely helpful and knowledgeable .
Absolutely Beyond !
Our first visit in South Africa , our first Safari !
Everything was excellent .
Carla Glaspol , our planner from `` and Beyond '' had excellent guidance , made beautiful suggestions for Phinda Mountain Lodge and Vlei .
We loved both !
Very private , beautiful rooms , food delicious , staff wonderful , setting magnificent .
the list goes on .
so well executed .
Hopefully , visitors will try more than one lodge .
Our ranger , Lucky was the best , along with KB , the tracker .
It was fasinating to watch them loved their work , as much as we loved watching them track so many animals , birds , and insects .
Our daughter was ill for one day , while we were out with the rangers , and Phinda Lodge staff , without us asking , were wonderful about calling her and sending soup to her room .
We loved the experiences , the surprises , the animals , terrains , bush dinners , so much food and drinkand way BEYOND !
Another great feature , we did not need yellow fever shots or malaria pills .
Everything went perfectly and we will definitely recomend this adventure to any friends considering safari in Southern Africa .
Great Hilltop location !
We stayed here for 3 nights after 3 nights at the forest lodge with our family with 2 boys ages 9 and 12 .
The family suite is terrific because we also had my 70 year old parents so we all fit in there like a little house .
The staff here is terrific and really organized .
We liked the restaurant and bar set up a bit better than forest because it is all together and you meet more of the other guests .
Also it has a great view of the valley .
We felt that the game viewing was a bit better at Forest at least when we were there but it could have been our days/luck .
Our guide Nick was great and even took the boys fishing one afternoon .
My boys also loved the big pool and the dinner at the Boma and in the Bush .
Very great !
! Would add a fitness center if anything could be changed .
Fantastic animals amidst luxurious surroundings .
My wife and I went to SA on honeymoon , and finished off with 3 days in Phinda .
They were the highlight of the stay !
We saw not only the big 5 , but cheetah and a whole host of other smaller but equally interesting wildlife .

Our ranger , Toby , and our tracker , Pat , worked brilliantly together to unearth all sorts of wonderful wildlife for us to watch - they worked really hard , and were a great combination of fun , enthusiastic and professional .
The food , drink and accommodation were all lovely .
The food and wine were plentiful , varied and very tasty , and the accommodation was delightful - spacious and well designed .
It was a fantastic way to end the trip , and we are already working out when to go back !
It was not cheap , but this is one of those rare occasions where I can honestly say it was worth every penny , and then some !
A Truly Magical Experience in Every Way .
Our friends booked this trip for us .
We had intended staying at The Forest Game Reserve but they were fully booked .
However we need not have worried .
Everything at Phinda Mountain was just perfect .
From the minute we arrived until the time we left we could not fault it .
The staff were chatty , friendly and welcoming .
They went out of their way to make sure everything went smoothly and to our liking .
When we saw the outside of our accommodation we were a little worried , however we need not have worried .
The interior was fabulous , pure luxury .
Every attention to detail was there .
The standard of food was excellent .
It was presented beautifully and the variety was immense .
We ate our evening meal in two different ways during our two day stay .
Outside in the boma on the first night was so different from anything else we have ever experienced .
There were candles and lanterns everywhere , but it was really too dark to see what we were eating .
The second experience was actually in the bush .
It was a wonderful evening at the end of our safari .
The only criticism is , the meat was very tough .
The local wines were all of a high standard and plentiful .
As for the actual safaris they were really exciting .
Our ranger ( Matthew ) , was not afraid to get up close to the animals so we could have a close up view .
He went out of his way to try and find the animals which we said we had like to see .
His knowledge was phenomenal .
He was so enthusiastic about his job .
In all it was a memorable experience which ranks as one of the best two days we have ever spent .
Great area , choose the right lodge .
We were there early January 2014 , after planning a trip there for many years .
We flew in from Londolozi direct with federal air ( by the way highly recommended ) .
The land is simply stunning , the owners did a great job to return farmland to wilderness .
Guiding was good but not excellent , the staff in general good , but there is a difference to family run lodges .
We stayed in Mountain Lodge which is the only lodge accepting kids under 16 .
it is rather big by comparison to similarly priced lodges in RSA .
We had a family room with no view , but a small pool on the deck .
But no shading on either terrace ( there were two ) .
We would have preferred to stay in one of the other lodges .
it is Abigail place and sometimes it is difficult have good sightings as the vehicles have to drive to various areas , although they know the animals are elsewhere .
Nevertheless a must if you love Black Rhino as much as I do !
truly a spectacular and special experience .
as soon as we arrived at the mountain lodge we felt completely , genuinely welcomed .
the place is beautiful , our house was spectacular , quiet and clean .
the lodge itself never felt crowded , always relaxing and the food was SPECTACULAR .
our safaris were guided in the most excellent manner .
lucky , our ranger , and josie , our trekker were truly wonderful .
they gave us many unforgettable moments , lots of knowledge & smiles .
ask for them , i can only recommend them highly as your ranger team .
all through our stay , we were surprised by very well planned little events , like breakfast , dinner , coffee or drinks in the bush .
all was always organized in an elegant fashion , with lots of beautiful details .
the staff was truly excellent and very friendly and helpful .
their genuine smiles brightened up all of our days even more .
i can only recommend going to phinda mountain lodge .
it is an unforgettable memory !
if you want to experience a truly special safari .
go there !
: - ) thank you mountain lodge team !
we will surely be back !
Awesome !
Loved every second .
The best !
When can I go back ?
Just beautiful !
The rangers are knowledgable and friendly the rest off the staff just briliant- .
The game drives are excellent - love the little surprises !
Would go there again and again and again
My happy place .
Just perfect in everyway .
A beautiful comfortable wild .
Phinda has been our first safari experience , it is although difficult to be objective .
1- We definitely loved very much the general service , the cosy and elegant atmosphere of the common area , the discrete but efficacy presence of the staff .
2- Food , far beyond expectation , is inventive , rafinate and mostly prepared with local products .
The cooking staff is gorgeous and succeed in preparing every day something completed different .
3 -The professionalism , culture and skills of the rangers is a real pleasure and the their sincere passion and enthusiasm for their profession is contagious .
From this point of view , Phinda has succeeded to put the right people in the right job .
These rangers are the nicest people we ever met in our tourists-busines-related-relationships .
4- The private reserve is of a real beauty , with richness and variety of landscapes , flora and fauna .
We can not say more , since it is the only place in earth of this kind we have visited .
The reasons we do not give a 5 : 1- Furniture of the public area need some upgrade ( fabric of canapé used and stained ) .
2- Rooms need a more accurate check by the managers concerning cleanliness and the state of furniture .
We have some issues about these 2 points ( some stains , some tissues forgotten by the previous guest , the lock of a door broken ) and the manager in charge manage them very well .
But still , for the huge price payed , there was no evidence of a procedure being in place to prevent this kind of problems .

3- The breakfast is excellent in quality like the rest of the food , but there is a lack of organisation in the order process : nobody come spontaneously to ask you for order , you must grab the ladies attention ( I stood and went closed to one of them ) and ask them to take your order .
But of course , even with these minus points , we will be back !
Proudly South African .
Upon arrival you are greeted with a welcoming smile , drink and cold cloth to refresh .
We went straight to a delightful lunch , roast warthog , variation of wonderful salads that I have not seen before , cheeses , wines , the list is endless .
We were shown around the lodge and then taken to our room .
We declined the afternoon game drive as we decided to lounge around our private pool .
That evening dinner was in the boma which was spectacular .
You walk into this area with bonfires and fire lights everywhere .
The bar area was magnificently displayed with any alcohol and non alcohol beverage available .
The food section had wonderful smells emanating from it .
Great selection of venison on offer and of course the traditional `` pap en wors '' .
We had a few drinks around the bon fire chatting to the staff and then headed to our table for 2 for a fantastic evening .
On getting back to our bedroom to our surprise tea light candles lit the way to the bathroom and the bath was tapped with hot bath water and bubble bath ! ! !
What a welcome sight that was .
Early morning game drive was fantastic .
The guide mentioned we will have a coffee and scone break in the middle of the bush to which my husband jokingly replied `` '' Why not champagne '' !
Well when it came to our break there in the middle of the bush was a beautifully set table with a silver container filled with champagne bottles ! !
With out us knowing he radioed it through .
We had great sightings on the drive .
Dinner that night was once again at the boma , as it is your last night you sit with you tour guide and your group , this we did not know about .
Personally we did not really want to do this , we came away for a 2 night catch up with our busy schedules and dinner was a time we got to do just that .
I feel they should give you the opportunity to choose .
Overall be prepared to eat , relax , eat , drink , eat , sleep and drink .
Great food , staff everywhere , great game drives , great location .
Be careful on room choice .
Some do not look over the plains so ask for ones that do .
Can be a walk to them though .
We will definitely be back .
Home away from home .
Nice place in the middle of a quiet area with no traffic .
Just mother nature .
A bit of a drive from Richards Bay where we landed .
However , the highway is nice and smooth and wide .
all the way .
You can to a gravel road when you veer off the highway to get to the lodge .
15 min drive on the gravel to get to the rooms .
And you can see some wildlife on the way .
We saw giraffes , zebras , buffalos , etc .
Lovely welcome .
Managed to see lions , rhinos , elephants too .
Saw the four of the Big Five .
Leopards are not the easiest to see or find .
So do not get disappointed if you do not see one .
But you are almost guaranteed to see the elephant , rhino , buffalo and lion ( `` big four '' ) .
Food is lovely and traditional .
Nice evenings by the fire with good wine .
Enjoy it .
I absolutely had a good time in between our conference and tense but productive company debates .
Perfect Getaway .
My partner and I spent a wonderful two nights at Phinda recently .
From the moment we arrived we were made to feel so welcome .
The room was absolutely gorgeous , the little touches like the bed side mats and the electric blanket put on in the evenings were fabulous little touches .
The staff really go out of their way to ensure that your stay is a comfortable one .
There was nothing to fault at all .
l The meals were incredible ( if slightly 2 large ) and the atmosphere was magnificent .
Our ranger Lucky found some wonderful sightings for us .
Lioness and cubs , leopard kill ( absolutely INCREDIBLE ! ! )
cheetah and cubs and lioness and male lion hunting .
Ema set up a gorgeous stop for us in the mornings with champagne and orange juice and delicious scones with strawberry cream , just a few hundred meters from a black rhino !
What a weekend to remember .
Can not wait to go back , thank you to all !
Trip Home to South Africa .
We were in South Africa to see our family and had in the past visited private lodges near Kruger Park .
We chose Phinda because it was close to our family in Durban .
We had an amazing stay , we saw the game we wanted to see and more .
The staff were Hospitable making us feel that we were special .
the game ranger Sebo was very knowledgeable almost knowing what the animals were thinking .
We would highly recommend Phinda to all our friends
Once in a lifetime experience .
My wife and I recently took our teenage children to Phinda Mountain Lodge .
It was our first African safari experience and Phinda did not disappoint .
From the moment we arrived we were treated as special guests by all of the staff .

The main lodge was spectacular ; the spacious suites nestled on the grounds around the lodge had every necessary amenity with minibar , snacks and laundry included along with our own personal soaking pool ; food that was absolutely fantastic in its quality and presentation , especially the dinners offered in outdoor BQ setting under the stars or if you like in a picnic setting out in the park ; the guides and trackers were first rate and extremely knowledgeable which made the actual safari experience something we will never forget - being so up close with cheetahs , lions , elephants , zebra , rhino , hippo , impala , leopards , buffalo , giraffe , wart hogs , monkeys , baboons , crocodile , etc , just too much to believe ! ! !
The thousands of acres of rolling hills and open plains were beyond scenic , especially at sunrise and sunset .
The kicker on the afternon/evening drives had to be the amazing views we had of the stars in the night sky .
levels of detail and brilliance that most people probably have never seen before but just incredible .

Our guide and tracker also took us out to fish and shoot one morning and on our last day , took us up to a special mountaintop rock overlooking the whole park for one of the most amazing sunrises we have ever seen .
can not say enough good things about Phinda Mountaintop Lodge .
We highly recommend Phinda for that dream vacation you are waiting to take your family on .
Best Vacation !
We really enjoyed our stay !
Every need was anticipated .
Our guide and tracker were incredible with off road experiences to find lions one night and a black rhinoceros the next day .
We also watched a herd of elephants as they made their way to a waterhole .
We saw so many different animals .
The accommodations were wonderful and the food was abundant and delicious .
We enjoyed a bush dinner the first night and dinner in the BOMA the second night .
We had pancakes made for us roadside on our last game drive .
Awesome all round .
My husband and I spent 2 nights at Phinda as we celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary .
From the moment we arrived , we were made to feel so welcome .

The room was breathtaking and the little extras like the welcome card , anniversary wishes , bubble baths in the evenings , electric blankets which were turned on in the evenings and the aircon which was turned on in the day , etc etc made us feel so welcome .

Loved the outside shower and deck chairs where we could enjoy the afternoon sun and even take a dip in the spashpol outside our chalet , let alone the game which came and greeted us and drank water from our pool outside our chalet , enabling us to get so close we could touch them .
The staff were so friendly and the food was absolutely delicious .
Thank you Paolo for showing us some of our trophies we donated .
Please remember to let us have the photos of the others .
We will definitely be back .
Incredible setting , amazing service .
My boyfriend and myself spent two nights at the Phinda Mountain Lodge .
We arrived just in time for dinner which we were driven to in the middle of the bush .
The setting was out of this world .
There were lanterns hanging from the trees and the tables were beautifully decorated .
The drive to the lodge was in the dark and the ranger stopped to show us different constellations .
It was an amazing evening .
The Mountain Lodge is better suited for families rather than couples .
Kids are welcome , which may suit you or may not !
There is free wifi all over the lodge , including the rooms .
We saw a cheater kill , two lionesses , loads of impala , nypala , buffalo , wildebeest , warthogs , black and white rhino , giraffes , zebras , hippos , and lots of birdlife .
The rooms are large with beautiful bathrooms and balcony area with deck chairs overlooking the private plunge pool .
An overall wonderful experience .
Outstanding .
From the moment we arrived we felt like royalty .
the staff pay extreme detail to everything and I mean everything ! ! !

From getting greeted on arrival to a lady waiting with fresh towels and cool ginger juice , and a guard to park our car and take our luggage to the room to the best food ever , the rooms , surprises ( which I do not want to spoil for visitors but it is extraordinary ) on the game drives , the ranger Ally , and our tracker Chris , to surprise bubble baths and candles lit on your return to your room .
and the staff making every effort imaginable .
I had not asked for any special diet but did mention at our first lunch if they perhaps had a gluten free bread roll that would be great .
well from then on the chef ensured I had gluten free options at every meal .
including cupcakes at tea times .
We saw everything except cheetah despite tracking them effortlessly .
WOW wow wow and we will be back for sure to try another lodge !
Worth every single penny and an experience of a lifetime !
Absolutely worth a visit !
Phinda Mountain Lodge is incredible .
We stayed in number 13 which was stunning .
The views from our room was fantastic , with our own deck and splash pool , a bathroom with a view , I did not want to leave our room for any reason !
The game drives were outstanding and each drive had a special sighting .
Thank you for spoiling us .
The food was very good .
Happy days !
( quote Sibu our guide on another great sighting ) Too true , Sibu & Beyond and the Mountain Lodge at Phinda Private Reserve exceeded my expectations .
Everything ran smoothly from the moment we were picked up from our hotel in Durban .
The staff were wonderful : they displayed good humour and a genuine personal touch while delivering a totally professional service .
Our guide and tracker were also fantastic .

Not only did they make sure we got see a huge range of wildlife , they did it in an informative way and seemed to be just as thrilled at finding the animals themselves as we were to see them in the wild .
Finding animals on safari does not provide instant gratification ( nor should it ) but just about everything else does .
The safaris , the Big 5 , sundowners , the meals and the settings .
all good ; We packed so many memories into such a short period .
It was brilliant and thanks to all those that contributed .
Awesome place .
Staff , venue and reserve excellent .
Game drives morning and night were superb .
Nice surprises like candlelight dinner in the bush at the end of the afternoon game drive or lakeside Champange & pancakes really were special .
Our ranger Lucky & tracker Josi showed us everything - big 5 & even leopard twice .
Awesome .
Lodge staff were excellent - Richard & Eric were fantastic as were Lauren & Kylie .
Both Lauren & Kylie were very nice to ours sons .
Very welcoming place .
Most Amazing Game Viewing Experience in a Luxurious Setting .
My husband and I spent four nights at Phinda Mountain Lodge in April 2014 .
It was our first trip to South Africa , and my first safari experience .
From beginning to end , & Beyond ensured an absolutely magical experience .
We arrived around 3:30pm our first day and after settling into our room we were immediately whisked away to join a group out on a game drive .

Although I have little basis for comparison , my husband has done safari in the Serengeti and was absolutely wowed by the proximity of the animals and by how knowledgeable and practiced our ranger and tracker were at finding even the most shy creatures .
We saw the Big Five and then some : many cheetah , zebra , giraffe , wildebeest , an African python , hyena -- everything .
Our room was a beautifully appointed enormous suite with a gorgeous cantilevered deck featuring a private plunge pool and outdoor shower .
The entire lodge is a rusticaly luxurious and tranquil retreat and the service is absolutely unparalleled .

Special thanks to Chef David , who was so kind and friendly and who supervised a tremendous team cooking up delicious breakfasts , lunches , teas , snacks and cocktails , dinners , desserts , you get the idea -- when we were not looking at animals , we were eating !
What a beutiful place , i like everything about this place , I thank God for broghting me in this place
Loved it !
I spent 4 nights here and loved it .
I loved the suites and how they are scattered down the hillside amongst the vegetation .
The bushbuck came and drank out of my plunge pool each day .
The game drives were amazing and I liked this location on the reserve better than Forest Lodge as we were able to go to the far south in the mountains looking for Black Rhino and Lions and Leopards .
Ian was a fantastic guide .
The staff at the lodge were good .
It is a bigger lodge so not quite as personal as I was used to , but it was not all that busy when I was there .
I can see where it might be a different story during busy season when the lodge is full to capacity .
I can not say that they blew my mind but it was definitely a very good experience .
As with pretty much any place , there is always room for improvement , but ultimately they are really good and I would go back if I find myself back in the area .
Luxury Safari with fabulous game viewing .
This lodge ( the largest of the lodges on the reserve ) holds up to about 45 people and yet somehow you feel like they know each of you and you get an intimate , quiet experience .
Game Drives First up the game drives are spectacular !
Our ranger Lucky had been there more than 18 years and managed to find us not only the big 5 but also a mama cheetah killing a nyala and feeding her cubs .

Every drive had something spectacular and it compared exceptionally well to previous safaris I ’ ve taken in Krueger so my initial concerns about whether it would be as good game viewing close to Durban were unfounded .
Our ranger and tracker ( Lucky and Josi ) were exceptional and very fun and they were a big reason for our positive experience .
RomsThe rooms are lovely with King bed ( or twins ) , small lounge area , massive bathroom including rain shower , deep claw foot bath , double sink , and outside small plunge pool and small deck .
There are open windows to take advantage of the view although you must keep doors closed or monkeys get in !
It is common to see animals right at the deck .
There was a good hairdryer , free wifi , robes , sarongs , free laundry services , mini bar with snacks and in room safe ( which is important as the doors don ’ t lock from the outside ) .
The bathroom products included bath oil and salts to make maximum use of the gorgeous bath .
The only noticeable thing missing was slippers , which seemed a big oversight .
There were lovely other touches eg the inclusion of a fresh lemon for your gin , ice always being refreshed , ribbons around toilet paper , turn down service etc .
All rooms are completely private so you can lounge around on your deck or in the pool in complete privacy .
I stayed in two rooms 21 and 16 both had advantages 21 was much closer to the main lodge but 16 had a much larger deck and stunning mountain views .
The only issue is the rooms are not very suitable for twin sharing as there are no doors on bathrooms etc .
Catering and staff .
All meals and drinks ( including alcohol ) are included in the price , which seems extremely economical when everything is taken into account .
Food is varied and of very good quality .
Breakfast includes range of cereals , yoghurt , cheese , ham , salmon etc as well hot breakfast to order .
Lunch is buffet with lots of options and dinner is usually set menu with a few choices .
Food is incredibly plentiful and you wish you could enjoy it but you eat so much !
Likewise all drinks wine , spirits etc are included .
The staff ratio is about 2 : 1 staff to guests so you there is always someone available to assist .
Overall the staff were very pleasant and accommodating .
There were always there to greet you on the return from drives with drinks and warm or cool towels or to get you whatever you need .

The only issue I had is one night Kudu was served ( which was had just seen on game drive ) we commented to one of the white male servers that this was a little strange and he said “ Don ’ t worry they love it ” .
I ’ m sure Kudu don ’ t love being killed so a different response might have been more appropriate .
There also seemed to be some inconsistency between service provided .
For example one of our group returned to her room to find a bubble bath run and the bathroom filled with candles which sounded gorgeous and made the rest of us jealous .
Some rooms had a little fudge jar but others didn ’ t etc .
Other comentsPhinda is an award winning eco reserve and it is lovely to hear first hand about hout the staff enjoy working there and how much Phinda puts back into the community .

There were times when the animals preference clearly came before the guests ( eg not shining lights on giraffes at night because it blinds them ) and it was reassuring to see them balance the animals needs with those of the guests .
It is a little haven of relaxation and definitely worth spending the money to go visit and I will definitely be back .
The mountain lodge is the most basic of the lodges but the quality was exceptionally 5 star and well worth a visit .
I can only imagine the service at the other lodges would be even more exceptional .
Absolutely AMAZING .
Everything was wonderful : service , food , lodging , childcare , game guides .
We can not wait to return on our next trip to South Africa .
I can not recommend one room over the other because they are all wonderful .
can not not go back .
Phinda was the best safari I have ever been to .
Their staff are the most friendly people and their wildlife is spectacular for example : during the first five minutes of the drive , we saw a cheetah with cubs .
There are also animals in the lodge .
You see nyala , vervet monkeys and baboons .
The whether was just the right whether for the stay .
It is the most amazing holiday and I am happy to rate it 5 stars
Wonderful views and great service .
We were part of a wedding group , the service and attention to detail were great .
Room in the trees and watched warthogs and Nyalas grazing from our bed .
Luxurious room with every possible amenity .
A wonderful experience from beginning to end .
It should be on your bucket list .
I stayed here for 2 nights and in that time I saw the BIG 5 plus lots of other wildlife .
Also paid and did the tour of tracking the elusive Black Rhino by foot .
very exciting and the money from the tour goes into Black Rhino conservation .

Our tracker and guide was Lucky and Josie they are an absolute credit to the company , the knowledge and passion they shared was amazing plus the little surprise stops for afternon/dusk drinks or morning coffee in amazing locations .
The lodge is lovely , the food was awesome .
no it was delicious and amazing .
The room had a lovely african feel to it .
no tv which was great it made you enjoy the room and its surrounds , along with the animals dropping by for a drink out of the outdoor jacuzi .
The bungalow rooms are all very private and the bathroom was massive .

As Phinda reserve is a narrow reserve you get to see a lot of different animals in a short amount of time unlike some of the other well know reserves you have to drive , drive , drive a long distance to see a variety of animals .
Amazing !
The room was unique and elegant , food was outstanding , and the game drive was fabulous and full of animals .
Our ranger Divan was impressive ; he was very friendly , patient , attentive and knowledgeable about everything animals , bugs , plants , birds , snakes , .
I hope to go back one day !
Wonderful and unforgettable .
There aren ’ t enough superlatives to describe our fantastic stay at Phinda .
We visited at Phinda Mountain Lodge for four nights at the beginning of August .
The Lodge is small with only 25 rooms so it was never noisy or busy .
The staff are very attentive and it has a warm friendly atmosphere .
The Lodge is not enclosed and there were a lot of nyala and other game wandering freely around the rooms .
For this reason guests need to be accompanied by a guard after dark .
This was never a problem as guards were always available to walk with you and we didn ’ t have to wait long for a guard to come and get us .
We had two separate suites to accommodate ourselves and our two children ( aged 11 and 14 ) .
At first we were concerned as the rooms were not very close to one another even though we were neighbours but the children soon proved to us that this was not a problem .
Both suites were lovely : the accommodation simply but comfortably furnished , with enormous picture windows opening onto a terrace with plunge pool .
The children ’ s terrace was frequently visited by thirsty nyala , coming to drink .
I was able to listen to and observe countless birds from our terrace as we lay in the peace and quiet between game drives .
Beware of the monkeys though , I caught one pushing open the sliding door on our terrace in an attempt to sneak in .
On our first night we enjoyed a wonderful brai by lantern light in the bush , with superb food , and a huge brazier adding to the atmosphere .
Other meals were also taken in the Boma , an enclosed outdoor eating area .
The food was always hearty and excellent .

As the evenings were cool in August we were also supplied with blankets for our knees ! I can not praise Ashley ( our guide ) and Busani ( our tracker ) enough for the contribution they made to our stay .
Busani demonstrated his first class game tracking skills as we scoured the reserve in search of big game .
Ashley shared his in-depth knowledge of the bush and the wildlife within it .
We were lucky enough to have a vehicle to ourselves and then we saw all of the big five on our first day .
There was so much wonderful game to see and we were able to get so close to it and then sit quietly and take it all in .
It is an experience we will never forget .
Best part of our South African holiday by far .
Busani took the time to teach our children the basics of tracking and they were completely hooked .
Ashley let our son sit next to him in the front of our vehicle and they were often deep in earnest conversation .
These experiences turned an already exciting safari experience into unforgettable adventure .
There were a number of really nice touches to our stay : one night we came back to find our room decorated with candles .
There are others but I wouldn ’ t want to spoil the surprise .
& Beyond go out of their way to demonstrate their eco credentials and there is a real feeling of caring for the reserve and the game in it .
I would definitely seek out & Beyond resorts elsewhere for future holiday destination .
A perfect way to start .
Phinda Mountain Lodge was our first time to a game reserve and I can not think of a better way to start a vacation in South Africa .
We drove from Durban and had no trouble finding the Lodge , and from the moment of arrival through to our departure after two nights everything was perfect .
Staff were warm and welcoming , and our room was clean and well-appointed with all the usual amenities of a luxury hotel .
Food was very good with lots of choice .
The game drives were thrilling ( cold mornings , but hot water bottles and blankets helped ) .
Our ranger , Matt , was enthusiastic and knowledgeable and our tracker , Bongese , was equally so .

We had so many interesting and exciting experiences , from watching a cheetah and her four cubs lounging about while they decided what to do about dinner , to witnessing a lion kill , to watching the cheeky monkeys as they looked for an opportunity to steal some food at the main lodge .
Every game drive had a little surprise !
This was truly a wonderful start to our South African safari and my only regret is that we had not booked for three nights .
Great family safari lodge .
The largest ( and one of the more affordable ) of Phinda lodges , Mountain lodge never feels too big .
They do a great job of creating a memorable experience .
They seemed to have a lot of vehicles as we ended up with our own during 2 nights we spent there and other families of 4 or 5 seemed to as well .

While this may have been the result of others having larger groups we were thrilled to be on our agenda with our agenda and with fabulous a guide and tracker ( thanks Toby and Joel ) who helped us see so much .
They also did a great job providing different environments for the meals - one night in the restaurant and one night in a candle-lit outdoor Boma .
We love doing cooking classes while we travel and the chef was wonderful , providing us with a cooking demo and sharing some classical local dishes .
Its a great place for families as they have a large swimming pool ( though it was too cold to swim in when we were there ) and a selection of games in the lounge .
They also have connected family rooms though we did not request these and had 2 individual suites .
Rooms are all a bit different with some a bit more private than others though it felt like they could use some minor maintenance to keep them at the impeccable level of other lodges .
Truely Awesome experience and setting !
Arriving into the resort on its own private airstrip in a 12 seater gave us a feel of what was to come .
Primitive on one hand but true luxury on the other , both making the trip unique as an experience .
We visited as a group of work colleagues ( all male ) and basically had the lodge to ourseves .
Each of us had our own hut come bungalow needing armed guard to access after dark .
no not a gimmick !
You are really up close to nature , with nature getting their own back after dark .

During daylight From sunrise and sunset both seen during safari trips in open , exposed trucks where we got amongst , Lions , Lepards etc , not so close to Elephants and the less predictable animals .
A true WOW from start to finish getting really up close and personal .
The tracker and drivers are very skilled ( and armed ) getting the closeness just on the edge of intrusive .

Money stolen from the room safe .
& no follow up .
We had been at the mountain lodge January 2014 and had an excellent experience .
This is why we went back 2 weeks ago .
The staff was still wonderful , so were our game drives and ranger richard .
Unfortunately the rest of our experience this time was NOT exactly what we hoped for .
Since none of the lodges have keys ! ! ! !
! , one has to rely on the safety of your in-rom safe .
When we came back from our morning game drive on the third day , we immediately realized that that our items in the safe had been placed differently then we had left them .
Upon counting our money , we were shocked to find out euros and rand were missing !
We contacted managment , a report was taken & the manager told us she was sorry and will follow up on the issue .
No apology note when we left , just the standard survey form was left in our room upon departure .
We did not expect to get our money back , but an apology note would have been highly appreciated !
It is now nearly 2 weeks later and we have heard nothing from the mountain lodge .
To add to our disappointment , we received a mail from phinda main office , innocently stating they hope we had a nice time .
That obviously means that the theft was not even communicated to the main office , which makes it hard to believe that anyone cared about our money being stolen .
Very disappointing !
We loved the mountain lodge and it is really friendly staff and were planning on going back there with friends , but our experience this time of course made us change our minds .
We will not be back !
PS : Apart from that , our little pool was dirty , the pump not on and on the headboard had white , yucky stains .
All in all , NOT a good experience !
If you get no room key , at least your safe should be secure !
If it is not , at least there should be an official apology after a theft and a follow up on the issue !

Phinda Safari .
We were two couples who stayed at Phinda for 3 days at the end of August .
We then spent 3 days on safari at Exeter and another 3 days at Jabulani before heading to Cape Town for 3 days and then back to the states .
We all felt Phinda was a fantastic experience with a very attentive staff and really nice private lodges for each couple .
Our best ranger and tracker of the three stays was Ian and KB at Phinda .
Ian was knowledgeable about all the animals but especially the birds , their names and habits .
Other rangers we rode with tended to ignore birds unles specifically asked .
His enthusiasm about everything we saw was unusual in any guide .
His broad smile and fist pump in the air when we finally found a black rhino and drove close to it was a highlight .
Another experienced couple with us who had been at Phinda several times before specifically asked to be assigned to Ian because of his experience and personality and we heartily agree with them .
Ian met us every morning in the main lodge and got us our wake up coffee before setting off on the morning safari .
With him , we were always the first vehicle out in the morning and the last one back after dark .
There are some differences in the animals at the 3 reserves we visited so staying at more than one reserve is recommended if it can fit your budget .
All meals at Phinda were buffet , although one could order cooked eggs from the kitchen in the morning .
The food was good with an abundance of fruits and veggies but serving some 50 people who come and go at different times would be difficult if not done buffet style .
This place was incredible !

Had a fantastic stay made all the more special by the effort put in by Luke and Bethenel ( excuse the spelling ) before the last game drive we were asked by them what we wanted to see of course one of the dominant males was the answer so off we set next morning treked for a couple of hours and there he was walking nearly within touching distance AMAZING is an understatement .
Thanks to all for this experience highly recomended

Amazing vacation .
We had an amazing visit to Phinda combining 3 nights at Forest Lodge with 2 nights at Mountain Lodge .
The whole experience was incredible I just didn ’ t want to leave .
Our ranger Robin was terrific .
He and tracker Sipu were so experienced and enthusiastic that we were immediately enveloped in the excitement of life in the bush .

On one memorable drive , Robin took us to areas I wouldn ’ t have thought possible so that we could stay with a pride of lions , both on the ground and to view from binoculars when they were on the side of a hill .
As they disappeared from view we listened to the chilling cries of a hyena as it encountered the lions .
Robin then drove around the hills to relocate the lions on the other side of a small ravine .
An experience I ’ l never forget .
We also got the opportunity to do a walk with Robin and see his and Sipu ’ s impressive tracking skills .
( Do this if you get the chance ; it is indescribable to see a mother and calf waking up , knowing that they have no idea you are there .
) And then there is the accommodation and food !
The individual rom/suites are beautiful .
Huge room and bathroom with separate sofa area in the bedroom and outside deck with sun-loungers , plunge pool and outside shower .
Amazing to be in a private pool looking out at the bush .
The food was excellent and plentiful , memorable meal was enjoyed in the “ Boma ” with fabulous open fires .

The entire & Beyond service/experience was seamless and perfectly executed ; from the moment Kristin replied to our enquiry to say she would be our safari planner , to our final airport drop off ; we couldn ’ t have had a better experience .
Kristin worked out all the details including a hotel either side of the safari in Johannesburg for luggage we didn ’ t need at Phinda , vehicle transfers and additional activities at Mountain .
In summary , I felt like I was in the pages of National Geographic for 6 days .
one word .
amazing and wow .

A magical Christmas .
We arrived on Christmas Eve for four nights -me , my sister and my 10 year old daughter , for a four night stay at Phinda Mountain Lodge .
We had also booked a couple of trips through & Beyond , the first of which was turtle watching that night .

Spending Christmas Eve at Sodwana Bay , with the Milky Way and many other stars overhead , the waves crashing behind us , and watching a huge , beautiful leatherback turtle digging a nest to lay her eggs was absolutely magical .
I will never forget the sound of her breathing at the sheer effort , it was such a privilege to witness .
We stayed right until she had found her way back to the ocean .
The downside of that was that it was 3am when we got back to the lodge and we did not want to miss our Christmas morning game drive so 2 hours sleep was all we could grab !

The room was great for relaxing in though , and once we were on the drive we soon woke up , we were at a lion sighting within ten minutes ( we could actually see them with binoculars from the main deck of the lodge ) .
That first drive was charmed , with lions , cheetah , white rhino with a baby , and all the usual suspects all seen before breakfast !
Opening a few presents we had brought out on Christmas day , while nyala came down to drink from our pool , is a great memory .
Over the following days we saw everything we wanted to , including leopards twice , thanks to Sibu and Tom , our fantastic ranger and tracker team .
One evening we were watching some zebras and giraffes at a water hole when we heard a low grunt to the other side of the vehicle , off in some bushes , and with a cry of `` leopard mating ! ''
we were off !
It felt almost like a movie at times , the sightings were so amazing .
We saw the lion cubs several times over the rest of our stay , plus the three cheetah brothers and their mum .

I also developed a soft spot for warthogs , and my daughter loved the story Zulus tell about why black rhinos are so bad-tempered ! Breakfast ( and all other meals ) were delicious , especially the surprise champagne breakfast in the bush on our last morning , and the boma on our last night .
Fanele , the kids rep ( for want of a better word ) was a gem and my daughter really enjoyed spending a couple of hours with her on Boxing Day , baking cookies and playing games .
Our room was really comfortable , the outdoor shower was amazing and the plunge pool got used lots as it was absolutely baking for a couple of days .
we had often return to find nyalas at the front and rear of our room , which was lovely too .
Our second excursion was to Emdoneni Cat Rehabilitation Centre , we were amazed to find that we were to have our experience before the centre opened to the public .
The guide there told us all about the work they do and the plight of each of the types of cat that are there .
Stroking Juba the cheetah was another one of those lifelong memories , I can still hear him purring like a truck !
My daughter also loved Sheila the Serval , who we adopted for a year .
I had echo the earlier comments about the walk from the rooms to the lodge being a bit long and uphill , but that is the only thing I had change .
The whole experience , and all communication with Desray from & Beyond both before and after the trip , was first class .
I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone .

Mountain Climbing .
Our stay at the Mountain Lodge was wonderful .

I would caution that the cabins are set away from the main lodge and the paths to and from can be a bit steep and challenging at times , especially at night when it is pitch dark and you only have a flashlight from the security guard to guide you to your room .
As long as you adhere to the guidelines , having the animals around the lodge was not an issue .

The monkeys will be a nuisance if you happen to leave your door open and you must take care to look around you in the daylight as you travel back and forth from the lodge to your cabin ; we actually almost stepped on , what we were told , was a venomous snake on our way to our cabin one day .
The views are breathtaking and it was a welcome pleasure to have air conditioning .
The rooms are spacious and beautiful and we loved having a stocked mini-bar -- it helps keep you in your cabin at night and not wanting to wander out in the darkness .
There are no fences so the animals truly are able to wander into camp and wander onto your patio and around your cabin so it is best to stay indoors after dark .
Although the lodge was accommodating to children , the food for the adults was too over the top in my opinion .
Simple would have been better .
The dishes were too fancy and most times we had no idea what we were even eating because the descriptions given were so fancy you could not decipher them .
The services was very good and loved their curio shop .
The safaris were great and the rangers take every precaution to keep you safe and stay a respectful distance from the animals .
Overall , this is a wonderful place and I would definitely go back !

Best safari , ever - according to South African in-laws !
Our stay had been booked by our South African family for 2 nights in April 2015 .
Our in-laws had not stayed at Phinda before but had heard great things .
It has the advantage of being a ca .
4 hour drive from our in-laws house in Southern Natal .
We arrived and were struck immediately by the size of the reserve and how well-preserved the environment has been .
On the ca .
9km drive to Mountain Lodge we saw Impala and elephants .
Our four young children were blown away .
From the very moment we arrived at the Mountain Lodge ( to a terrific and friendly welcome ) we felt totally at home , which is rare in a 5* property .

There was dedicated childcare ( the kids were taken on a WONDERFUL fishing trip by the Lodges nanny and a guide from which they returned FULL of excitement and incredibly happy having caught 5 fish and seen lots of wildlife ) and a delightful reception .
The food was exceptionally good and my mother-in-law , who is a gourmet chef , was highly impressed .
The most important factor - the game drives - were tremendous ; on the first night we saw Black Rhino , Lion , Buffalo and were herded down a road by a large bull Elephant !

The room was phenomenal - we booked the family suite ( rooms 24/26 ) which had two separate rooms each with a large double bed and a separate bedroom with two single beds and a communal lounge - this comfortably took our entire party of 8 .
This is one of the most memorable and wonderful trips I have ever taken .
More impressive was the fact that my South African in-laws , who have been on many safaris , rated it as their best ever stay at a reserve .
Superb , although we preferred the Forest Lodge .
I am talking about the difference between 9 .
5 and 10 - they are both excellent grades , and Phindas Forest and Mountain Lodge are both excellent choices .
Our family preferred the unique al-glas suites at the Forest Lodge that gave us complete privacy by surrounding us by woods .
The Mountain Lodge suites were bigger , but darker ( when we finally found the switch for the small ceiling lights , it was still pretty dark ) .
Our walk to the suite was also a bit treacherous , as was the hidden step leading from the bedroom area to the living area in our suite .
( I did not fall , but I did worry about it .
) I think in the summer , I might have preferred the Mountain suite , with its private outdoor plunge pool , but by fall ( late April ) , it was much too cold .
Finally , while the service was excellent at both , Phindas Forest Lodge seems to be slightly better managed than the Mountain lodge .
Staff are better trained and are therefore even more helpful at anticipating the guests every need .
PS - a shout out to our guide Lucky , who was true to his name .
We game him an impossible list of things to see during our 2 drives with him , and he somehow managed to deliver .
What a tracker !
The Game Drives are one of a kind and the food is excellent .

Amy will even take them fishing in one of the dams .
The whole experience is totally amazing
