A Benchmark for South African Game Reserves .
We stayed for 3 nights at the Phinda Mountain Lodge and the service , game drives , stunning landscapes and attention to detail lived up to the property ’ s sterling reputation .
Phinda Mountain Lodge is a 25-rom al-vila luxury property – one of six lodges that are part of the & Beyond Phinda private game reserve located roughly 3 hours North of Durban .

The room rates are all-inclusive and come with two 3-4 hour game drives per day , three bufet-style meals daily , complimentary laundry service , free wi/fi and complimentary bar/beverages/snacks in-rom and at the main lodge .
Phinda is known for the particularly high quality of its game drives and the reserve did not disappoint .

In our three days we were able to view all of the Big 5 ( Lions , Buffalo , Leopard , Elephant and Rhino ) as well as many other animals and birds including cheetah , giraffe , hippo , crocodile , nyala , impala , kudu and warthog .
I feel I can say without hyperbole that the setting is among the most beautiful in the world with glorious sunsets , terrains and panoramas .
If you want an escape from city life I can ’ t think of a better place to do it .
The game drives make sure to leverage off the setting and include tea/drink stops from especially pretty vantage points .
Beyond the actual game drives , the service was also top-clas .
Our ranger and tracker were excellent , friendly and informative .
Staff members in the lodge were also quick and efficient and available for any request .
We never had to wait or want for anything , which is always a good measure of whether a property meets 5-star standards .
Amenities in the large vila-style rooms were comprehensive and the attention to detail was at the luxury level .

Our rom/vila was large including a king size bed , sitting area , dressing area , large bathroom with separate luxury bath and shower , his and hers sinks and there was also an outdoor terrace with loungers and a small plunge pool .
One note : we were there in the early winter and the leaves in the pool did not make it particularly attractive so we didn ’ t use our plunge pool .

That said , it did serve as a watering hole for the local nyala so we were pleased it was there ! Toiletries were of high quality and the room was kept immaculately clean with three maid services daily .
The room also came with a complimentary mini-bar which included cocktail amenities such as fresh lemon and zesters as well as snacks .
One area which I felt could improve in consistency was the dining .
Dinners were generally of high quality and we were impressed with the special outdoor settings the hotel made use of .

During our three night stay , one dinner was set up in a beautiful outdoor encampment a short drive from the lodge , another in a boma replete with fireplace and torches while the third was in the main dining room .
The game fillet and curries served were superb and up there with any fine dining restaurant in the country .
The complimentary wines were also good .
Unfortunately , I did not feel that the breakfast or lunches necessarily lived up to the same standards and could use some improving .
They were by no means bad and I felt they were satisfactory , but just not up to the same standards as the dinners .
As the meal portions were all large and I felt full most of the time , I don ’ t feel this is a huge problem .
Overall , & Beyond and the Mountain Lodge staff live up to their reputation as among the best private game reserves in South Africa .
If you want high quality service , attention to detail and world-class game drives , this is the place to go .
We look forward to returning to Phinda and trying out the other lodges !
Real Safari feeling in South Africa .
We stayed 2 nights at Mountain and then 2 nights at Forest and we can definitely recommend doing this .
In march when we were there is seemed not to be completely full - or at least it was full with adults so it was tranquil and romantic .
We have heard it can get noisy with lots of children but it was not in March 2015 .
Our room was a chalet style house with small plunge pool with an amazing view ! !
I now know why when arriving the lounge area also with a spectacular view was so still - The view from our own private pool was just so wow .
And very private .
The decoration of the room was straight out of a magazine and made me want to go home and have a re-decoration of my own home .
Stunning and stylish .
Wonderful fudge in the ( free ) mini-bar but beware of the monkeys .
We know to watch out for monkeys but these monkeys are really sneky .
I left a bowl of nuts on the minibar inside our room and 2 monkeys managed to get in while we were admiring the view outside .
Believe me they were not going to leave without me calling my husband to help shoo them away !
The food , like in most & beyond camps , is based around a lot of vegetables and is not only healthy but really really tasty .
The biscuits and cakes are also to die for ! ! ! !
We saw an amazing amount of wildlife .
Unfortunately we didnt click with our Ranger and we found it rather irritating that he continually talked ( loudly ) to the tracker while viewing .
His continual talking to the tracker also meant he missed picking up on moments that people wanted to take pictures while driving .

Normally the @ beyond rangers are the best but unfortunately if it does not click it makes the group dinner together a bit uncomfortable - something I think they should reconsider specially if the group consist of people who do not know each other and some of the group do not speak English .
We would have preferred to have had dinner on our own for both nights .
Even though we did get on with the other couple - we would have liked to have been on our own in the evening .
Slight damper on our stay was that our departure was confusing .
There was nobody we recognized in the lobby at check out time .
There is no clear reception so I ended up asking for my car keys in the lodge shop .
We saw other groups with their rangers saying goodbye but ours was no where to be seen .
Luckily someone saw us standing with our cases looking confused and arranged for our car to be driven to the lodge front .
Fantastic !
We spent 5 nights at mountain lodge with 2 children aged 10 and 14 , it was the most amazing family holiday that we have ever had .
The game viewing was incredible , we saw everything , so close up too .
Our ranger , Rici was fantastic , she had such a passion that was infectious , and Sepewi our tracker was lovely .

I can not fault the service or the food , we were there over Easter Sunday and were suprised by an amazing breakfast for the whole lodge in the bush along with an Easter egg hunt for the children , plus Easter eggs back in our rooms .
I would highly recommend & Beyond , and can not wait to go back .
The Phinda way .
precious people .

My husband and I we are fortunate to enjoy the fine hospitality Mountain Lodge offers theirs guests - I do not think in all our numerous bush trips have we seen so many attentive , very friendly staff .

Jomo thank for your friendly smile and looking after us personally all day , to Richard and Mdu for showing us your piece of heaven under African Sky - from a lion kill to watching elephant drinking , hippos playing , crocodiles basking to many Fish Eagles calling near by on one safari ride !
The food was extremely good and plentiful - every meal was very well presented and very tasty .
Phinda is the whole package and highly recommend not only South Africans but International guests especially - and it is not too cold in the evenings in winter which is a big bonus !
Luxury in the Bush .
We stayed at Phinda Mountain Lodge for two nights in May and it was amazing .
From the acomdation , food and game drives to the attention to detail .
The staff really go out of their way to make you feel welcome and cared for .
We had dinner in their beautiful boma on the first night as well as surprise dinner in the middle of the bush lit up between the trees with at least a 100 lanterns .
What a memorable evening .
The chalets are luxurious and spacious and has all that you need including your own splash pool that look out on to the bush below .
The outside shower and modern bathroom , slippers and gown was a special treat as well as all the Africology products .
top-notch hospitality at Phinda .
My son and I spent 4 nights at Phinda on our recent trip to South Africa .
The quality of the guiding , the food , and the lodging was excellent , as I expected from AndBeyond , having stayed at one of their properties in Botswana on an earlier trip .
The Mountain Lodge is much more of a hotel experience , so I would not recommend it if you are looking for an `` authentic '' bush experience .
While the camp is unfenced , and full of nyalas and naughty monkeys , the rooms are air conditioned with all the hotel amenities including hair dryers .
However , the rooms are gorgeous , with each having a private patio with outdoor shower and private pool ( which we did not use since it was not warm enough ) .
The food was outstanding and abundant -- no chance to go hungry at Phinda .
I also would not recommend it for elderly people -- the `` mountain '' part of the name is no joke and there is a lot of stairs and somewhat uneven terrain that might be problematic .

The game drives were excellent but I felt there was a little too much emphasis on the `` big five '' -- we spent a whole game drive looking for a leopard , who we finally spotted quite briefly in the darkness , whereas I would rather have enjoyed the bush and looked at other animals rather than concentrate so much on the big cats .
Bush deluxe .
On a 3 night stay we say the big 5 and more .
The sand forest was great but far away and better if done on a whole days trip .
Food is pretty good with a few misses but it is the bush so deal with it .
Nyalas drinking from the pool , cute warthogs everywhere .
Booze was good and included but too many cheaper brands excluded .
All in all though a great stay and well worth the experience for our family group of 10
Amazing .
We had a wonderful time at this lodge .
The rooms are big , beautiful and comfortable .
The service is very special .
Everyone is there to make your vacation perfect .
The rangers are well prepared and do everything to make you game drive the best .
Our ranger Matt Murray and the tracker Muza were perfect .
We highly recomend this lodge , specialy if you have kids .
Incredible Lodge .
Incredible Service .
We recently stayed at Phinda Mountain Lodge and were completely blown away by the experience .
From booking with Jayne to all of the staff at the lodge , the entire experience start to finish was top notch .
Having stayed at a number of high end resorts around the world , I can say without question that & Beyond exceeds them all in service and quality .
The rooms were clean , large and well appointed .
The food was excellent and the selection quite good .
Our ranger Robin and our tracker Pat were incredible , and were able to track down every animal we wanted to see .
My son especially enjoyed learning about tracking and going fishing with Robin one afternoon .
We were lucky to get to meet with members of the habitat team , and Dale and Simon impressed us with their knowledge and obvious passion for their jobs .
Each and every staff member went out of their way to make sure our needs were met and that we were happy .
We will definitely be returning to & Beyond property in the future .
Fabulous wildlife viewing !
Across a 3-wek trip , we stayed in three different & Beyond lodges ; a hotel in Cape Town ; and a different lodge in Victoria Falls .
Like all other & Beyond properties , Phinda Mountain Lodge was beautiful and the service was excellent .
It was a slightly bigger property than others , with I believe 22 suites .
We had 2 suites for our family of 4 .

The family suite was not available when we booked , but we were a little disappointed not to be given two rooms that were adjacent - there were a couple of suites that shared a wall which would have made staying with children easier .
Although they set up one room for our kids ( ages 9 & 12 ) and another for us , the rooms were 25+ meters apart and it is not safe to walk between them at night .
As a result , we did not feel safe leaving the girls on their own in a separate room .
If we had had adjacent rooms , where we could hear them across the balcony , we had have felt fine letting them sleep in one while we slept in the other .
But this is a small thing .
The food was very good ; a dinner in their boma one night and out in another clearing another night .
There was a kids menu available and plentiful snacks .

When our younger daughter struggled the first morning of a drive to make it until 10 AM without more than a few sips of cocoa and a small biscuit , the next mornings there were godie bags in the vehicle with juice , water , fruit , and more biscuits .
Phinda had the most amazing wildlife viewing of all of our stops .

We saw adult and juvenile lions ; adult and juvenile cheetahs ( one mother with 7 month old cub and another with 2 month old cubs ) ; zebra ; elephant ; bison ; impala ; kudu ; nyala ; and giraffe in abundance .
Our guide ( Richard ) asked us what we most wanted to see ( cats ! )
and worked hard to make sure we did , spending a long time tracking the cheetah mothers in particular .
We really , really appreciated the effort as we were just delighted to get to see all we wanted to see .
This was our third & Beyond lodge of our trip , and we would rate it the most family-friendly , casual , and best wildlife of the three .
Amazing experience .
Stunning rooms with plunge pools overlooking spectacular views .
Every meal was fantastic .
The safari experience exceeded my expectations by a mile - our guides , Ben and Bongani knew their stuff and gave us a once-in-a-lifetime experience .
Awesome Reserve and Lodge with Average Service .
Stayed for three nights recently .
Phinda reserve is an incredible location with views to die for .
AndBeyond is doing a great job at restoring the reserve to a true animal paradise .
The lodge is very nice and blends into the mountain .
The service lacks attention to detail compared to other AndBeyond property .
We experienced some neat dinners and breaks but when it counted the service just did not go the extra mile .
The lodge was crowded so maybe they were over burdened felt more like a number than a guest .
Asked to speak with the General Manager and was told he was on property but too busy .
Lodge can be great just needs to be managed better .
The game drives are very nice as there are multiple different habitats to see and explore looking for the animals .
Definitely will use AndBeyond again in a different lodge .
The Travel Agent Cathrine Mcluckie was extremely knowledgeable and a pleasure to work with .
Definitely would recommend her to anyone seeking a safari experience .
The most beautiful .
When I arrived at Phinda mountain lodge .
I did not know that it would be so amazing .
The staff there were the most friendly staff I have ever seen in my life .
The scenery was beautiful .
The wildlife was plentiful .
It was definitely one of the best places I have ever been to in my life
Fantastic safari experience .
The lodge itself is of a high standard in terms of service , amenities and how the rooms are appointed .
Little special things like arriving back in your room after dinner , finding candles had been lit , the bath had been run , a tray was left with a night cap and chocolates made our stay memorable .
The surprise bush dinner was a great surprise after a long and relatively cold afternoon safari , and the morning tea surprise during the morning safari was wonderful .
Spending 1 .
5 hours amongst a pride of lions who were totally relaxed with us there , was the absolute highlight .
The butler service is good but can be a bit overwhelming at times .
Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and answered all our questions with great patience !
amazing safari .
lovely location , welcome friendly , however our room was not ready so we had a glass of wine and went straight to lunch , which was superb Mediterranean spread .
room was adequate , it was a family room ( 4 ) with a door leading to another room , splash pool without great privacy .
game drives were fantastic with Robin , a true champion of the jungle , he does his utmost and more to get you close to all the action , if you going there ask for him to be your ranger .
dinner choice , superb venison or chicken , chicken , polenta and risotto needs fine tuning .
salads and fresh veg was lovely , no fish option .
overall a wonderful stay with service being superb , food was good and game drives being the highlight .
andBeyond Beyond My Expectations !
The Phinda Mountain Lodge , it is staff as well as the trackers and rangers were all absolutely awesome .
I did not quite know what to expect but they totally exceeded any dreams I had .
Everyone looked to make this experience the journey of a lifetime for me and my group , and it certainly was .
From the terrific food to the hospitality to the thoughtfulness of every gesture to seeing the Big 5 - it is an absolutely incredible experienced !
Fabulous Safari Experience .
This is a lovely lodge .
The individual rooms are very large with a spectacular bath .
There was an outdoor sitting area , shower and plunge pool .
The nyala would come and drink out of the plunge pool .
Our guide and tracker were very knowledgable and helpful .
The game viewing was outstanding .
The guide was willing to find the animals we most wanted to view .
The food was excellent .
We never ate lunc ; because after the wonderful breakfast , we were never hungry .
The service was outstanding .
large safari lodge .
Service , food , accommodation and gaming experience are all superb .
Please be aware though that this is one of the two larger lodges in & Beyond Phinda so more suited for families or business events .
If you want intimacy then go for Vlei or Rock ( my favourite ) .
Just superb ! ! !
Everything at the top .
Divan and Malusi over the top ! ! ! THANKS ! ! !
Great for large group .
Very few of the top game lodges that con accommodate a 30+ group for a corporate event .
Great service/fod/acomodation + superb game viewing .
Staff went out of their way to arrange an amazing and memorable bush dinner .
Great team building event enjoyed by all .
Phinda for Cheetahs .
Christine Ross with & Beyond helped me plan our 10 day safari for myself , son ( 11 years old ) and husband .
I highly recommend her , she responded to all my emails within 24 hours .
I was interested in doing the whale shark excursion and mentioned this to her .
I asked if we were guaranteed to see them , she was honest with me and said they would try but sightings had been low .
Needless to say because of the cost of this activity we passed .
I appreciated her honesty .
Eric and Se-bo our ranger and tracker were the highlights of this lodge for us .
My husband and I did a bush walk with Eric .
( Our son was two months shy of being 12 so he was not allowed to do this activity .
I wonder if we would have asked if he would have been able to do the walk . )
I recommend doing a bush walk since you do not get much exercise while on safari .
We were still learning from Eric on our last day .
We had the best night drive with them also .
We saw a-hipo ( dead ) , black rhino , owl , and a genet .
On our last safari we were the only jeep at a sight watching a mother cheetah and her five cubs .
The cubs were very active , so much that they were running under our jeep .
It was fun watching Eric and Se-bo get just as excited as us watching them play .
This was the only lodge where we saw cheetahs .
On our drives it was us and a family of three in our jeep .
We enjoyed being in a jeep with no roof .
We did get caught in rain a few times but Phinda supplied ponchos and blankets in the jeep for us .
Eric told us the rules at Phinda was no driving off road unles we were looking at cats .
I took 2,50 pictures on our 10 day safari .
My camera zoomed to 200 .
The rangers at all the camps get you close enough to the animals to get great full body pictures of the animals but I needed a better zoom to get only the animals face , paw , etc .
If you buy extra memory cards for your trip make sure they are compatible with your camera .
We felt at Phinda the communication was not as good compared to the previous lodges .
For example-I bought with instant pudding mix for each lodge to mix with milk so our son could mix in his malaria pills .
It was no problem at the previous lodges , but after the first night our butler came out and apologized that the rest had been thrown out .
Second we did the village tour and did not know what time to meet for this activity or what time we should be ready to depart for the airport the last day .
The previous lodges put a note on our pillow to let us know this information .
Lastly-I mentioned several times when we did the village tour I wanted to visit a school .
We got in the van and mentioned this to the driver and he told us he was never notified about this .
Phinda was advertised as a kid friendly lodge .
It was nice that every evening our son received a short story on his pillow about an animal .
One being titled Why the Giraffe has a long neck .
( An East African Story ) I felt the other lodges were more kid friendly .
There was a big corporate event ( all adults ) going on while we were here .
Maybe they were more focused on this group .
I am not sure .
That being said I am glad we stayed at Phinda the landscape was different than the previous lodges and we did get to see the cheetahs , but I do not think we would return .
Phinda lodge a perfect South African lodge .
we recently spent a weekend at this beautiful game lodge , two couples in our 50s .
The game was outstanding managed to see all of the big five , loved the young informative game ranger who made each safari interesting .
The sunset drive being my best .
The lodge and accommodation was superb , slept like a baby and woke to the sounds of Africa .
These lodges are absolutely private and Especially enjoyed the bath tub with the view and I can only imagine how amazing the outdoor shower must be in summer as well as the private plunge pool .
The fauna and natural habitat created a peaceful ambience that I can not wait to get back to .
With buck and warthog roaming this is truly paradise .
Personally I did not enjoy the dinners , however the rest of our party did , so perhaps my expectations where a little high on that side .
Breakfasts were superb .
The staff where attentive and nothing was too much trouble .
The lodges are quite a walk from the main centre , so perhaps request a near lodge if you are not too fit and definitely ask for a kettle as room service coffee arrives cold .
All in all an experience I will never forget .
simply amazing .
I stayed here two weeks ago with my husband on our honeymoon .
It was just amazing , the staff could not do enough for you , Elsie looked after us very well .
Our room was amazing , the bed was so comfortable and the views were outstanding .
Total luxury .
Our ranger Divan and tracker Sepo were brilliant , friendly and patient with a great knowledge of animals .
Overall had an amazing time , hope to make it back again something in the future ! !
Stunning ! !
The food was delicious , the chalets were beautiful , clean and had everything we needed .
The rangers were all friendly and so knowledgeable .
and most importantly the game drives were incredible !
I am from England and have never experienced anything like it .
I LOVED it !
Once in a lifetime visit .
I have always dreamed of going on safari and Phinda fulfilled that dream .
We stayed 5 nights with 4 game drives and saw EVERYTHING .
Lions and cheetahs feeding , baby giraffes suckling , wart hogs exiting there dens , elephant herds on the move , even baboons .
I could not imagine anything better .
Staff were incredible .
We had three different Rangers - Lucky , Jonty and Ian .
All with different skills and all incredible .
Our tracker , Josi , found us nearly everything we asked for .
And our butler , Nontun , did a great job fulfilling our every desire at meal time .
The bush dinner was particularly stunning .
Such a wonderful place .
This was our first time on safari so hard to compare but I can hardly imagine this place being topped .
Come prepared to eat .
Food was spectacular and overly abundant .
Always as good as the first time !
There are not a lot of places in the world that has everything going for it .
The staff , the atmosphere , the food , the game drives , the spa treatments .
Phinda mountain lodge is truly a example of how things should be done .
If you ever want to treat yourself .
Stop browsing and simply come here .
Attention to detail matters .

From the moment they meet you at the airport , handing you a drink and snack , to the dedication to find that elusive animal you want to see , to remembering you only have Bitter Lemon with you gin , this lodge is exceptional .
The facilities are excellent , the food outstanding .
But most of all , the staff really care .
Fantastic Experience .
On holiday with the family , we had a great time at Phinda Mountain Lodge .
We stayed there for three nights and saw all of the big five including a kill by a lioness and a kill by a cheetah .
The diversity and density of animals kept it exciting all through .
Great service from the staff at the lodge and amazing food .
Our ranger Ricky was very knowledgeable and tracker John was an excellent spotter .
In all an absolutely fantastic experience !
October visit to Phinda .
Phinda Mountain lodge is surrounded by the beautiful Phinda Game reserve .
Professional and informative game rangers , an expansive selection of game including the big five , amazing bird life , excellent customer service and food - make Phinda a pleasure to visit .
Personal one on one attention is provided to all guests from the game drives to hosting at dinners .
If you are interested in the bush and game , whilst enjoying the comfort of 5-star accommodation then this is the resort for you .
Absolutely Incredible !
Phinda should be an absolute must do for anyone that visits South Africa .
We spent 2 nights at Kirkmans and 4 nights at Phinda Mountain Lodge and the combination was perfect !
The rooms are essentially private cabins , which are spacious and cozy -- the beds are comfy with large bathrooms .
The staff is wonderful , making sure you are very well taken care of .
The food is delicious and they cater very well to vegetarians .
We were even treated to a dinner in the bush where they had this absolutely incredible setup surrounded by candles/lamps .
Our ranger , Luke , was absolutely wonderful -- we saw several sightings of cheetahs and black rhino and he even took the men of our group fishing .
I joined along to take pictures -- I think it was one of my husbands favorite memories of the trip -- catching a catfish from a waterhole with girafes/warthogs on the other side .
It was incredible .
Luke also drove us one morning to the northern area of the reserve where we saw a large male and female lion as well as a herd of elephants .
It was great !
We also spent almost an hour watching an interaction between a single male hippo trying to get back into a water hole that was invaded by another herd of larger hippos -- it was fascinating !
Nice but just not at the top .
After spending time in the Kalahari at Tswalu and at Ratrays at Mala Mala Phinda mountain camp just missed the mark .
do not get me wrong , it is very nice but not at the summit .
The camp has 25 accommodations which is a little bigger than we like .
The game was good , a lot of Rhino ( white and black ) Definitely go to Phinda if you seen other reserves in South Africa .
You will be in for a treat if you get Gordon as your ranger .
After going on over 75 game drives he ranks as one of the best .
Fantastic .
Fantastic 4 days at Phinda Mountain Lodge .
Spectaculair game drives , wonderful service , great food .
Saw cheta families , lions , leopards , white and black rhino , elephants , buffalos , .
Thanks to Luke and Muso ! Climax was the flight in a small Cesna to JoBurg .
andBeyond every expectation !
Start with the cool wet towels and drinks upon arrival .
move on to the short walk down the winding path to a private bungalow .
The accommodations are stunning .
Big king sized bed with overstuffed down pillows overlooking a seating area indoors and outdoors on a private deck .
The enormous bathroom has a separate bathtub that also sits in front of a floor to ceiling window that leads to the private plunge pool on the deck .
The view is a vista across the game reserve .
Heaven .
Phinda is so much more than stunning accommodations .
it is an experience .
The property is an enormous private game reserve with experienced rangers and trackers that will surely find the Big 5 for your adventure , regardless of your length of stay .
Our ranger was a bit over-the-top chatty , but if it is your first safari , you will learn so much about the animals and the environment .
The meals served were all delicious .
The staff seem to work overtime to ensure they are providing everything you like to eat .
There are so many choices at every meal , there is something for even the pickiest diner ( me ) .
For something outside the Kruger , andBeyond will exceed any and every expectation of your safari dream !
First class all the way .
A great 3 days of an amazing experience !
My wife and stayed for three nights at The Mountain Lodge and we were blown away by the experience on all fronts .
Kudos to the staff for creating and managing such an amazing place .

it is oure luxury , without going over the top , The game drives were outstanding , with just 6 guests in a open Land Cruiser , as well a a ranger and a spotter , both of whom were good guys , knowledgable and hard working .
We stayed in a suite that was 5-star with an outdoor plunge pool and shower , a huge bathroom with freestanding tub and two level sleping/living area .
Amenities aside , what makes Phinda unique is that staff who clearly care about what they do , as well as strong belief in practicing the wildlife .
Did we see the Big 5 ?
Yes , but I would suggest that greatest thing was just being there .
Phinda does SA wild life tourism proud # animalsrule .

On arrival , from our car being whisked away by a personal valet service to fresh wet towels in the Zululand heat an iced drink and luggage arriving at our room promptly , we felt like long awaited guests and the staff were always willing to meet a requestSpecial kudos to our private ranger Wesel for meeting a special health need on game drives at very short notice , as he said here a boer mak a plan .
Wesel and Sifiso ( spotter ) made an excellent team on the drives , taking us off road and tracking all the big 5 within our first few game drives .
Their knowledge on birds and wildlife was commendable from the tiniest blue legged centipede , white collared sparrows to all the big 5 .
Every game drive was an adventure with them .
Meals were generally buffet style , selective and not overly abundant with a stylish African flair to them .

Our only caution would be to not expect too much from your `` private butler '' , and to double check any special requests made at the time of booking , for some reason JHB coms with the resorts seems to have some gaps .
For the local South African tourist ask how to benefit from their special rates .
The Cheetah rehab centre nearby is also a must for cat lovers .
Generally highly recommended !
Will be back K & D CapeTown
We went at Christmas and it was the first time we were convinved that heaven had come to earth .
This was our second andBeyond experience .
We had been at Ngala last year and had loved our stay so much that we wanted to return .
We were a litle bit afraid that the second time would not be able to keep up with the first experience but were proven to be wrong .
We had heaven on earth .
We loved the secenery , the lodge , the activities at the lodge and especially all the animal viewings .
Our son had wished to see more chetas and we did .
We saw them each time we went out .
The biggest thanks goes to our ranger Jeni which we imported from Ngala .
She organised all these special kids experiences for us that we will never forget , When we left this time , it was not only my 7 year old who was crying .
We had all tears in our eyes , except for my husband who did not dare to cry .
Phinda means the return .
and we will for sure return .
HEAVEN ON EARTH .
This was my second visit to Phinda Mountain Lodge .
The first time my darling husband took me there for my 70th birthday .
He passed away in 2013 and Christmas has never been the same since , so my daughter and I decided to spend Christmas at Phinda .
I loved it the first time and this return visit was just as magical as the first time .
The staff from the cleaners , kitchen staff , rangers etc .
go out of their way to make your stay perfect .
A very special place .
A DREAM THAT BECOMES REALITY .
Everything about this visit was perfect .
The people , the view , the dinner .
Everyday you fall into a new surprise that they have arranged for you .
A bq in the bush .
A private dinner in our lodge .
No more words than : A DREAM LOCATION !
Memories for a lifetime .
My husband , teen daughter , and I went on our first safari end of December and first of January .
And Beyond planned our entire trip that included 2 nights at Phinda Mountain Lodge , 3 nights at Phinda Forest Lodge , and 5 nights in Cape Town .
After 2 weeks , we did not want to leave , and my husband and daughter did not even want to leave Phinda to go to Cape Town .
We created memories for a lifetime .
Everything was perfect !
All of the staff were friendly and helpful .
Our game driver , Nic , and tracker , Menzi , were the best ! !
Not only was it fun to see the animals , but I enjoyed learning about them from Nic and learning how to track them from Menzi .
The science and skill behind what they do is fascinating !
The food was delicious and plentiful !
Our room was comfortable and beautiful .
I appreciated that at Mountain Lodge we could have adjoining rooms for the three of us .
We had 2 separate cabins at Forest Lodge .
We can not wait to go back !
Heavenly .
Every year at least once me and my girl friend travel far away from Europe and this year was South Africa , starting our journey with Phinda Mountain Lodge .
I can assure you that having traveled and stayed in good hotels worldwide , Phinda experience was so far THE BEST ONE .
It was our first safari ever and Im sure we are coming back for more because at Phinda we managed to see the BIG 5 in 3 days .

Everything about this resort was perfect and if you are planning to experience safari in an A grade location serving only the best cuisine with great rangers and excellent service then you will not go wrong with Phinda .
My sincere thanks to Desray for planning a meticulous itinerary and to our Ranger/Tracker , Sibu and Thomas , and above all the great Chef that somehow doesn ’ t go wrong with any dish .
It was truly a dream come true .
Keep up the good work , Sachin .
Truly amazing ! ! !
Totally amazing two nights spent at mountain lodge .
So luxurious and left feeling completely spoilt !
Nothing is too much for the staff and the accommodation is amazing , as is the food ! !
Game drives incredible seeing all the big 5 on our first drive !
Just wish I could have stayed longer - although it is a lot of money to go it is so worth it !
Great Wildlife .
Although staying at another reserve this one is much larger .

We only had half day here but every moment worth itBig game and get real close to the wildlifeStaf courteous and friendly always asking if everyone ok Worth a visitWent and saw the animals that were not at our game lodge and experience was amazing
Here I fell in love with Africa !

We spent 3 nights at Phinda Mountain Lodge and the days spent there were the highlights of our South Africa trip ! The accommodation is very comfortable and stylish , the rooms are spacious , great terrace and you really get the privacy they promise !

Thank you Desray for helping us organize this safari adventure , thank you Sibu ( our ranger ) and Tom ( our tracker ) for making sure we see all the animals and for making us feel safe even if lion king was 10meters away !
The views are phenomenal , the people are lovely and the food is fabulos !
You can not stop eating what Chef Neo prepares for the guests there !
I will definitely like to go back to Phinda mountain lodge and to its people !
Game viewing delight .
I ’ m giving 5 stars to both this lodge and to Vlei lodge , where my wife and I stayed for a few additional days – but for slightly different reasons .
You can read my reviews of Vlei on the other review section .
Mountain Lodge offers wonderful game viewing – and is especially convenient for groups and families .
Due to the fact that it has as many as 25 rooms ( more like giant luxury huts ) the food is served most frequently in a buffet style .
If I had a criticism of the place , this would be it .
It is slightly less personal , and less delicious , than other & Beyond lodges .
However , if you are in a group or with children , this can be a benefit as everyone can eat in their own time – and there is no waiting for service .
The rooms are all beautifully appointed , and although I understand not all rooms have the same views , ours ( room 19 ) had a beautiful view from our deck and plunge pool .
We enjoyed a relaxing afternoon in the cool water of the pool on the first day , overlooking the whole valley .
It was only after seeing how many monkeys and baboons also enjoyed our plunge pool on subsequent days that we decided to leave the water to them .
As the name suggests , Mountain Lodge is fairly mountainous .
A couple of older members of our party requested rooms close to the main lodge – but even then the walk up the hill for them was tough .
My wife and I enjoyed the little hike up and down the hill walking to and from our room , and were able to enjoy the frequent sightings of nyala and warthog – but it ’ s not for everyone .
If physical activity is a problem for you – this might not be the ideal lodge even if you have one of the closest rooms to the main lodge .
But if there is one reason to choose Mountain Lodge , it is because of the incredible Rangers and Spotters who make the stay there so thrilling .
We were fortunate enough to be assigned to Rangers Niki and Ian , along with Spotters Musa and Sipho – and they could not have been more amazing .
Niki and Ian were so knowledgeable and enthusiastic it was just a joy to go on the rides with them .
I can ’ t speak highly enough about how much we all loved the time spent on the vehicles , learning about the beautiful scenery and animals .
I would go back in a heartbeat .
they have done it again !
Well done to AndBeyond , they have again surpassed our expectations of what a great experience a Safari should be .
Mountains lodge is in a spectacular location with stunning views from both the main lodge and from the apartments , and the game drives were truly wonderful .

Our Ranger JG and spotter Betheuil < sp ? > were absolutely top notch and some of the sightings were remarkable , include one particularly memorable one of a Lioness carry a cub in her mouth ! Food is excellent and plentiful , the Boma dinner spectacular and the Bush meal a very impressive operation , as always we have come back with pounds to shed : - ) The main lodge and the rooms are well appointed , the beds extremely comfortable , but as has been said elsewhere , if you are not particularly fit , the walk to the rooms might be a bit of a challenge .
Also , worth noting is this is a family friendly lodge , so there is a fair chance you will get a kid or two on your game drives .
All in all , if there was not so much choice of where else to go , we had go back in a heartbeat .
Cats on the hunt !
This was our third andBeyond adventure and just when you think it could not get better , the team sets the bar even higher .
We stayed 3 nights at Phinda Mountain Lodge and 3 nights at Phinda Forest Lodge - completely different but both exceptional in terms of wildlife , accommodation and service .

We saw lion hunting buffalo and cheetah hunting impala ( the first a dramatic fail , the latter a heart stopping success ) , rhino-both black and white - and a myriad of other amazing wildlife big and small from elephants to dung beetles - even the elusive suni antelope made an appearance .
The andBeyond teams at both lodges were exceptional .

Our Guides at both had exceptional knowledge of the wildlife - not only the Big Five , but birds , reptiles and plants too - and everyone went out of their way to make our stay amazing and bespoke - special dietary requirements ; not a problem .
A special occasion ?
Expect something to remember .
We are already planning out next andBeyond experience .
We knew we were in safe hands from the moment we booked .
If you go anywhere else , you only have yourself to blame !
Take it from me and the others commenting here - if you want an amazing holiday that will provide a lifetime of memories - Phinda is the place to go !
Where dreams come true .
From the moment we decided to spend hour Honeymoon in South Africa and do a safari , the company & Beyond won my attention .

From the time of research on the Internet for the ideal Game Reserve for safari , public or private , the most suitable resort for the honeymoon , the orientation to align the flight schedules with the transfers and the charter flight to the Lodge , the team & Beyound always exceeded my expectations !
For honeymooners the company give a discount , where the bride pays 50 % of the fare ( see rules for that ) , besides , the treatment of all crew always make you feel really special !
The Phinda Mountain Lodge has a private airfield for charter flights or you can go by land if you prefer .
The Lodge is in a mountainside with a beautiful view of the African Savannah .

The day to day at the lodge starts 5:30 at single day with a quick coffee and the first game , where for three hours in a special Land Cruiser one tracker and one ranger drive crazily ( in a good way ) looking for the big five !
After that everybody returns to the lodge for a real coffee , with all cold stuff you can imagine , salad , different cheese , salmon carpacio , champagnes and beers .
From that you can relax in your room till lunch .

The room is huge with a king side bed , a living room with a small fridge plenty of drinks , bathroom with shower and bath and a stunning balcony with a small pool where you can receive a visit from monkeys flocks at any time .
In the afternoon you have the night game , more three hours driving over the savannah .
I must say that in the first day I imagine that I could not be able to do two games per day , but as the end of the first night I was completely addicted to that !
All night we had a surprise about dinner in the three nights we spend there .

At the first we had a dinner in the lodge , at the second a surprise dinner in the middle of the Savannah with all customers of the Lodges in the reserve ( there are more than one ) and at the end , a stunning private dinner by candlelights manage by our butler , yes , because each customer has a butler for himself .

Well , after all , I must say that the days we spent in Phinda Mountain Lodge was the most incredible time of our lives , thank you & Beyond , thank you all time , Zodwa ( our butler ) , Tom ( our tracker ) and Sibu ( our ranger and guide ) you make the difference !
Hope we can come back one day ! !
Greetings from Brazil !
Amazing family experience .
My family was so sad to leave Phinda .
What an amazing experience ! Staf- super friendly and helpful .
Great with kids .
Fun and knowledgable tracker and guide on our safari treks .
There was even a designated child activity planner .
My daughter loved making a bow and arrow in the arts and crafts room .
They organized our transport to the airport as well .
Safari- saw the big 5 ( all in one day ! )
plus cheetahs , giraffes , nyalas , crocodiles , spitting cobra , vervet monkeys , impalas and dozens of birds .
Plus our little family of four had our own jeep with guide and tracker .
They gave us little snack bags for the kids for the day as well .
Fod- wow !
Huge portions , healthy and delicious .
They made a dinner in the bush for all the guests one night with a special birthday celebration for my son .
So sweet !
I can not recommend Phinda highly enough .
We would definitely use And beyond for our next trip .
Faultless and Truely Amazing .
This was the final leg of our anniversary trip and we could not have had a better 3 night stay than being at Mountain Lodge .
Our welcome after a long drive was great , iced drinks and towels to revive us .
We were appointed our personal waitres/butler and after having had our luggage delivered to our lodge and our car parked , we sat in the restaurant for lunch .
Amazing panoramic views over the canopy of the reserve .
We elected to go on our first Safari drive and were met by our Ranger and Jose our tracker who would look after us throughout our stay .
What an amazing first drive , we saw 2 female Cheetahs with their cubs , lots of Rhino Black & white as well as Hippos .
Surely our drives could get no better but in the coming days we also saw Bull Elephants and 2 female Lions with their cubs .
Wow !
! We were especially lucky to see a rare sighting of a young Leopard Cub sat under a bush which then strolled past us and lodged itself in a nearby tree .
We were informed by John & Jose that this was an extremely rare sighting and we were all delighted .
As a surprise on the first night the Lodge Manager Keny , together with John & Jose had prepared a suprise for our anniversary .
We headed to a water hole for sun downers , and found the area lit by lamps with an ice bucket holding a bottle of champagne .
We all tucked in and it was one of the most memorable events on our trip .
Big thanks to everyone .
We also had a surprise bush supper where all residents were treated to a lamp lit dining experience in the heart of the reserve .
Our lodge was exceedingly well furnished and faultless .
I would recommend to everyone to visit at beyond Pinda Mountain Lodge as it was an unforgettable experience .
A big thanks to Keny and all of his team .
Awesome experience !
Stayed for 3 nights at this awesome 5 Star Lodge .
This was the pinnacle of our three weeks holiday !
The management and staff are extremely professional and the suites are magnificent .
The food was delicious and well presented .
We have been on several game drives ( at various locations ) over the years but our game drives with Niki ( the Ranger ) and Musa ( the Tracker ) stand out as the best ever !
Through their enthusiasm and commitment we managed to see all of the `` Big 5 '' and so much more !
it is not about the Lodge ; it is about the game drives .
Phinda Mountain Lodge is nice .
Not exceptional as accommodation but perfectly nice .
It is hugely improved by the people who work there .
I will explain .
The rooms are perfectly lovely .
They are very large , cleaned twice a day and contain all the amenities you could need .
There are robes and slippers , mosquito repellents , fully stocked bar and sweets for snacks .
Home-made toiletries and a hair dryer , air-conditioning and usual mod-cons .
Laundry is taken daily and brought back the same or next day .
All included in the price .
You will not need much and no dressing up is required as you generally go from game drives to meals .
I was in room 22 .
Apparently , the monkeys like that room .
This was something I discovered one afternoon after the monkeys spent hours running up and down the roof and banging on the windows !
If you leave your sliding doors open , they apparently run into the rooms and steal the sweets .
I did not give them the chance .
The room had no views but other members of the group seemed to have better ones .
The main lodge has a comfortable lounge area with plenty of board games and drinks permanently available .
Everything ( except premium drinks ) is included .
There is a gift shop and IT centre with computer terminals .
You may need these as the wifi around the lodge is fairly unreliable .
I was not a great fan of the food .
The breakfast buffet was adequate .
Fruit was of a good quality and there was smoked salmon , cheese , bread .
Hot food was quite pleasant but not a huge choice and the menu remain unchanged in the 6 days we were there .
I did not have lunch but at dinner , there was generally a soup starter which was tasty but never hot enough .
The steak we had one evening was delicious but generally other dishes were at best , average .
We were allocated 2 butlers for our group , Elsie and Zodma who were both wonderful and attentive .
But our rangers and trackers were what made this a special trip .
Ian and Sihpo , Niki and Mousa could not have been more fantastic .
Niki was absolutely great with the kids and Ian was just great .
We were astounded by their enthusiasm and immense knowledge .
We never heard them answer `` I do not know '' to any question although some of the bird names were suspect !
I have no idea how they see some of the animals .
One night , Sihpo spotted a leopard stalking some impalas and even with his torch shining on the animal , we could not see it until it moved .
It was a pleasure to spend time with them and they treated us all with patience and humour .
The game drives are the reason you are staying in the Lodge so if it is acceptable too , that is a bonus .
Phinda is better than acceptable but the rangers and trackers make it fabulous .
Beyond Expectations .
Phinda Mountain Lodge is exquisite .
From the moment we were greeted by Regie and his staff our two nights at Phinda Mountain were magical .
The self contained suite was luxuriously appointed and boasted its own deck and private plunge pool .
The food was delicious and plentiful .
Niki ( our ranger ) and Musa ( our tracker ) gave us an exhilarating experience .
The animals were amazing and we managed to see four out of the big five at quite close range .
Niki arranged special treats for us : sunrise on the mountain top enjoying the ultimate African vista and a champagne breakfast beside a waterhole .
We were thoroughly spoilt and so pleased that we chose Phinda Mountain as part of our African experience .
The perfect family holiday .
My family and I ( 2 children aged 8 and 10 ) stayed at the Phinda Mountain Lodge for 2 days at the end of March and had a most amazing end to our South African holiday .
We took 2 game drives per day ( 4 in total ) and saw countless animals including Rhinos , Lions , Elephants , Cheetah and Leopards .
The park felt empty ( rarely saw other vehicles ) except for the abundant wildlife and nature .
Our ranger and tracker were both outstanding ! We took 2 rooms , each of which felt like their own private retreat with views of nothing but the hills and bush .
The rooms were incredibly well done and blended perfectly into the settings .
Kids loved the plunge pools and watching Nyala and Monkeys playing in the back yard .
Food , service , views and overall experience were among the best holiday experiences of my life - a huge credit to the & Beyond team for all of there efforts .
It was our first time in Phinda but unlikely to be our last .
Family holidays .
First experience with my family ( one children aged 8 months ) .
Everything went smoothly for all the stay at Phinda , it was really great .
The staff was very concern with our daughter and we left with wonderful family safari experiences and memories .
Amazing .
Stayed here with family in April .
2nd Safari in South Africa .
They are not cheap but you get what you pay for .
This place is magical and rooms and service were exceptional .
It is fully inclusive but guarantee you will be in bed by 9sh as the days are so long and good you will not want to miss a thing .
The lodges were very comfortable and beds nice and soft .
Food was varied and of good quality .
Our guide was a guy called Lucky and he certainly was .
We saw all the big 5 and the highlight was the leopards , cheetahs , and lions .
Unlike last safari these guys go off road into the bush which was great .
I highly recommend this place and it was so well organised from start to finish .
I had a fantastic time here and I highly recommend this awesome experience .
All of the staff were a delight .
These people do an amazing job ! !
Met some great people and of course saw the majestic animals !
Thank you for making my stay so great .
I felt right at home .
Loved this place .
We had 5 nights at Phinda and from the moment we arrived we were so well looked after .
We had lunch as soon as we arrived and met the lovely Anayda who looked after us for the duration of our stay .
She always had a smile on her face and went out of her way to help us .
We then met for our first safari and were met by Niki Muller who was our Ranger for the duration , and Musa our tracker .

Both are a credit to Phinda andbeyond , they kept us entertained for 10 game drives , Niki is so knowledgeable about the area and if there was something he did not know ( which was rare ) he would make a note and tell us in the evening .
They were both a huge amount of fun and recounted many stories of their experiences .
They engaged my son Sam who is 15 years old , and Niki even played monopoly with him in the evening .
It was also great when they joined us for dinner or breakfast .
We saw everything we wanted to see , and just enjoyed every trip out as there was always something new to see or hear .
The evening Niki stopped the car and turned the engine off as we gazed into the sky to see thousands upon thousands of stars was so magical .
Our rooms were lovely , very clean and tranquil , always plenty of hot water .

Selection of food available was exceptional and they catered really well for Vegetarians and fussy eaters eg ME ! I would recommend Phinda to anyone , I was very nervous of going on safari as I like my home comforts but I did not want to leave when it was time to go .
All the staff go out of their way to help you and are always cheerful .
I can not wait to go back soon .
Great game , nice location , amazing ranger , poor hosting staff .
We came here from Ulusaba so had high expectations .
Phinda game was as good , Sibu our ranger was top notch , food was excellent but hosting staff were poor .
Not friendly , no engagement , appalling attitude at checkout .
We were charged R50 for one night of baby sitting which is more than I would pay in UK !
I would not mind so much if it all went to the sitter , but I am sure there is a massive margin on that .
Also it is petty to charge me for babysitting when i am already paying £10/night .
We have stayed at many & Beyond properties but feel that the standards are not as high as they were say 6 years ago .
Still very good , but we have enjoyed Singita properties and Ulusaba more on our last 2 trips .
Phinda !
There is nothing like being in the wiles of Africa to restore your soul .
Phinda is one of our favorite get sways in the whole world .
From the moment you arrive until the moment you leave you are treated like the King of the jungle .
The comforts of the rooms are restful .
The splash pool in the privacy of your deck is a real treat un summer heat .
Food - be prepared for weight gain ! Staff top class .
& be prepared to be amazed at what you see .
A glimpse of heaven
Amazing lifetime experience .
Having taken a private chartered flight from Johannesburg , we landed on the airstrip close to the resort .
The drivers picked us up with the modified off road pick-ups and we got on our way to the mountain lodge .
Just 3 into the drive we came across the first elephant playing in a water hole under the watchful eyes of a giraffe !
the driver stopped and allowed us to enjoy the view for several minutes .
And this was just the beginning of a lifetime experience .
Once we arrived at the lodge we were escorted to our bungalows .
Simply unique and luxurious in a true to the region manner .
Every bungalow has a view into the bush and no visual access to any other bungalow or structure .
Restaurant and lounges are beautiful and the service is exceptional .
But this trip is all about seeing the animals in their natural habitat , and that you get plenty of .
Morning safari , afternoon safari with the best trackers and drivers out there make this THE most memorable experience ever .
But take with you a decent camera with a good zoom lens and binoculars .
That is the way to enjoy this unique experience .
And make sure you experience the sunset during the afternoon safari .
Is it worth the money ?
Absolutely ! Would I do it again ?
Cant wait ! Simply magical !
Amazing game , fantastic rangers , food and accommodation but some points to enhance .
We travel a lot .
It was our first experience with & Beyond and we do not regret any penny of it : the game was absolutely fantastic , we saw ALL the `` big five '' and much more .
The kids ( aged 10 and 6 ) were thrilled .
Our rangers Richard & Jomo were a great team .
The food is really good , healthy , light , fantastic .
The accommodation is very beautiful , comfortable , exactly what you expect .
BUT .
- room service is REALLY poor ( 45 minutes to get a small salad and pasta for my kids ) ; the food was served warm , without even a table set , a glass for the water .
- laundry service is included in the daily rate .
Great .
BUT they shrank 100 % of our clothes and I had to throw EVERYTHING away upon arrival in Paris .
A 6-star property MUST be able to wash clothes ( especially they were `` normal '' cotton clothes , not even silk dresses , thank God ! )
- some staff lack training : coffee would stay 2 hrs on the table after you drank it / you would wait for 15 minutes to get a cafè latte at breakfast / some were `` lazy '' .
But overall , it was a unique and fantastic experience , that we recommend .
a luxury safari , at its absolute best .
wow .
first off , the lodge .
it was BEAUTIFUL .
each room is in its own freestanding hut ( might share with one other room ) and has its own private jacuzi and own private outdoor shower .
the indoor shower , bath , bathroom , etc are all amazing .
the toiletries/amenities provided are spectacular .
everything is thought of .
theres even a fresh lemon and a knife to make a garnish for your drink ( from the very well stocked mini bar ) beds are comfy , AC is powerful , privacy is unparalleled .
the shared areas in the main lodge are equally superb , a deck to hangout on , a section with a giant fire pit , cigar and drink bar .
the food was spectacular , with each menu written out in chalk in the main courtyard before every meal .
the staff ?
well it seems like this applies to all of south africa , because everywhere i went the staff was truly , truly beyond .
now the experience .
My rangers were absolutely incredible .
we only stayed for one night , so only had two safaris .
the first , we saw : lions , giraffes , warthogs , wildebeest , zebras , white rhinos , black rhino , hippos , cheetahs , wild african dogs , antelope , impalas .
and probably more .
it was something else .
at the end of the drive , we stopped , in middle of the wilderness , with not even the slightest hint of human disturbance anywhere .
and we pulled out a bottle of champagne and some flutes , and there we were , in middle of the plains of africa , sipping champagne , watching the sunset .
no words i know of can describe it .
day two , we woke up early , and were off to see elephants .
of course , we did , and i can now say that elephants are the scariest animal out there lol .
since the safari starts so early , with only cofe/juice beforehand , we stopped at the end and set up a spread , again in the middle of the wilderness .
The most wonderful place in the entire world .
If i were planning a honeymoon , this would be hard to beat
Leker Safari .
Very large game reserve with many and diverse types of fauna and flora .

Experienced , knowledgeable game rangers and trackers that really go the extra mile to immerse you in the African wildlife experience ( special thanks to Sibu and Tom , who hosted us over 3 days and managed to track down very nearly all of the major animal species - leopard being a notable exception , though not due to lack of effort or expertise on their part ) .
The Mountain lodge has genuine luxurious units ( the private plunge pools were very welcome on hot days ) .
Meals , snacks and drinks are included in the rates and are ample .
Staff are friendly and do well to create a very special , personalised experience .
Very highly recommended for a luxury safari experience .
Unforgettable experience .
The Phinda Mountain Lodge was fantastic .
It is absolutely worth the splurge !
Excellent service , food & amenities .
The game drives were exceptional .
All staff were friendly and the rangers and trackers are top-notch .
You will never want to leave !
Mountain Lodge and Phinda is the most magical , fantastic place I have ever visited .
The rangers , trackers and all the staff were fantastic .

And all this on top of having an amazing experience with a very protective mother elephant , witnessing two cheetahs making a kill right in front of our eyes and seeing a pride of lions and having two of their baby cubs walk right up to the side of our vehicle .
at that point I have to admit tears filled my eyes it was so emotional .
I will never ever forget my trip to Phinda and Mountain Lodge , it was truly an experience of a lifetime .
& BEYOND MEASURE - AMAZING TRIP .
SO GRATEFUL AMAZING SERVICE , FOOD , THE STAFF IS FIRST CLASS .
AMY AND MALUSI ARE ONE AMAZING TEAM .
FEELING VERY GRATEFUL .
Unforgettable trip !
Firstly , the safari is just spectacular .
The rangers accompanying us were very very friendly , helpful and knowledgable .
We travelled in a large group .
They organise two safaris per day and it is totally your moneys worth ( even though it is very expensive ! ! )
We have many many close encounters with the big 5 and fabulous photo ops .
The rangers do not rush you and help you savour every moment of those sightings .
It is a trip worth every moment and create unforgettable memories .
The rooms are very very luxuriously done up .
However the staff messed up the bookings and room numbers big time .
The booked our children in a room very very far away from us , even though they had rooms which could accommodate all 4 of us easily .
We had to spend a good agonising 1 .
5 hours trying to sort out the rooms , and finally we swapped with our friends , the hotel staff did NOTHING ! !
A Big Big thumbs down for this , because nobody from the management helped us .
As mobility within the resort is restricted because of wildlife threats , getting rooms next to each other for families becomes imperative .
The food was mediocre , as compared to the prices charged .
And considering they did take details of food preferences , and number of children were known , there was very limited options , especially lunch .
Dinner was at best average .
The only good meal is the gala dinner which happens on the last night of the trip .
That was absolutely wonderful !
Service for breakfast was agonisingly slow and only two persons were allocated to our party of 15 people and they kept mixing up our orders .
Overall for the large part it was an absolutely wonderful trip .
However for the prices they charge one definitely expects much better food and service .
The staff are all very well behaved but are limited in their efficiency .
This part was unexpected and disappointing .
An amazing and breathtaking place ! !
We were blessed with such amazing sightings , that made it full of life time memories and experiences ! ! !
Overall service was so personal and exceptional ! ! !
A luxurious private reserve .
The Phinda private reserve provides excellent wild life viewing in an extensive and varied landscape .
There are two game drives each day , accompanied by expert rangers , my party had memorable encounters with the famed `` big five '' and numerous other species .
The mountain lodge is spectacularly situated on a high point with fine views over the surrounding landscape .
The accommodations are luxurious .
My room was spacious with sitting area , comfortable bed , bathroom with both indoor and out door shower , well stocked mini bar , room safe , and good wifi connection .
There was a private outdoor jacuzi as well .
All the furnishings and fittings were high quality .
The staff were congenial and efficient .
The food was superb .
All in all this is an excellent place to stay if you want luxury amid the African wildlife .
PERFECT ! !
Once in a lifetime experience at the top SA resort .
Unforgettable experience !
Want to go back ! !
Wow !
This was our first safari experience and it was just incredible and we have made memories we will never forget .
Firstly , the lodge itself - the lodge has stunning views across the mountains where you can see for miles .
We stayed in room 20 which was a short walk away from the main area .
At night you do have to be accompanied by a security guard to take you back to your room but during the day it is fine to walk without security .
We had a plunge pool on deck but with it being winter , the pool was really cold so we stuck our toes in a couple of times but that was all .
The views from our lodge were spectacular and we really were surrounded by the bush and saw many animals just from our private terrace including many birds , baboons , impala , nyala , and warthogs .

The food was amazing , you have breakfast after your first game drive and there is a selection of cold buffet and also cooked options if you had prefer , the rangers omelette is certainly one to try ! !
Lunch is a buffet with many options , although we skipped lunch most days due to having a big breakfast .
The evening dinner is outside and the whole surroundings and atmosphere is amazing , this is served after your evening game drive .
A special mention to Selby who looked after us during our stay here .
The game drives - Wow ! !
We did not think we had see half what we did see but it was an unforgettable experience .
John our ranger was extremely passionate and knowlegeable and Sibu our tracker had the eyes of a hawk !
I honestly do not know how he saw half the stuff , he left us lost for words .
There were 2 game drives a day , one at 6 .
30am and one at 3pm and we were lucky enough to be there for 4 nights so had 7 game drives in total .
This meant we were fortunate to have plenty of time to spend with the animals without having to rush around to see everything and made the whole experience natural .

We saw the big five and were also lucky enough to see lion cubs , cheetah cubs and leopard cubs , along with baby giraffe , baby elephants , baby zebra and baby warthogs , of course with plenty of adult animals too .
We also saw an abundant amount of birds which was a great experience .
Sibu also managed to spot a vine snake on a bush we drove past which I am not sure how he spotted it but it was great to see !
! One day we sat with a female cheetah and her two cubs and mum went off to make a kill .

We saw her run after her prey , although we missed seeing the actual kill , we spent a while with them afterwards when they had to calm down and they started tucking into the nyala they had just killed .
Amazing to see .
On our last drive we were fortunate enough to have the first ever sighting of a leopard and her two cubs , this just topped off our whole experience here .
We are already planning our next trip here and we have only be left less than a week !
Unbelievable experience !
The level of pampering us incredible .
On the game drives we of within a few feet of cheetah , lions ( including cubs ) , rhinos and various types of antelopes .
The private bungalow with personal pool and deck overlooking the valley wad great .
Highly recommend !
Phinda Bush Escape .
Phinda is a reserve that we like to get back to at least every two years .
It has 6 camps and 4 distinct ecosystems yielding such a variety of game and different experiences .
On this visit we chose Mountain Lodge as it is truly child and family friendly , with daily activities planned for children .
We were warmly welcomed as usual by friendly but not overly effusive staff .
The rooms are spacious and luxurious and are situated far enough apart to give complete privacy .
The beds are really comfy - sleeping here is part of the plan !
Each room has its own plunge pool and there is also a large communal pool that you can swim in all year round .
The game drives were all memorable , with the partnership between game ranger and tracker yielding amazing sightings .
We were looking for very specific game and their patience and knowledge was superb !
A photographers heaven .
The reserve offers all the Big 5 and if you still want to experience relaxed Rhinos in their own habitat then this is the place to come .
Phinda is globally renowned for their Rhino conservation efforts .
The food is always too plentiful , with the menu choices mouthwatering .
The inclusive wine choice is good and some serious stuff is laid up for the oenophile .
We leave with wonderful memories and look forward to our return .
Wonderful safari .
We had a three day safari with our granddaughter .
The staff were wonderful and helpful especially Amy the guide .
She really took her under her wing .
the food and facilities were superb , they also had activities for the children The game viewing was superb even seeing cheetah chase wildebeest , I highly recommend
Great Facility & Male Lions at Night !
This was the 3rd of our 9 lodge safari tour of July 2016 ! The Mountain Lodge was pleasantly surprising .
The pictures on the web do not do it justice .
it is a lot more luxurious than the pictures you see on the web .
A special shout-out to Niki , Musa and Ayanda ! Very memorable stay and we hoped to have stayed longer .
Great staff , well prepared & tasty food ! Niki had the ladies swooning as he is very handsome .
But most of all , he is a dedicated guide who made sure we tracked and found that male lion no matter what .
We found him on our last night .
Him and his trusty tracker , Musa should be recommended for their dedication to providing us a memorable 2 days .
We will be sending some more people your way ! Thank you to Yellow Zebra Safaris for arranging this great itinerary : - )
One of the best .
Have been to many safari destinations and happy to say this is one of the special ones .
While we say the big 5 in first couple of days the big highlight were the specials in the stunning and varied terrain .

Examples of highlights : successfully tracking Narina Trogon through a forest , spotting the scarce suni , bush pig , tonga red squirrel , and a shrew all on one evening drive , photographing a palm nut vulture and range of local specialities .
We were superbly looked after by Ben and Bongani ( many thanks , v special ) , and are pleased to say there is also an effective management team .
Beautiful .
we had a great time .
love to go back .
exelent .
all the way from belfast .
What an amazing experience we had last year September the staff were all super friendly and helpful and made you feel at home .

On the 14 September 2015 Derick Senekal proposed to me at Phinda Mountain Lodge
Superb animal viewing and exceptional staff .
There are many safaris to choose from—but for me , the best choice was andBeyond Phinda Mountain Lodge because of its superb animal viewing , comfortable stay and welcoming staff .
The attention to detail at Phinda was outstanding .
Each drive includes both a guide and a tracker who are exceptionally wel-trained .
Nic , our guide , could answer any of our questions—and he obviously loves his job .
The accommodations are 5-star .
The food was excellent : quality ingredients with lots of options .
The lodges are wel-designed , luxurious and showed a special attention to detail .
Thendeka , our butler , was thoughtful , kind and attentive .
The park itself is varied in its landscape and animal population , and because it ’ s relatively small , we were able to see a great diversity of animals in a short few days .
Our stay at Phinda went beyond our expectations—and was a highlight of our trip to beautiful South Africa .
Special thanks to Thendeka , Nic , Menzi , Bronwyn , Sade , Presence , Richard—and the elephant who visited our pool !
Beautiful location , perfect service , got to see the big 5 within 48 hours !
Responsible Eco tourism combined with impeccable service- an animal lovers dream .
Privacy at its best .
The Andbeyond properties all seem to have this in common : they support the areas ecology , community and animals .
They are amazing properties located in amazing places with service better than any Ritz I have ever stayed at .
I had the pleasure to stay at both Phinda and Ngala .
I highly recommend staying a couple of days at each as they do provide a different experience .
Phinda is set with amazing views of the mountains .
In a bush-like setting yet with amenities comparable to the best five star hotels/ loges .
The rooms are just huge with their own dipping pools and sitting areas on private decks with incredible views .
If privacy is what you are after , here it is .
Each room is a detached little house with Windows to a private viewing of the beautiful mountain side .
You could quite possibly spend all your time off just by yourself ( or with your partner ) in your little piece of paradise .
Animals such as monkeys , Impala , birds of all sorts come to your windows/deck ( sometimes even getting a drink from your pool ) The sunrises are amazing from any part of the facility .
Why I would go back-Al of the above plus : -The rangers are super knowledgable ( Luke , you have set the bar in what a ranger should be like for the rest of our trip .
Your knowledge , presentation , care , humor were all just perfectly on point .
Thank you ! )
-The endangered species we have seen and all that Phinda is doing to conserve and protect them is really impressive .
As is the fact that they are so involved in building up the community around them .
We went for the Zulu village trip and Phinda ( andbeyond ) can truly be proud of all they have accomplished .
-The variety of animals we saw was just awesome .
In 3 days we had checked off the big 5 ( plus many more ) .
-The service was impeccable .
The food was good and the attention to detail very impressive .
A couple of points : The lodge is not as well suited for families with small children .

It is very spread out and with winding paths which are not easy to navigate for elders or kids ( perfect for couples or families with older teens who are willing to stay in a separate `` little house '' within walking distance of their parents ) Overall loved it !
can not wait to go back !
Honeymooning at Phinda .
We had an amazing time at Phinda .
Jonty and John were a great guiding team .
The rooms were amazing .
The staff went above & beyond to make our honeymoon unforgettable .
It was humbling to see rhinos and cheetahs and wonderful to support their conservation and community development efforts .
Amazing oasis , game reserve .

AMAZING !

Wow .

you will forget the outside world exists for a while .
Friendly staff , the food and the safari drives .

Richard and Maz
Perfect Phinda .
We stayed here as a family in 3 rooms .

5* Safari Heaven !
Phinda is a world-class game reserve with several lodges on the reserve , but we chose Mountain Lodge for its reputation of being the best for families .
From the moment we drove in ( sighting 4 rhinos next to the road before we had reached the entrance ) , the experience did not disappoint .
The staff could not do enough to help and make your stay as comfortable as possible .
From the welcome drinks and refresher towels , to the luxurious relaxation lounge and deck , the main area of the lodge was excellent .

Our personal butler , Bongani , made sure that we had whatever we needed for mealtimes and was on hand to top up wine glasses and see to our every need at breakfast , lunch and dinner , whether in the lodge , boma or magical outdoor dining area .
Rooms were the ultimate in rustic sophistication and we loved the outside waterfall shower .
Our only disappointment was the plunge pools which looked so tempting but were freezing cold - if only they were heated !
The beds were comfortable and housekeeping was superb .
In-rom drinks and snacks were great .
The game drives were the highlight of the trip - our experienced ranger , Richard , was so knowledgeable and friendly and Jomos wonderful smile was matched only by his brilliant tracking .
How he spotted the cheetah hunting from as far away as he did , I will never know !
The little surprises on the game drives were a wonderful touch and the drinks and snacks such a treat .
Chef was as good a cook as he was charming and we loved the food - the only comment on the food is that we were constantly full !
I had have loved to have had some opportunity to exercise or walk .
As we had kids we could not do nature walks but we really needed some exercise to walk off all the incredible food and drink .
Overall , we could not recommend Phinda Mountain Lodge more highly - the game is plentiful , the terrain varied and exciting and the staff and facilities superb .
Though we were disappointed not to see our hoped-for leopard , it is a great excuse for a return trip !
great location , while safaris are average .

Amazing Service and Safari .
We spent two evenings and several game drives at Phinda .

We visited in early September for a two night stay which included a late afternon-evening game drive on day of arrival and dawn game drive followed by breakfast on day of departure for a total of four game drives .
The game drives were superb and for for the most part consisted of only our vehicle with tracker , ranger and six guests including ourselves .
Our tracker Busani with our ranger Dylon made a great team , with their knowledge , experience and passion for the environment and animals which they were more than happy to share with us .
Highlights from the game drives for me were seeing Cheetah , Lions , Elephant , Black & White Rhino , Giraffe .
Spending the time to watch and learn the animal behaviours and interactions also made for some unique experiences .
From the subtle establishment of dominance between male Nyla to Cheetah hunting Impalia , Lion cubs suckling , Lion mating .
The accommodations and hospitality at Mountain Lodge was outstanding .
Keny and the lovely team , including our butler Zodwa , took marvellous care of us throughout our stay .
Our beautiful suite felt tucked away and private with it is incredible view , veranda and plunge pool .
When adding in the location , challenges , conservation and achievements of Phinda game reserve , I considered it excellent value for money .
To avoid spoiling any surprises for future visitors , I will refrain from details of why I felt our experience exceeded expectations .
Suffice to say the team at Mountain Lodge made every effort both small and large to make it a wonderful stay I shal never forget .
Wonderful time and beyond expectations !

as its really bad .
