Very disappointing and made me I will !
This was our second safari .
The first had been to Kenya where you could not help but bump into one of the big five around every corner .
Phinda was entirely the opposite .
We did see some amazing stuff including all the big five but the weather was awful and Phinda do not provide either closed top trucks or canvas roofs .
Freezing cold and wet is simply no fun ! The lodge itself was of a good standard but the staff with the exception of Kate English lacked any warmth or interest in their clients .
They shouted across the resort when talking to each other and were generally unfriendly and noisy .
They seemed unable to grasp the concept of vegetarian food .
The first night they served us meat while out on safari and a plate of half warm vegetables with cheese when we returned .
That night I was violently sick and shaking .
The reception did not understand what a doctor was !
After 40 minutes the manager came with a few over the counter medicines .
I was not well enough to go out at all the next day .
The manager or staff did not even come to see if I was ok .
Instead , staff walked constantly past my outdoor shower , shouting into walky talkies while fixing a broken air con .
There was absolutely nowhere to find some peace !
On leaving we were given two wraped chicken rolls for breakfast ! !
These were then replaced with slices of quiche from the previous day ! There was no apology , no flowers , no good will gesture .
I hope mountain lodge gets its act together as the company that owns it does amazing work for conservation and the people of South Africa .
The only thing I could recommend is the therapist ( Kate English ) who was fantastic at her job , kind , caring and very friendly .
The experience of a lifetime !
My husband and I stayed at andBeyond Phinda Mountain Lodge for 3 nights due to our 4th wedding anniversary .
Words would not be enough to describe the time we spent there !
We came back home full of amazing memories and already planning to go back to this unique place .
The staff is fantastic !
Our ranger Clive and our tracker Pat were very friendly and also knew very much about all the species around the area , what gave us more confidence getting to see each of them .
We were very lucky , cause in our very first game drive we saw 4 of the Big 5 !
Also , we saw many animals that we wanted to , such as wild dogs ( it is pretty rare to find them ) , hyenas , hippos etc .
I had like also to highlight about our butler , Dumi .
She is very kind and sweet !
The food is incredible , the room very comfy .
Well , there is a lot to say , but I will resume in one word : outstanding !
First safari and can not wait to go back !
We went for our honeymoon and stayed in one of the mountain lodge suites .
From the moment we were picked up from the airport until the moment we left , every detail was taken care of .
The food was plentiful and amazingly delicious .
On the morning and evening game drives there was a break for drinks and snacks where we were intrduced to chocomocharulas .
Lunches and dinners were each 3 courses and there was afternoon tea if you had any room left in your stomach .
One evening we had a bush dinner in a lovely area set with lanterns lighting our tables set with white tablecloths .
A bar was available for all main wines and spirits .
Staff were all friendly and attentive .
Our waitress remembered our preferred wine choices and was ready to pour our glasses when we dined .
The safaris were well organised with guides communicating to advise where specific animals were located .
Courtesy rules ensured that only a small number of vehicles were permitted within the animals vicinity to minimise stress to the animal but also permit greater viewing opportunities for guests .
We were fortunate enough to see the big 5 within our first 36 hours but we were very lucky to do this .
Our guide Jonty was fantastic and made our experience very memorable with his knowledge and professionalism .
Highly recommend additional activities such as the wild cat experience , rhino tracking and night under the stars .
Rooms were very private , comfortable and spacious .
We stayed in 17 which was reasonably close to the main lodge area .
Paths are narrow and steep so may be difficult if you have impaired mobility .
Wonderful Lodge , fantastic experience , fun staff .
We had three nights at Mountain Lodge and loved it .
Even though we were there during one of the worst droughts they had experienced in many years , the game viewing was excellent .
Clive , our Ranger , was terrific and the relationship between all Rangers and Trackers was professional , but fun .
Our room was wonderful , the main Lodge spacious and great views over the area .
Showering outdoors whilst Vervet monkeys play in the trees and Nyala ( mid size antelope ) graze below you is very special .
Food gourmet and a good wine selection topped off our fantastic trip .
We were all sad to leave .
Another one of andBeyonds superb Lodges .
Probably one of the nicest places on earth , wonderful people and amazing gamedriving
Thanda or Phinda ?
We spent two nights each at the two safari camps - both places were most enjoyable but definitely had slightly different experiences .
The good news is that you will have a great time at either camp - accommodation , service levels etc .
are high at both .
Phinda is physically much bigger - three times the size of the area that most guests access at Thanda - with more diverse habitats .
At Thanda you are more aware of the hand of man as you regularly come across perimeter fencing or hear a main road , which is not the case at Phinda .
And Phinda has more animals in general .
so you can come across several different groups of cheetahs , for example , rather than searching for Thandas two brothers .
Phinda also has regular leopard sightings ( including whilst we were there ) whereas they seem infrequent at Thanda .
Phinda has been operating for a good deal longer and feels more mature .
Food is good at both places , but Phinda has the edge ( if you do not want to feel constantly stuffed we had suggest taking it easy on the buffet .
But Thanda certainly has its positives .
We preferred the Thanda accommodation - the bush suites at the Safari lodge were spacious and charming .
And very African : whilst the Phinda rooms at the Mountain Lodge were excellent , they did not have that uniquely African feel .
Thanda also seems to try a little bit harder .
it is privately owned ( Phinda is part of the & Beyond group that has numerous properties across three continents ) and you feel slightly more cherished .
little things like sparkling wine in the complimentary minibar ( Phinda just has still ) , glasses of Amarula waiting for you after dinner .
Lastly Thanda feels more local .
all local management , whereas Phinda has managers in from around the country it appears .
Your game driving experience will be determined largely by your guide .
in our case our guide at Thanda ( Themba - identified by other writers as being outstanding ) was really excellent , whereas our guide at Phinda , whilst very experienced , was less engaging .
But that all depends on whom you have .
Both places are recommended .
Relaxation in the bush .
I stayed here for 3 nights on my own before a visit to my parents in Umhlanga .
I have been to quite a few game lodges and they all have their own character .
Mountain lodge is relaxing , understated , excellent staff , and delicious food .
The rooms are lovely but not over the top .

The dinners were sensational , one night out under the stars , and two nights in the Boma .

Absolutely brilliant !
My husband and I were fortunate enough to spend two amazing days here .
We had previously been on a safari holiday but in the Kruger Park and had thought that was very good , - but , at Phinda it was on a whole new level .
The drives out were incredible .
We had a superb ranger called Matt and the most brilliant tracker Benuzi ( that might be spelt wrongly ! )
they made each and every one of our drives very special .
I know it is down to luck as to which animals you see but all of our experiences were incredible .

Our tracker seemed to have a sixth sense as to where to find animals and we were all astounded when he spotted a vine snake in a tree as we were driving past that the majority of us could barely see once we actually stopped and were standing right next to it - absolutley amazing .
Sundowners on the evening rides were great and I particularly enjoyed the morning Amurula coffees !
Most welcome after the early starts .
One evening we came back to find dinner was a bush supper set outdoors with wonderful food .

The last morning we were thrilled that in the middle of one of the morning drives we suddenly found ourselves stopping in a beautiful spot to enjoy champagne and croissants that had been left out ready for us - its these little touches that make Phina very special .

Keny the lodge manager was really good - he greeted us and made us feel very welcome and always took the time to talk to us and ask about our day - he never made you feel that he was just doing it to be polite - which was lovely .
The rest of the staff were always very courteousThe lodge itself was excellent with lovely food and accommodation - definitely worth a visit - we would love to return but for longer another time .
What an experience .
First time to a game reserve !

Brandt Safaris @ & beyond Phinda Mountain Lodge .

They just loved it !
Nick was a fantastic ranger who went out of his way to satisfy our family and we have never had as superb a butler as Ayanda ( and never needed one as much as this time round with kids ! ) .
The staff really stand out at Mountain !
Five amazing days at Phinda .
We travelled as a group of 10 adults and 6 children to Mountain Lodge for a 5 day stay .
From the moment we were collected at the airstrip by our wonderful guides , the experience was magic .
Our every need was catered for by the wonderful staff , the location is breathtaking and the game viewing was superb .
Our three guides , Rici , Matt and Ian and their trackers ( thanks to Siphewe , Bethtzel and Sipoh ) were amazing .
They engaged our children aged between 2 and 9 , and provided lots of amazing experiences for the grown ups as well .
We all learnt so much about the animals and the local area .
The dining experiences and opportunities for relaxing were also superb .
Our rooms were tidy and a great spot to relax with full bar amenities in each room for a relaxing G & T by the plunge pool after your mornings game drive !
A special thanks also to Bongani , Sboh and Lungi for looking after us all so well .

One of the many highlights was our bush dinner held in a dry river bed under a canopy of trees covered in lanterns and listening to locals from the Zulu community singing and performing traditional dance .
Also , thanks to Kate for the lovely massage !
We really do hope we have an opportunity to return in the future .
We will definitely seek out other andbeyond experiences when returning to Africa .
Most amazing holiday EVER !
We stayed at Phinda Mountain lodge recently for six days .
The venue the food , the staff , the organization , the animals and the overall experience was amazing !
It was a fantastic week - from the moment we were greeted by the enthusiastic and friendly staff at the airstrip to the sadness we felt as we returned to the same place six days later .
I can not recommend Phinda Mountain Lodge enough - I hope to return someday and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone considering travelling to South Africa .
Really wonderful !
We stayed at Mountain Lodge and Amy was our Ranger and Malusi was our Game Tracker .
They were both wonderful and we had fantastic viewings of elephant and cheetah which were the animals our party most wanted to see .
Our accommodation was lovely and we only wished we had more time to enjoy it as we only booked one night .
That said , definitely worthwhile and we would love to go back .
If I was asked for one thing that could be improved it would be to have less spicy food .

The idea of providing a set range of food works really well as food arrives very quickly and is beautifully presented but we found that too much of it had chilli and maybe a non-spicy option could be offered .
Otherwise really a great experience .
What a Venue .
I have never seen such well planned out rooms and fully stocked with everything you ever would need .
Had a wonderful time .
The staff is so friendly and helpful .
The accommodations were wonderful , the food wonderful , our Drive guides Lucky and Josie were terrific taking us on amazing drives .
The staff surprised me with a birthday cake , song and dance to celebrate my 70th , it was unbelievable and wonderful .
God bless them all , I hope some day I will return .
we are currently here just finishing up our last night .
Everything about this Lodge is unimaginably spectacular .

The guest accommodations are absolutely mind blowing , the views on Phinda reserve are surreal , the services and treatment you get from the staff literally make you feel like you are members of a royal family .
The food here rivals any fine dining we have had at home and abroad .
Everyone here is obviously highly trained and professional and it shows .
Our game drive partywhich included us and 2 other couples were assigned our own personal assistant for the hotel and a dedicated ranger/tracker duo for the game drives for the duration of our stay .
The overall host of the Hotel was Wiliam who deserves special mention for doing such and outstanding job at coordinating everything about our stay and making our stay so special .
Our personal assistant Sthe bent over backwards to give us everything we needed day to day and was always attentive and extremely helpful .
Huge kudos have to go to our ranger Ben and tracker Bongani !
This pair guided all of our safari game drives and I was completely blown away with how knowledgeable and expert they were at it .
They managed to bag us all of the `` Big 5 '' in 3 days which was a superhuman feat considering how hard it was to do .
The rare Black Rhino was tracked and spotted our first day !

On day 3 they got us the elusive and hard to find Leopard and in order to get it for us they had to push through bush as hard anything I have seen since my army days in armoured carriers AND they even blew out a tire which was swapped out in record time during the chase , that is the kind of effort these two men put into it .
I spoke with other guests and it looks like none of them managed what Ben and Bongani pulled off for us .
My wife said it was `` the most fun I have ever had my entire life '' .
Amazing .
we are off to Phinda Vlei lodge tomorrow morning and they are going to have a tough challenge on their hands to follow this act , that is for sure !
Our last vacation of this magnitude was the Greek islands with an extension on Santorini in an exclusive villa I never thought we had be able to top .
so far , AndBeyond have managed to surpass it
Honeymoon Adventure .
We spent 14 days in South Africa and Mozambique for our honeymoon and our time at Phinda Mountain Lodge was by far our favorite .
The accommodations were incredibly private and wel-serviced .
We spent every night with the windows open so we could enjoy the sounds of wildlife .
We arranged many of our honeymoon activities around food and the food at Phinda can not be beat .
The trackers , rangers , and other staff members were friendly and accommodating .
Money well spent !
We can not wait to come back and bring our friends and family !
African Safari luxury style went above `` andBeyond '' We had a tough time selecting the perfect setting for our 25th anniversary trip to Africa because Africa is not an inexpensive destination .
We found that many areas were incredibly high priced but only offer accommodations that looked like they were pulled out of an old dated 3 star Cuban hotel and transplanted to Africa !
We also did not want a `` Disney Africa '' experience with large crowds , busy hotels , and safaris packed full of other tourists and buses and jeeps crowding all the animal sightings .
andBeyond came to the rescue here .
Their reviews and awards speak for themselves and they deserve them .
They advertise themselves as a luxury safari experience and they certainly are a first class , 5 star experience .
Booking was fantastic thanks to our rep Fred who really went out of his way for the 12 months leading up to and planning this trip .
We were greeted as soon as we arrived at the airport by an andBeyond rep who gave us our travel documents in a classy leather folio and directed us to our private driver in a classy BMW .
If you think that is a pretty amazing first impression , it gets better .
First I will talk about the Mountain Lodge itself .
It only has 20 luxury suites which meant no crowds and lots of privacy .
All of them overlook a beautiful mountain valley and you can not even see the other suites from yours .
The suites themselves are roomy , impeccable and luxurious and each have their own private pool and deck with both an indoor and outdoor shower .

The manager Wiliam was incredibly friendly , outgoing , and helpful and you had see him every day at the main building taking his time to stop and chat with every guest every day to see how their stay was going .
The food was also 5 stars all the way .
In fact it was too much !
I got fat on this trip in 2 weeks and I am normally a slim guy .

I would easily compare it against several fine dining locations back home , which is surprising for a vacation getaway , but I guess they can pull it off easier because of the smaller number of guests .
We even got our own butler Sthe , who bent over backwards for us to meet our every indulgence .
All of the staff here were like this , you can really tell there is some intense training going on with this operation .
One of the coolest things about Phinda is that the lodges are right inside the reserve and animals can and do freely roam in between the suites .
The game drives were top-notch .
We had a ranger Ben and tracker Bongani who worked as a team and man did this pair pull through for us .
The knowledge , experience and training these guys have is intense .
Since Phinda is a private game reserve and not a national park , that means they have the ability to go of-roading to get you right up close to the animals .
The rangers would meet you at he main building and get you snacks and drinks before each game drive before getting underway .
Ben really impressed the heck out of us on the 3rd day by doing some crazy of-roading to get us a daylight look at a leopard that REALLY did not want us around .
He said at the start of the day that `` I really want to get you guys a leopard today '' and he sure did .
He even blew a tire in the middle of the chase , they changed it out with the speed of a race track pit crew and carried on .
In fact he got us all of the big 5 in 3 days , and 4 of them were done in 2 .
Bongani had an incredible eye and could spot even the smallest animals or tracks all through the day .

They also have a cool mid-drive break every game drive where they pull out a field bar with drinks and snacks , and one evening they had a surprise set up where someone had set up a lantern lit bar in the middle of the wilderness ahead of time complete with champagne on ice .
Phinda itself is breathtaking and diverse .
It occupies the size of a small province and has rolling plains , gorgeous mountain valleys and forested areas all in one game reserve .

The wildlife is abundant here and we had no trouble repeatedly spotting pretty much every species of bird , reptile , and mammal you possibly can in this part of Africa and we enjoyed being able to do so without spotting other humans all the time .
There is a ton of other activities offered besides the game drives but to be honest we were so satisfied and kept busy enough just doing the game drives we did not bother with the other excursions .
We liked it so much we even spent another 4 days at one of andBeyonds other lodges at the opposite north end of this reserve , which I will be reviewing after I post this .
Amazing game-viewing in a 5-star lodge .
We stayed at Phinda Mountain Lodge for the safari portion of a safari-and-beach holiday , and it was truly wonderful .
The lodge is beautifully designed , the rooms are private and comfortable - that bathtub !
those views !
- and the game-viewing is excellent .
Phinda Mountain Lodges chef is superb : the food is fresh , delicious and varied , and the kitchen easily accommodated our dining preferences and restrictions .
Hospitality is first-class , and though it is in a remote location , there is strong wifi - even in the guest rooms - for those who want or need to stay in touch with the outside world .
Our trip coincided with some very strange weather , including a cyclone on the day we landed in South Africa , which resulted in cooler weather and on-and-of rain for much of our 3-night stay .

This is absolutely not typical for the region at this time of year , as confirmed by both our immensely talented ranger-and tracker team , Clive and Pat , and by everyone we spoke to at Phinda ( including new friends we made at the lodge , fellow guests who have been coming to the game reserve each February since 2010 , and who had previously experienced nothing more than a passing shower ) .
So , when it rained we wore ponchos on some game-drives , and we saw fewer cats than we might have seen otherwise , though there was plenty to see , even in the rain .
including hippo , buffalo , elephant , giraffe , zebra , and so many rhino - both black and white !
- that we eventually lost count .
The only animals that we did not see were leopard and cheetah , though we did see leopard tracks in he morning after the rain had stopped .
When the sky cleared , we saw a family of lion , along with a gorgeous rainbow .
Overall , it was a terrific visit , and its easy to understand why Phinda attracts so many repeat visitors .
I was sorry to say goodbye when it was time for us to leave for our beach resort in Mozambique .
Fantastic wildlife and superb accommodation .
We stayed here for three nights as part of a six night Phinda safari .
The whole experience was superb .

The lodge is large ( 24 suites ) but doesn ’ t feel crowded , although you may have to share the open topped Landcruiser with two other couples ( usually not a problem as the other travellers are always interesting ) .

The game-spoting opportunities are extensive and you will almost certainly see the “ Big Five ” – we saw four of them on the drive to the lodge from the park gate – as well as lots of other wildlife and beautiful , varied countryside .
The food is plentiful and delicious with a wide choice of dishes .
Much thought is put into the organisation of the meals .
We had dinner one night with our ranger and fellow Landcruiser guests .
Another night there was an open-air candle lit “ brai ” .

The suite was very comfortable , quiet and private ( but take with a pinch of salt andBeyond ’ s website claim that you can lounge “ in your private plunge pool overlooking the dense green slopes ” – extensive tree growth put paid to that from our room ! )
The lodge staff are welcoming and helpful without being intrusive .
The rangers and spotters are magnificent .
Highly recommended .
Back to Nature .
What a delight to experience this place , out in the never nevers !
! Beautiful Lodge , with every convenience available .
Overall fantastic experience .
The wonders of seeing all the animals outside your windows was an experience to behold .
Loved every minute of this place !
Outstanding .

and the dinner under the stars with all the guests .

Trip of a lifetime .

Unforgettable experience - Highly Recomended !

where do I start ? The accommodation is outstanding , the rooms are great with beautiful views from your bed and even better views from your balcony & plunge pool .

so far !

Great Safari Lodge ( accommodates young children ) My wife and I stayed here for two nights with our two young children ( 7 and nearly 5 ) .
The Lodge is very nice and set on top of a little hill affording nice views from the main Lodge .
This is the largest safari lodge we have ever stayed at ( I estimate guest capacity at about 40 ) , which did mean one or two groups of 8-10 people some nights .
Most importantly the game drives , guides and trackers were outstanding .
The bedrooms are very nice and we had our own cottage with two connecting rooms and separate bathroom facilities for each bedroom .

Beyond expectations .
We decided to treat our teen children to a safari experience and are grateful to have chosen Phinda Mountain Lodge -- can it get any better than this ?
From the moment we arrived we were treated as welcome , individual guests , and left feeling we had left a community .
The atmosphere is peaceful and tranquil while at the same time welcoming for families .

) , the housekeepers and the security guards who escorted us to our rooms by torchlight at night .

Options are endless .
Yes , WiFi is available but may I deter you from using as much as possible ?
Take the time to disconnect !
DINNER : is out if this world !
The dining area is simply breathtaking and if the weather permits , you will have dinner outdoors .
All the dishes were outstanding , chicken , fish , soups , lamb .
They made my birthday special with a lovely cake and impressionable Zulu dance !
SPECIAL TOUCHES : - morning drive : stop for coffee , chocolate OR my favorite : Chocerula = Hot chocolate + cofe + Amarillo - evening drive : for my bday : champagne , chicken skewers , chips .
- bush walk with one of the Trekkers .
LODGING : Superb .
the bed , the personal plunge pool ( wish it was warm for the chilly days ) , the outside shower ( do not worry , inside shower ) , the decor - everything !
REMINDERS : - bring bug spray - one drive we were caught by the rain .
Bring waterproof jacket .
You will be supplied with a Poncho but good to be prepared .
- bring a camera to strong zoom !
Charge your camera before every drive and have enough space for lots of pics .
- lock your door ( while taking a nap , clever vervet monkeys came in to eat my residual lunch , they love cheesecake !
) - take the time to learn pleasantries in Zulu !
After all , we are visiting their precious land .
- IF you find it difficult to walk far or walk on imbalanced turfs , request a cottage close to the living area .
SPECIAL shout-out and deep THANKS to : -Prescence , Wiliam and Sade for making me feel welcome .

- Lucky ( daily Driver ) and Josi ( daily Trekker ) - All the staff ( wait staff , cooks , housekeeping , evening security ) SUGGESTION for Lodge : make tea machines available in room ( felt horrible asking for a tea in the middle of the night ) do not listen to travel agents when they say , `` Safari in Durban ? !
Why would you go to Durban ? ! ''
GO ! !

SOLO TRAVELER BEWARE .
of the +50 % up charge for traveling solo !
Yes , there will be +50 % added to the `` per person rate '' since rooms are based on double occupancy .
Unles you are on a special tour or the property has loosened their solo rates .
For example , Abercrombie Travel had a special first week of Sept `` no solo supplement charge '' .

We stayed 3 nights at Mountain Lodge , the lodge is beautiful and the rooms are great , they have a small outdoor plunge pool to cool off and great views over the bush , all the meals were excellent and we also had a surprise dinner in the bush that was excellent .

Almost Perfect .
This was our third safari with andBeyond and our fourth andBeyond lodge .
We love traveling with andBeyond and always feel well taken care of .
Mountain lodge was no exception , but I must admit it was not my favorite andBeyond lodge .
I prefer smaller lodge and I love the `` luxury tent '' atmosphere .
Mountain Lodge is larger and family-oriented so there are children here .
And we had a few minor glitches I will explain below .
But the wildlife was amazing .
LODGE/ROMS : It has a beautiful location at the top of a ridge with a beautiful view .
The suites are beautiful with luxurious bathrooms and a private plunge pool and deck .
The cottage rooms do not have a mountain view and are not as private .
However , the grounds of the lodge are a bit difficult to get around and I did not think the common areas are as well laid out or as beautiful as other andBeyond lodges .
And they were a bit cramped for the size of the lodge .
FOOD : In my opinion , the food was not as good at Mountain Lodge as it is at other lodges .
We loved the food at Forest Lodge .
Here it was mediocre .
We are not `` foodies '' so that did not bother us too much .
One other minor thing : the day we arrived they surprised us with a lantern-lit dinner in the bush .
Very nice buffet .
However , we stayed 4 nights and on the 4th night they again had a surprise '' dinner in the bush .
it is fun to eat in the bush , however , the menu was exactly the same as the bush dinner the first night .
I think most guests only stay 3 nights so this does not happen to everyone .
But we would have appreciated a different menu the second time .
SERVICE : The waiters/butlers here seemed to be either new or very shy .
Our butler/waitres was always hesitant about approaching our table and then spoke so softly we could barely hear her .
At one buffet , the chef and two butlers were standing nearby as we were trying to figure out what certain dishes were .
I noticed the chef actually shoved one of the girls forward to encourage her to come tell us what was on the buffet .
Also , a mistake was made in our rooms .
We were traveling with my sisters family .
My sister and her husband were to have a cottage room with their single daughter in a connecting room .
My husband and I were to have a suite .
We arrived after dark ( after our game drive ) and were exhausted .
We were shown to our rooms and I realized we had a cottage room and my sister had our suite .
The single daughter was not connected to any of us .
I called management and they were apologetic and she said she thought it seemed strange .
So why did not she ask us ?
Anyway , it was late and we told her we would switch rooms the next day .
But that meant we spent one of our four nights in a cottage room rather than the suite we had paid for .
But my sister enjoyed it !
Also , the cottage rooms have sliding glass doors .
My sister and niece were not given keys to lock the doors when they left .
Well , the monkeys know how to slide the doors open .
Upon our return from our first morning game drive , they came back to monkeys all over their front porch eating candy and gum that they had `` stolen '' out of their rooms .
Thankfully , candy is all the monkeys got , but that could have been a real mess !
They were then given keys to lock their doors -- why were not they given keys in the first place to avoid this problem ? WILDLIFE : This is the reason to go to Mountain Lodge .
The wildlife sightings were amazing !
Our ranger , Brendan , and tracker , Bethuel , were fun , knowledgeable and always ready to leave early if we wanted ( we did ) and do extra '' stuff .
Our ranger/tracker met us at the airstrip around 4:0 p. m. and we immediately left on our first game drive .
We started with sightings of cheetah and a male lion .
It only got better from there .
Although we had to search for the cape buffalo one evening , we saw many of the big cats .
One drive we saw 4 of the Big 5 in one hour !
Our most amazing experience was finding a leopard at the top of a tree `` hiding '' from a male lion below .
When the male lion discovered the leopard , we watched as he tried to climb the tree after the leopard , roaring the whole time with the leopard `` hissing '' down at him .
Quite exciting !
We thorougly enjoyed the wildlife here .
The jeeps are comfortable and they provide blankets and hot water bottles when it is cool .
SUMMARY : So , all in all the Mountain Lodge is a beautiful lodge with abundant and amazing wildlife sightings .
Remember they cater to families .
If you would prefer a smaller lodge without children or if the quality of food is important to you , you should try a different andBeyond lodge .
It is really a matter of personal preference .

you are truly top-rate .

Amazing Stay - Highlight of Our South African Vacation .
My husband and I stayed at Phinda Mountain Lodge for 2 nights / 3 days as part of a Crystal Cruise shore excursion .
We were transported from Richards Bay from the port , taking roughly 2 hours .
This was our first time at a safari and I thought everything was terrific .
When we arrived , we were warmly greeted by the staff and had our own butlers who took care of us the entire time .
Our room was spacious , beautiful and comfortable .
Pictures on the website felt accurate .
If you are limited on packing , bug spray is in the room as well as complimentary same day laundry service ( if picked up by 8:0AM ) .
I found the A/C to work perfectly and the bed to be very comfortable .
Food is so widely available ( breakfast , lunch , dinner , pre- and post- game drive snacks as well as mid game drive ) that there is absolutely no way you would ever go hungry during your stay .
The staff additionally goes well beyond and out of the way to also accommodate for any dietary restriction .
My small complaint is that I really wanted to eat more local food and found the meals to be more Western style ( i. e. , I doubt smoked salmon would be widely eaten by locals ) .
However , what was offered was very good , given the remote location .
I thoroughly enjoyed the game drives and did not learn until we got there that private game reserves are the way to go ( compared to national parks , such as Kruger ) .
For starters , the 4x4 can go off the main roads if something interesting is spotted and nobody from the outside is allowed inside the reserve , making the experience much more private .
I also liked that the safari guides are frequently communicating with each other , so if one vehicle does spot something fantastic , the other vehicles are not far behind to share the experience .
Of note , the most we ever saw were maybe 3 other vehicles with us when something was spotted .
Otherwise , we were just on our own majority of the time .
If I were to plan this on my own , I would spend 3-4 nights here , instead of two .
The ocean is somewhat close by and it would have been great to spend one of the days scuba diving .
I really enjoyed the stay and highly recommend this lodge !

Stayed 2 nights which was enough for us as we saw all the Big 5 during the 4 drives we took .
The lodges are scattered along the hillside and have private plunge pools which were perfect for a dip in the hot summer sun .
Staff were well trained .
Food was really good .

On our first night we were treated to a dinner in the bush .
The whole experience pushed me totally out of my comfort zone but we thoroughly enjoyed it .
It was just spectacular .
Our Ranger and Tracker were great .
Personable , professional , enthusiastic and obviously loved what they did .
Morning drive was at 530 and was imo the nicer of the two timelines .
We usually got back to the Lodge around 1030 am .
Evening drives were from 4 pm and I feel ( and this was the consensus of others on the drive ) that was way too long .
I do feel that once the sun set it was not necessary to continue until 8/830 .
After sundowners it would have been perfect if we were returned to the Lodge as it was just not very comfortable out in the dark for that extra couple hours .
There were not that many nocturnal animals to view and with no ablution facilities it was just torture lol for us ladies .
We could not enjoy the sunset or mid morning stop as we knew it would still be a couple more hours before we could use a bathroom .
While this may be TMI , I wish others who felt this way would say so or that people had mentioned it in their reviews as we were not prepared for such a long drive with no facilities .
Alternatively if this is what makes the program work , then maybe a few jeeps should be allowed to make pitstops at the other lodges in the reserve at the halfway point of each drive .
It would certainly make for a way more pleasant experience .
However now having this knowledge with my next safari , I will be sure to factor this in before booking or book a private jeep .
I do not mean tobelabour the point but it is my one complaint .
The experience however was awesome we saw many Cheetahs , were fortunate to see a pride of lions on the move , elephants , zebras , rhino , two giraffes fighting .
It was a truly magical experience and one we highly recommend .

The accommodation was great too and slept so good .
Being able to lie back in our private pool and see wild life go past was amazing , we saw wild hogs , monkeys going past .
If you want an amazing time you should definitely consider this .
First class safari experience .
From start to finish this was an excellent experience .
We stayed three nights and went on 6 drives giving us plenty of variety in terms of terrain visited and animals seen .
Our guides , James and Menzi , made a great team , driving safely , providing useful facts without flooding us with details and spotting animals from a great distance .
Their obvious enjoyment of their work and enthusiasm for the fauna and flora was infectious and we thoroughly enjoyed each drive .
Our chalets were immaculately clean and spacious and just a minutes walk from the central area .
There are no fences so it is common to see animals wander past windows and along paths .
Meals were well prepared with extensive choice and excellent and attentive service .
We can not wait to go back .
Experiencia inolvidable !
Awesome !
This is one of the best game lodges- hands down .
Excellent staff , always willing to assist , and doing it with a smile .
Fantastic , knowledgeable trackers and rangers that ensured some of the best game drives Delishes food ( in abundance ) in the greatest setting : nature .
& beyond Mountain and Forest Lodge you rock !
WOW .
Absolutely amazing !
My wife and I stayed here last week and loved every single minute of it .
What made our game drives so special was our ranger - Dewald , his enthusiasm and passion was so inspiring and he is a credit to & Beyond .
Our suite was absolutely stunning with a private sun deck and plunge pool .
Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and the food was fantastic .
I would highly recommend Phinda game reserve to anyone thinking of going on safari , I very much doubt it could be beaten .
Spectacular .
My wife & I spent four nights at Mountain Lodge and had a tremendous experience .
The vastness of Phinda offers several different habitats to search for a variety of wildlife species .
Our ranger , Clive and tracker , Pat did an incredible job in finding the animals we were most interested in seeing .
The lodge itself is beautiful and the food was fantastic .
The only drawback to Mountain is due to the larger number of visitors they have at one time , you don ’ t get the personalized service that I ’ ve experienced at other & Beyond lodges .
However , with a private vehicle ( which I highly recommend ) you can tailor each drive to your individual desires .
Amazing place run by amazing people .
Absolutely loved everything about our 3 days here .
We had the best ranger - Dewald who was so passionate about everything and what he does and made sure we had the best experience we could .
His guide was also fantastic and on our first game drive we saw leopards including cubs , lions , elephants and much more .
Every using was an amazing experience and it was made more special by Dewald and Jumo the guide and we can not thank them enough for what they did for us .
Te food was fantastic too with outdoor dining every night including one night in the bush .
The room was fabulous and everything well stocked and they had bring you anything you asked for .
If you ware considering going to Phinda do not hesitate and book it now .
Went for a wedding reception and it was magical .
Glorious view of the reserve and a spacious area in which to host the reception .
The game rangers and everyone else behind the scenes were informative and helpful the whole weekend long and were happy to help out with a smile .
5stars !
This place is magical .
We visited three lodges on safari and after much research we landed on Phinda mountain lodge as a first stop .
We flew in from Kruger International Airport via small plane .
This was fun and made going there special .
Our guide , Dewald met us at the air strip and took us to the lodge .
I could write a whole review on how good Dewald is with his tracker Jomo .
I would just say ask for them ! ! !
Dewald has a degree in zoology so there is no much he doesn ’ t know .
He made the trip spectacular ! !
Anyway , back to the lodge .
Beautiful and romantic , it sits in a hill with great views .
Staff is out of this world .
Five star or better .
Food is also great and better than any high end restaurants in the states .
In fact , they fed us so much we actually skipped some meals .
The environment was quite relaxing and peaceful .
As for the game drives , we did see the big 5+ a lot more .
The terrain and wildlife are quite diverse and the staff do a good job of locating animals .
The game drives are in the morning and afternoon and each one offered a unique experience .
We left there happy and content of the great sightings .
A sidenote my kids and I did take a day and went scuba diving .
This was a great experience the bay is quite unique .
The dive was somewhat more difficult than expected due to the shifting currents and large waves .
The reef is quite beautiful with an abundance of wildlife .
If you are into diving I would highly recommend adding this to your trip .
Phinda provided everything from transfer there , a beach gourmet lunch with a tent , chairs , and towels .
The scuba operators were top notch and very professional .
Their equipment was also excellent and they were very safe .
I ’ l have to say I am fairly new at safaris as I ’ ve only been to three separate lodges .
I would say the experience at Phinda will be hard to beat .
This place is five Star all the way .
We met a lot of people who were very experienced at Safari and they agreed with us on the excellent quality of Phinda .
I can honestly say that you won ’ t be disappointed if you spend time at Phinda .
( Dewald , ask for him ! ! )
Leave Now for Phinda !
You won ’ t regret it !
I don ’ t even know where to begin , we loved our 3 nights there so much !
We had great game viewing but I think why we immediately fell in love with Phinda Mt .
was our guide Amy and tracker Malusi .
I ’ m sure all & Beyond guides and trackers are great but Amy was fabulous .
Her knowledge and enthusiasm were infectious and we fell in love with Phinda and Africa .
We stayed at 2 lodges , Phinda Mt .
and then Ngala , next to Kruger .
They complimented each other very well .
It did take us a day to appreciate Ngala after enjoying Phinda so much .
A few things to help other travelers : & Beyond lodges do have pretty much everything I needed for toiletries , including conditioner and shower caps , except toothpaste and deodorant , haha .
We didn ’ t use any bug spray and I don ’ t think we got one bite ( mid May ) and they have bug spray if you need it I think .
I could have lightened my luggage without it !
Take shooting glasses or clear safety glasses of some type if you don ’ t wear glasses .

You get going pretty fast sometimes on a game drive and coming back at night when we were driving faster to get to the lodge especially at Ngala , they would be helpful because of bushes and bugs and even the wind in your eyes .
We didn ’ t carry much on the game drives .
Our cameras , lens cleaners , Kleenex , lip balm , hat and sun glasses .
They provided water and probably had sunscreen etc if we needed .
Never used the mono pods we took .
Would be helpful to stabilize but weren ’ t worth the hassle so they stayed in our duffles .
We are big photographers but used the land cruiser to stabilize and that worked .
At most we had six people in the vehicle which was great .
They will do everything possible to get you on as many game drives as possible including driving you out to join one if you arrive late .
Amy knew exactly how to position us for best views and photos .
What she also was great at was thinking ahead to where the animal was going to go .
I think she was right 100 % of the time and it put us in even better positions .
I had read about how quiet we had to be , some articles talked about not having velcro or zippers for pockets etc .
- that was not an issue .
A couple times we were really quiet but most of the time the animals ignored us and we were relatively quiet but not ridiculously so .
Also I had read don ’ t wear leggings because you need all these pockets .
My jacket pockets were enough , and while I loved my pants , I could have gotten by with the leggings as long as it didn ’ t get hot which it didn ’ t .
You do want some way to attach your hat , again for when you are on the hunt - following an animal that ’ s on the move .
And as everyone tells you , do layer .
I used the cuff I had gotten for around my neck , I was glad we had gloves , a scarf , and I ’ d gotten my husband a beanie and he wore it a lot early mornings and at night .
I think he would have worn a scarf if he had one .
Then it warms up and you shed stuff .
We used the duffles they recommend , and I got the e-bags online and really recommend .
It makes packing and unpacking and staying organized a breeze .
As mentioned they do your wash and are quick about it .
We also liked Phinda Mt .
because a number of the other visitors were from Durban or Joburg , just up for a night or two .
It was fun to learn more about Africa from them .
It was not crowded at all when we were there .
In fact Ngala was much busier .
As far as tips , I carried around a lot of Rand that I got before we left the USA , and then found out we could have used credit card and it immediately goes into their account .
I would recommend doing that to avoid worrying about carrying so much money .
For the one that I did use cc , I wrote a note to him so he knew what to expect .
While I was aware of tip recommendations , silly me , I did not realize how it worked .
When you arrive at the lodge , the staff that will be your personal staff meet you .
Take note of their names and get to know them !

Then when you leave , just before you get in the vehicle , the staff that took care of you are there and you can give them the tips in envelopes ( provided by & Beyond -ask if you don ’ t see any envelopes ) .
It is all so easy .
& Beyond Staff will do whatever they can to make you comfortable and take care of whatever your issue .
They have a nice little gift shop , not many toiletries , but prices for souvenirs and T-shirt ’ s etc .
are really reasonable .

Cape Town has the best shopping if that ’ s important to you , but we visited that area first and headed to Vic Falls after the lodges ( and we were really glad we did it that way ) but prices and selection wasn ’ t as good in Zimbabwe as at the & Beyond shops or Cape Town .
AndBeyond put together our whole trip and I really recommend them .
I don ’ t normally use a travel agent or have a trip completely planned but I am so glad we did on this one .
I miss Phinda Mt .
so much .
I wish we could go back but it is not likely .
Go on every drive you can and go with And Beyond !
Amazing Scenery and of course the animals !
Phinda Mountain Lodge was the last stop on my 14 day safari adventure .
The game reserve was beautiful .
Beautiful rolling hills , watering holes , grassy plains and bush terrain - so many different types of terrain .
It was so interesting to see the animals in all these different types of terrain .
My guide Nick was great .
New the best places for really taking in the scenery and was relentless tracking lions !
I saw black and white rhinos , giraffes , zebras , leopard , lions , cheetah .
only one elephant but I came mainly for black rhino and the cheetah so all good .
The room was beautiful .
One complaint was the generator .

or whatever that they used for the plunge pool was really loud - so when I was sitting out on the deck it drowned out the birds and the sounds of the bush - which is a big reason why you come - to soak up the sites , sounds and smell - or I do .
They turned off the generator when I asked but I do assume it served some purpose .
I did not use the plunge pool .
I do have to say after the previous places I stayed which were much smaller - that the service at Mountain Lodge did not measure up .
My phone in the room stopped working - you need your phone to call someone to pick you up from your room when it is dark .
I had to walk in the dark to dinner without an escort .
I mentioned the issue with my phone - they said they would fix it .
Next morning the phone was not working and I once again walked up to the main lodge in the dark by myself .
Compared to other lodges where I knew who the manager was , and who to talk to , about such things - I did not find it as obvious here .
There were different people at different times .
For myself as a solo traveler - it was too big .

I like having communal meals - and while we did do that on the bush dinner , and my guide was lovely and offered to have dinner with me on other nights - I missed the communal meals that I had at the other lodges .
I never felt alone at the other lodges - but definitely did at Phinda Mountain Lodge .
This is not the lodges fault - but my personal preference and means I would pick something smaller if I was doing this again .
Overall beautiful setting , great game drives , good food , but for me not quite a 5 star experience .
Safari day trips .
Excursion to Phinda known for lions as well as others wild life .
We started our day off at 530 am requiring a bus ride from Zulu to Phinda .
The ranger Mosa dropped us off at the gate where we were picked up by Matt the park tour guide .
Matt explained that the park was just over 70,0 acres and that he wanted to take us to spot where a lionis and her three 16 month cubs .
To our surprise they had traveled towards us on our journey and were on the bank of a small pond playing .
We were able to get so close to them and the pictures turn out great .
We the .
Traveled the park and spotted several other animals throughout the day .
I would recommend the day trip or vacation spot .
Fantastic .
We stayed for 3 nights in June and loved it .
I was with my elders mother , and Presence ( Assistant Manager ? )
went out of her way to move us to a cabin closer to the main lodge so there was less walking .
She was incredibly helpful and warm and suggested the move when she noticed my mother struggling - just wonderful of her .
The cabins are spacious , with plunge pools ( there is also a larger pool ) and generous bathrooms .
Terrific gift shop .
The game drives are great .
We had Nick ( with Menzie ) and he was knowledgable , friendly and a great communicator .
He was always locating us in a spot for great photographs .
The food was very good , with a good range as well .
I had a massage with Tammy and it was fantastic .
This was my second stay - I was here is January with the whole family and loved it so much I came back !
Amazing personalised service .
From the pickup in Durban right through to being returned two days later the personalised service was 1/10 ! .
Great food and lovely people .
and best of all I saw the Big Five animals plus more in just two days .
This companys enviromental policies and support for the neighbouring communities and the absolute best practice for the good of the animals places them right at the top of my list .
Pricey but worth it , if you can afford the best safari experience possible & birding in a great part of S Africa .
Fantastic location and luxury accommodations with fine food at Phinda Man Lodge enhance the incredible safari experience provided for their guests .

We have talked with other experienced S Africa safari travelers from the USA and they were amazed at the close proximity we gained on the Phinda reserve to leopards , lions , cheetahs and the rest of the animal species in this region .

I have photo albums of our trip on Flickr ( as Ken Pulvino ) and Youtube videos ( as GHRancher ) with all the species mentioned viewed from within several feet while they were hunting and/or roaming beside us .
Great , great trip here .
First off the experience start right at the gateway , when they let you in you need to make sure to look at your reservation because inside they have several different lodges .
In my case was the mountains lodge and on my way there I was able to see zebras , monkeys , giraffes , Impalas , wild pigs and so much more !
Keep in mind that this was without the drives and for me that simple experience made my whole trip worth every penny .
Moving to the cottages they are beautiful and very well build , they have a mini pool outside of each cottage with an incredible view of the wilderness .
do not think this twice , book and you will not regret it .
awesome !
awesome !
Once In A Lifetime .
A fantastic 5 day trip to Phinda Mountain Lodge !
The accommodations were perfectly appointed , the food was amazing , and the staff treated us like family .
We had two safaris a day , with our ranger Dylan and tracker Sibu , both professional , experienced and extremely accommodating .
Bongani was the gentleman who took care of us for our stay , and again , gracious and professional .
I can not say enough wonderful things about Phinda !
The location , the sights and the people were fantastic !
If you ever have the opportunity , make Phinda your destination Thanks Phinda , Alana W
Lodge is 5 Stars quality , excellent service !
Simply fantastic from arrival to departure !
From the moment we arrived we were looked after superbly , especially by Bongani our butler .
The service was fantastic and there was a lovely atmosphere around the lodge .
We were a family of five so we had the family cottage , which gave us plenty of space , with two plunge pools !
There is also a main pool .
Lovely rustic rooms with no tv .
Food was delicious , with plenty of choice on the childrens menu .
A nice touch was the laundry , with no charge ! Now onto the main reason for our visit , the game drives !
As we had a family cottage we had our own jeep .
This was great with young children as we could spend as long or as short as we liked at a sighting .
We had a great team of Clive as our ranger and Pat as our tracker .
Wow , what can I say ?
We have been going on safari for 19 years in South Africa , and these guys were the best .
Pats eagle eye was amazing ; and we got to see a chameleon on our night drive .
How he spotted it , I still do not know .
Both were fantastic with our children and made each drive so special for them .
My children have insisted that I mention that they had great fun and were delighted that Pat showed them how to track and Clive involved them in all aspects of the drive .
By far their favourite safari ever !
Each stop for coffee or sundowners was at a totally different type of location .
We all truly enjoyed each drive with them .
Another thing I liked was that they did not just focus on the big five ( which we saw ) , but also lots of birds , and small animals , like scorpions .
On our last night we were so lucky to have dinner in bush under the stars .
It was really magical .
Although Phinda is very expensive , it was really worth it for this special family holiday .
We would all love to come back some day .
Wonderful Experience .
The Mountain Lodge is truly an amazing place .
Different from the Forest Lodge in that it is a bit more family friendly .
Incredible lodgings and staff , and the safari rides were truly remarkable .
Absolutely a first class option !
Amazing experience from beginning to end - the highlight of our holiday .
You are welcomed to Phinda by your team and from then on in it was an amazing experience and the highlight of our holiday .
Nothing was too much trouble and you really felt they wanted you to really experience the best Phinda had to offer .

Amazing service with attentive and friendly staff , lovely rooms with plunge pools and a lodge pool , great food and of course great safari experiences tailored to the animals you most wanted to see .
could not have asked for a better safari experience or end to the holiday .
Stunning views from the lodge and the bedrooms .
They have thought of every detail , with a view from your bath to having a yoga mat in your room .
Great service with first class rooms , decor and food .
Vibe and feeling in the lodge is magical and very welcoming .
The food is out of the world , loved the breakfast selection .
Rangers are knowledgeable and sightings of the big 5 are basically guaranteed .
Good dirt roads and a variety of lodges in the reserve .
Would recommend it to everyone .
Thank you .
Disappointing Visit .
A little background .
This was supposed to be the 3rd and final stop on our 10 day family safari with 3 days at Ngala Safari Lodge , 3 at Kirkmans and 4 at Mountain .
We left after 2 days .
If you see my other reviews , Ngala and Kirkmans were very special made more so by the people working there .
Unfortunately , that is were Mountain really failed .

While management at Ngala , Kirkmans and Forest were every present and truly cared about their guest , the first management we encountered at Mountain , Natalie , appeared to go out of her way to avoid the guests and when presented with issues did not resolve them appropriately .
It is a beautiful lodge and a scenic location but there were many issues .
Too many to list but heres a few that caused us to leave:1 .
The A/C in one of our rooms malfunctioned the first night and soaked our clothes in water while squeaking all night .
No sleep .
It was `` fixed '' the next day only to break again at 9pm .
Maintenance said it was not repairable but would not allow us to change rooms until the next day even though a room was available .
No sleep again .
Our other room has mold covering a good part of the shower .
Not a spot or two of mold , but several large black patches of mold that were clearly visible if anyone bothered to look .
When Natalie was told about this , she said that is the natural color of the stone coming through .
I will attach a pic so you can be the judge but unles they used black grout as well , it is 100 % mold .
My Son was left to wonder around the lodge unattended because no one told us that the activity he as scheduled was postponed to the following day4 .
My Son is a picky eater .
When checking it we requested the same meal for him at lunch and dinner .
Pasta and chicken nuggets .
It never changes .
We confirmed this with 2 different people .
First nights dinner was in the Bush .
When asked about his meal , there was the look of confusion .

There were definitely a few good employees that lived up to the andBeyond standards - Presence the manager that helped us on our final day arrange a move to Forest , Ayanda ( spelling ) our `` Butler '' that was sweet and helpful and Andrew , our Ranger , that moved with us to Forest Lodge .
So after the 2nd night of no sleep and the other issues , my Wife had enough and requested a move to Forest which they graciously accommodated .
Thank you to andBeyond doing this as it really saved the day .
See my review on Forest Lodge .
Very Poor ! !
The lodge itself was very overcrowded , Did not feel like luxury , Which is what you would expect for the rates charged .
Food for Vegans was very very bad .
Tour guides i will give to them are good quality .
But as a whole , would not recommend .
Ranger not up to scratch .
We are frequent guests of And Beyond and we love this company because of its rangers and trackers .
Unfortunately , our ranger this time fell short of expectations in a big way .
Little passion , certainly no knowledge or information given as we drove - most of the time we just drove and didnt stop for trees , grasses , birds , etc , .
Got trees and birds wrong and was corrected by the very experienced tracker , Pat .
He left the dinner table before us as he was tired .

Ric needs to up his game if he is to continue because he is certainly not of the same calibre of the And Beyond rangers and we were so disappointed .

& beyond mountain lodge .
Phinda is Absolutely my favorite game reserve .
Spent one night here recently and had the most amazing sightings in two game drives .
Saw lions , cheetah with two cubs and a leopard with her two cubs .
They were very close sightings and got to feel really close to nature .
The best part of these sightings was that our Ranger Nick and his tracker Menzi , tracked these animals down using their recent tracks .
what an awesome experience .
The accommodation is fantastic , service levels 5 star , friendliness of all staff just great .
Definitely worth paying the premium to get a close encounter with the big 5 .
Leopard population growing very nicely and have spotted leopard here the last 4 times I have been here .
Known for it cheetah population as well .
Would highly recomend staying at any of the lodges at Phinda .
Wonderful time .
A friend and I had the great fortune to have to visit the lodge as part of a photographic scouting trip .
I have had the great pleasure of staying at Forest Lodge and Vuka lodge before .
I have also stayed at Kirkmans Camp and sosusvlei Lodge .
I really enjoy the And Beyond brand and the care the staff give and the attention to detail .
I have not had a bad experience yet .
We had the lodge to ourselves as they were between groups and we had a fantastic time .
We loved every minute and could not have asked for more .
Luxury !
Phase 2 of our SA adventure organised by Savile Rowe Travel Henley .
We landed on the Phinda airstrip , one of just two couples on our small plane from Nelspruit .
We could not believe the quality of the accommodation here .
Blaine was our guide and could not have been more knowledgeable or hospitable .
Arriving from Sabi Sands , crocodile and leopard were among the small number of animals we had still to see .
On the first game drive we saw them both - our only crocodile out of the water on a distant bank and two leopard cubs in a tree right by the landrover waiting for mummy leopard to return with tea .
Amazing .
Three nights here and yet more wonderful wildlife watching , excellent food and maybe the best accommodation we have had anywhere .
Amazing place and friendly staff
Amazing safari experience with a family feel !
My wife and I left yesterday after a four night stay .
The weather was unseasonably cold/windy/rainy and if we knew that beforehand , we might have canceled or delayed our trip .
but .
it was amazing !
The andBeyond team treated us like family from the very beginning .
The food was amazing .
Our ranger , Righardt ( or Ric in an unfairly negative review ) , was awesome and catered to our every request .
We wanted to see lions ?
Done .
We wanted to search for cheetah ?
Done .
He seemed personally invested in making sure that we were happy and it was unlike any experience we had had before .
Outside of Righardt , our trackers Pat and Jomo were great .
The food was ample and delicious .
The staff ( including Tyler our butler Nduduzo ) and went of their way to make sure our fun was not affected by weather .
