Looking forward to our next andBeyond and/or Phinda experience .
Best Game experience ever !
Hubby and I enjoyed a lovely one night stay here .
Staff is so friendly and facilities at the lodge is more than anyone could ask for .
I loved the suite , so spacious with air conditioning for those hot summer afternoons .
We really enjoyed cooling of in the private splash pool with an amazing view of a herd of elephants crossing .
Game drives are out of this world ! !
Our ranger and tracker was super ! ! !
Rickhard and Pat , very knowledgeable and went the extra mile to find the male lion for us .
They have so much respect for nature and it is refreshing to see others who share the same sentiment as we do .
The food was delish and I loved the pineapple sorbet at lunch .
We were treated with a bush dinner on Saturday evening , lovely tables set up in the middle of the bush .
Our ranger always made sure that we are ok with drinks and food and we were able to star gaze on our way back to the lodge .
The turn down service was so lux , a warm bubble bath with lemon verbena bath salts .
Felt like a spa and was just what I needed after the chilly wind on the drive .
I would highly recommend this lodge to nature lovers .
The BEST experince .
Wow .
It ’ s hard to put into words how incredible my experience was at the mountain lodge .
It all started with a smooth arrival being met by Tyler and our butler for the week Dumi .
Both were excited for our arrival and were happy to show us around the lodge and to our rooms .
The lodge is laid out beautifully with a full bar , plenty of comfortable seating , a great dining space and an incredibly helpful staff .
The rooms are extremely spacious , comfortable beds and a great bathroom with tub and high end lotions and soaps , a fully stocked mini bar with fresh limes was available for use as well .
The meal services were incredible and even included several visits from the head chef , she made you feel at home and was happy to personalize anything to your liking .

Dumi was always one step ahead of us and new our habits after the first few hours of being there , always prepared with sparkling water and our favorite wine , she even brought us a bucket of our favorite beer to enjoy at the pool without being asked .
The hospitality alone is enough to give this a 5 star experince but the highlights were absolutely game drives .
Damen our ranger and John the spotter were a brilliant team .

Damen was extremely knowledgeable and was happy to just spew information about everything we saw and could answer any question we asked , he was so friendly , personable , and fun to just spend time with .

John brought years of knowledge of the reserve to the table and was able to navigate us to any animal we wanted to see , his spotting skills are just amazing and he has spent so much time there he can predict the animals next move .
There teamwork was artful .
I have stayed at many high resorts in the past and they all can learn something from the mountain lodge .
Thank you for making our experince so special .
Incredible Experience !
We had an amazing time at the Mountain Lodge for our stay of 3 nights .
I can not say enough good things about how wonderful the service was .
Upon arrival we were greeted by Tyler and our butler for our stay Dumi .
They made us feel right at home as we settled into our accommodations .
The rooms are spacious , private , and offer great amenities like your own private plunge pool , outdoor shower , beautiful views , and fully stocked mini bar ( with fresh limes ! )
The lodge has comfortable open spaces for hanging out by the bar , a beautiful dining room with views of the mountains , and a large pool with lounge chairs and plenty of shade .
We were even joined by some monkies and nyala at the pool .
All of the staff was always incredibly friendly and helpful with anything you needed .
They made a point to remember our names and ask about our personal experience during our stay and were very genuine .
Dumi , our butler , was especially attentive and knew our habits ( and favorite wines ! )
within a few hours of our stay .
She always greeted us with a smile and sparkling water .
She even brought a bucket of our favorite beer and a bottle of champagne to the pool without being asked !
The food was delicious and at every meal there was always a large variety offered for all tastes .
The twice a day game drives were the star of this location .
Our ranger Damen was very attentive , friendly , and knowledgable .
He made a point to ask about what our interests were , what animals we wanted to see , and was very enthusiastic about his job .
Damen was great at educating us about the park and animals , but balanced that well with just letting us observe the animals in silence as well .
He was able to answer any question we had !
John was our tracker and has been at Phinda for 24 years .
He knew the ins and outs of the park so well and was able to spot a leopard over 100 yards away .
He was able to track down any animal we had interest in seeing and had some great stories from his time at Phinda .
His experience was invaluable .
He also makes a great cocoa Amarula !
Damen and John made an excellent team and we thoroughly enjoyed our time with them at every single drive , though we wish it could have been for longer !
We saw all Big 5 , had several sightings of leopard , lion , and rhino , and had an incredible encounter with a curious elephant .
Damen and John have a great respect for these beautiful animals , conservation , and a true passion for what they do .
It was an absolute pleasure being with them ! If I could give Mountain Lodge 10 stars , I absolutely would .
We were truly sad to leave as our time came to an end and I would 100 % recommend staying here .
We had an excellent experience all around and would love to go back again some day !
Thank you so much to everyone who helped make our stay so special and memorable !
Extra thanks to Dumi , Damen , and John !
Fine Champagne on ice !
As a hotelier and tour operator I was determined not to be too critical and to enjoy myself .

Unfortunately others in hospitality and tourism will understand that it is extremely difficult to do so yet I could not fault this property and staff on anything hard as I tried ! The `` bush valet '' service is a nice touch as it immediately forces you to relax and immerse yourself into the adventure .
Michaela and team welcoming guests really adds that family feel which truly endured throughout our stay .
We were mindful not to be late on arrival and miss the welcoming talk but little did we expect Tyler to welcome us like a friend would which instantaniously made us feel at home .
Tylers finely tuned attention to guest relations is highly commendable .
Rooms are gloriously lux and cleaned to perfection !
Having a personal splash pool is very decadent .
The food .
oh the food ! ! !
I gained 4 kgs in 2 days ! !
I got the overall impression that meals were prepared with nutrition in mind .
Healthy and varied .
It was so very hard not to try absolutely everything .
The a la carte hot breakfast is supreme cause let us be honest , buffet breakfasts are so yesteryear with staff looking at you from the other end .
Well done Team Mountain Lodge !
Love your veggie juices at breakfast and I wish I had made a note of all the interesting welcome cocktails after game drives .
The duck was simply splendid .
Chef Jaco and Team really exceeded my expectations ! Our butler , Bongani , was a sweet attentive man with soft spoken profesionality as he makes you feel sincerely cared for .
Game drives were as expected , very personal and top class .
We did not feel crammed into vehicles .
Sbus almost meditative focus with nature was a right treat to watch as you could tell that he absolutely loves his job and strives to get guests what they paid for .
Most impressive was when he cornered a Leopard in a treed enclave , on foot !
Do ask for this amazing man to be your tracker .
Dylans admirable driving skills and wealth of knowledge assured us that we were in safe hands despite getting within 3m of Leopard , Cheetah and a pride of Lion .
This is definately big cat country .
Phinda comes highly recmended as I have never been lucky to see Leopard on hundreds of game drives .
Dylans of-road skills one evening hot on the heels of a Leopard female was an adventure that will make me smile or a long time to come .
Natalie and Michaela are great hosts and I never had a sense of them being distracted by staff or micro-managing the team .
Overall had a feeling of visiting friends who just hapend to live in the heart of africa .
I have entered a return visit on my bucket list !
An absolutely fabulous experience well recommended
Amazing staff and service
A lovely place , but the cold weather did not help
fantastic the staff where friendly and professional .
well done mountain lodge 5 stars
A wonderful place to celebrate , relax and enjoy nature at its best !
My husband and I have visited Mountain Lodge many times on our own and find the hospitality pleasingly consistent .

Our visit of 3 nights in December was made with 12 adult family members of varied ages and who had come from both the northern and southern hemisphere to celebrate a special birthday in an environment that appealed to everyone .
Phinda Mountain Lodge certainly did not disappoint with comfortable accommodation , well stocked fridges and private dip pools which were great for relaxation during the heat of the day .

The staff are all very friendly and professional and our rangers ( Righardt ; Damen and Tayla ) and trackers ( Sifiso and John ) displayed both knowledge ( and great patience with a very diverse and rather excitable group rotating between two vehicles ) .
We were very fortunate with our sightings of all big 5 , but it was good to also see and hear about the smaller , less obvious offerings of the reserve .
Undoubtedly , Damens enthusiastic input helped make our adult childrens first trip to Phinda an experience they would love to repeat .

The food was adequate , but my son , who is a chef , correctly noted that the cost and pleasure of a private game reserve experience such as Phinda could be further fully supported if the food preparation and delivery was of a higher standard .
One of the best Game Lodges in South Africa , has to be on your bucket list of places in South Africa
Excellent !
can not wait to come back .
Excellent service and most engaging crew .
Highly recommended .
Stunning place !
Great lodge and over the top wildlife viewing .
My wife and I spent 4 nights ( 8 game drives ) here in September .
We had a spectacular time !
The food and service were outstanding .
The trip was made incredible by the quality of the wildlife viewing - all of the big five , cheetah , both white and black rhino , feeding cats and more .
We were so close that it was almost scary at times .
We were also able to do a one of a kind night drive using an IR camera .
Highly recommended !
Great place , very excellent service and nice staff , outstanding guide and spotter
This is realy place to spend your holiday
Perfect experience .
Great experience from the initial contact and travel arrangements and the great service during our stay .
All staff are very friendly , the safaris were outstanding , the guides did everything to show the big fives and more , for us with success .
The suite had great view and was a perfect place to retreat between der safaris .
Beautiful place .
Great view and great ice cream too !
You can not go wrong with this place , the view , the food , the culture and the fact that you can watch animals from your patio doors !
Rooms are amazing to say the least .
5 star ice cream .

You have a ranger call you in the morning ( sometimes too early ) to let you know the coast is clear , lions etc are known to roam free and sadly a few people have been caught out , more to their own ignorance as you are told when you arrive you must always have a ranger with you if you wander to and from your lodge or around the grounds .
Excellent lodge and wildlife viewing !
My family and I spent 4 days at Phinda mountain lodge and it was above all expectations .
The staff was so kind , service oriented and genuinely interested in their guests .
The safari experience was out of this world ; we managed to see all the big five just the first 24 hours and our tracker and ranger had such passion for the animals at the reserve .
We got everything we wanted and more at Phinda .
The lodge is highly recommended .
What a live .
Dream come true !
What an amazing experience !
The lodge is stunningly beautiful .
My room was gorgeous and classy with a view to match .
The highlight for me were the game drives with our ranger Liam and our tracker Jomo .
We saw everything - leopard , cheetah , lions , elephants , rhinos and and and ! ! !
Liam has such extensive knowledge and is so passionate about the bush , you can not help but be captivated throughout the drive .
Jomo has the most amazing bush eyes .
I am pretty sure he is part eagle : - ) The game drives were insanely good .
I had to hold back tears of joy on more than one occasion .
Treat yourself , you will love every moment !
Simply brilliant .
We had an amazing time here .
Everything was just great .
The service from our butler Ayanda was truly excellent .
Our game drives with guide Bredon and tracker Bethuel were stunning .
They were hugely knowledgeable , and managed to track everything we asked to see ( including prides of lion , cheetah and even leopard ) .
They were very responsive to our particular interests and really patient at letting us linger .
The lodge itself is lovely and the catering superb .
Speaking to regular visitors , they are obviously always improving rather than resting on their laurels and reputation .
The lodge and central booking office were very responsive , too , arranging an additional room for us when we asked .
This was definitely a 5 star experience .
we will be back !
good and bad- which is not good !
Mold and No responsibility !
I took my family here for a once in a life time vactaion in August 0f 2018. we were given a large family suite .
Unfortunately the bnthatched roofs were musty and smelled so bad we had to sleep wioth the doors open .
the facility bofed us other rooms both on the site and at anearby site , but they were all smaller .
when we requested even a [ partial refund we were told it really wasnt mold .
there was actual black mold in the showers and another couple we traveled with accepted a move to a pair of suites , becuse they had two children who could share one .
we couldnt leave our one child alone .
in fact they manager offered us so many different suites it became an annoying distraction .
If you are on a once in a lifetime trip - which our safari was , then you do not have room for this kind of error and inability to provide customer satisfaction .
thank god we also booked some time at another resort .
I contacted both the regional supervisor and then the director of this business through sevral emails and recieved no courtesy .
I also tried to Hold our travel agen Timbuktu responsible , but they also refused any refund and no one wou ; ld take responsibility .
while we were there the staff was mostly young and inexperienced .
the only good part was that the safari guides were very good .
PS .
I have names , photos , etc to verify any of this information so feel free to request any aditiobnal information .
Nice day , all big 5 .
Loved the food and service and decor .
Bed , linens and bathroom were spot on .
Dinner under the lights , outside was magical and the team worked well to make it feel special .
I ’ d recommend it , but I wouldn ’ t go back .
The reserve has a cool story , but it ’ s smaller than I ’ d like and not as breathtaking as other places we ’ ve traveled , for the price .
It our guide Curtis and sizwe made it fun and interesting and funny .
We learned a lot .
We were Disappointed that my husband and I had to split up , each with one kid .
would have been nice to have cots for the kids in the big room and all be together .
Kids are too small to be far away in another room .
The splash pool offered some fun , but only for two kids , not a family swim , which was disappointing since the large pool was on the guest maps and slated to be completed before we arrived .
On Safari .
Spent an absolutely magical long weekend at the & Beyond Pindha Mountain Lodge .
The place is stunningly beautiful and very luxurious .
Our every need was taken care of from the moment we arrived to the moment we left .
We were also blessed to experience the Big Five up close and personal - memories we will cherish .
Big shout out to Grant ( our Ranger ) and Sifiso ( our Tracker ) who hosted us on 6 game drives .
They both gave us their undivided attention and shared their wealth of knowledge and insight on the reserve .
They also hosted us for wonderful drinks and snacks on each drive .
Would highly , highly recommend to anyone if you want luxury and wildlife in the hands of experts .
The surrounding landscape and vistas are just as wonderful as the animals themselves .
Must end with a mention of Menzi who was our butler ( seriously ! )
throughout our stay and made us feel so welcome and looked after .
We used Sue Garson of Safaris For Africa to book our trip - again , highly recommend her services , you will not be disappointed .
The best yet .
Had everything .
This is now my 5th safari but defo the number one .
Arrival was the most special of all safaris .
4 or 5 people ready to greet us and waving and welcoming us with cold towels and some refreshing drinks .
Walked through the central area and the views were breathtaking .
You could look off miles into the distance clearly see Giraffes walking about and it was just stunning .
Sebastien , one of the managers told us all about the place and out butler took us to our rooms which were a wow factor .
Most comfortable bed and pillows ever , soaking tub on the patio , huge bath tub and both indoor and outdoor showers .
Amazing rooms .
The brand new infinity pool and sun deck area is pretty much the best ive ever seen considering you are out in the middle of the bush .
Its a little piece of heaven .
We were right out onto game drives and not going to go through each of our trips but let me just say Curtis was the BEST ranger ive had to date .
A common theme in all my safaris is just how incredible each of the Rangers have been but Curtis really was a cut above everyone in my opinion .
His knowledge was excellent but he was also not afraid to say `` great question and i will find that out for you '' which game me confidence he wasnt just telling us what we wanted to hear .

We saw 4 of the big 5 ( not leopard ) and we had a very close encounter with Buffalos ( 4 feet from the vehicle ) and pride of 6 lions at the start of a hunt which ended with a kill that unfortunately we missed in the end .
Just seeing some of them watching , stalking and getting ready to take down Wildebeest was superb .
Saw a Cheetah and her 3 very young cubs .
Male lion , baboons , rhinos , giraffes , 2 bull elephants , zebras and all the other usual bush animals were also saw .
Was just amazing .
Food on the whole was excellent , bar service excellent , sun downers ( though it was rain downers ) excellent .
If you are scared of the wild .
stop reading now and just go to the best ever and ask for Curtis before you go .
Anyway .
Mountain lodge has no fence around it .
Its therefore open for animals to roam and we had some warthogs roaming about and the usual monkeys .
Security are always there to walk you to your room so dont worry .
I got an unexpected guest on my day of departure .
You are in the wild so again , you have to understand you are in their territory .
A snake found its way into the toilet .
Fortunately , i heard it and was able to call the troops in to deal with it , but it was a reminder for me to check everything regularly so be careful .
The manager was concerned it had affected my holiday but i reassured them i would be dining out on that story for years .
Its part of the adventure in my opinion .
Be back really really soon .
PS - Ive been to Forest lodge and this was far better in my opinion .
The staff in Mountain were the best i have experienced .
Keep up the excellent work everyone .
Beautiful place .
Phinda is a beautiful resort on a beautiful piece of land .
Definitely the most upscale safari lodge I have visited .
The rooms , pool , seating area , etc was beautiful .
The food here is outstanding .
Its almost comparable to a cruise .
You definitely will get more then enough food to eat and it is all very good .
The game drives are wonderful and my only complaint is that they cut the horns off the rhinoceros to discourage poaching .
Well I understand the reasoning I just did not enjoy seeing them like that .
In all it is a top knoch , family friendly lodge that dosent disappoint
Absolutely stunning getaway .
Our recent weekend at Mountain Lodge was beyond incredible .
As we arrived , we were made to feel welcome with the staff greeting us at the entrance , the accommodation was luxurious & the attention to detail was unbelievable .
Our suite ( # 8 ) was the furthest from the main area , so the most private but wouldn ’ t recommend if you don ’ t like a walk in the midday heat .
Sebastian was our attentive host who ensured we wanted for nothing .
Mensi our butler is a wonderful & friendly man who kept the cocktails & wine flowing .
Housekeeping was brilliant , on our 2nd night we came in from a game drive to candles burning & a bubble bath ready & waiting for us .
The biggest shout outs must go to our amazing ranger Jason & tracker Bongani .
Their knowledge & professionalism were beyond 5 stars .
Every animal we wanted to see they somehow found ; we did see the big 5 by the 3rd game drive & even saw a Cheetah mom with her cubs which was so special .
Jason ’ s enthusiasm is unrivaled , no ask was too big for him & Bongani ’ s knowledge of animals & tracking was so interesting & educational .
They make a wonderful team & the banter between them & the other rangers kept us laughing all the way .
The reserve itself has a special energy , from its community involvement programs to its anti poaching unit–they really are doing some incredible work as a whole .
We are back in the real world today & already dreaming of our next trip .
Well done to & Beyond & their amazing team , this experience will not be easily matched .
Luxury Safari .
Having done a safari before I was interested to see how they compared .
Phinda came out on top .
We were greeted very enthusiastically and were taken to our lovely lodge .
It was one of the furthest from the main building downhill but we managed over the couple of days we were there , although it was very hot when we were staying .
If you have any mobility problems or you are the wrong side of 50 it may be worth asking when you book for a room near the main building .
The lodges are delightful , very spacious with plenty of storage and the bed was very comfortable .
Gorgeous bathroom with a separate bath and shower and self contained toilet .
Nice selection of toiletries and one evening we returned from safari to find the bath filled with bubbles and flower petals .
They did your washing for you which was a very nice touch .
The chef came to talk to us when we arrived as we had specific food requirements which they accommodated us very well .
The first evening we all ate in the restaurant and the second evening they had a barbecue for us all .
There was always a sense of camaraderie and the actual Safaris were excellent .
The ranger and spotter we had were fantastic and we saw it all !
Lions , leopards , cheetahs literally a few metres from our jeep !
Also the giraffes , elephants , zebras , impala , crocodiles and monkeys who were around the camp especially at meal times .
I would definitely recommend Phinda .
Second to none !
I can not say enough about our experience at Phinda Mountain Lodge .
My family of 7 ( my husband and I , our 3 grown boys and my parents ) recently spent 5 nights and days at Phinda and the experience and memories created will last a lifetime .
I have traveled quite a bit and to far away places and I would highly recommend this outfit to anyone .
The staff was delightful .

From Wiliam greeting us upon our first arrival to our Butler , Bongani to our Ranger and Tracker ( Dylan and Sibo - which you can request by name by the way ) we were pampered and treated like kings and queens .
Not only was the safari experience amazing but the special touches , like breakfast in the bush and dinners under the stars , made the trip even that much more special .
You can not go wrong with Phinda and we are already looking to book our next adventure with & beyond !
Perfect safari lodge .
We stayed at Phinda mountain lodge for three nights in October - quite a wonderful experience !
We enjoyed every second of our stay .
The premises , service and staff were excellent , taking care of every need we might have had .
But above anything else , as that is why we went there , was the variety of animals we saw .
The stay included two long safari drives per day , one at dawn , one at dusk .
Quite an exciting experience and we saw all big five plus countless other animals .
